title: MLC 2024 [WATCH]: Kieron Pollard’s wild celebration after dismissing Andre Russell in the LAKR vs MINY game
body:
In a crucial Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 encounter at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Sunday (July 21), MI New York captain Kieron Pollard delivered a match-defining moment by dismissing the formidable Andre Russell during the match against the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR). The wicket came in the final over of LAKR’s innings and ended their challenge at 130 runs, giving Pollard’s team a clear path to chase down the target.

A defining moment for Kieron Pollard

Pollard’s dismissal of Russell was a high-pressure scenario that saw the veteran all-rounder rise to the occasion. With LAKR struggling at 102/9 in the 17th over, Russell’s explosive hitting had propelled their score past the 130 runs mark. Russell was on a roll, having struck two boundaries each too Rashid Khan, Romario Shepherd and Trent Boult. His 35 off 20 deliveries was a significant contribution, but he found himself facing Pollard in the final over.

The final over drama: Battle with Andre Russell

Pollard, known for his match-winning abilities, took charge of the last over with the game hanging in balance. He delivered a length ball, which Russell attempted to pull but could only manage a top edge. Wicket-keeper Nicholas Pooran, alert to the situation, sprinted to his left and made a crucial catch, dismissing Russell and sealing the innings for LAKR. Pollard’s ecstatic celebration, including wild screams and jubilant fist pumps, reflected the importance of the moment and his relief at securing the crucial wicket.

Here’s the video:

Also READ: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Broadcast, live streaming details – When and Where to watch in India, US, UK, Australia & other countries

Pollard’s power play secures MI New York’s playoff spot

New York’s chase was anchored by Dewald Brevis, who provided a solid foundation with a brisk 27. Wicket-keeper Pooran played a vital role in stabilizing the innings, contributing 35 runs off 28 balls. However, his innings came to an end when he was dismissed LBW by Ali Khan.

The game’s decisive moment came when Pollard stepped up to finish the chase in style. Known for his explosive hitting, Pollard delivered a spectacular performance, smashing three consecutive sixes off Spencer Johnson. His unbeaten 33 off just 12 balls not only secured the victory but also highlighted his finishing prowess. Pollard’s powerful strokeplay ensured a smooth completion of the chase and a decisive four wickets win. The win was crucial for MI New York as it guaranteed their advancement to the playoffs. Conversely, LAKR’s elimination was sealed by their net run rate, despite their efforts throughout the tournament.
summary:
**Match Details:**
The match was played between MI New York and Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 21.

**Key Moment:**
MI New York captain Kieron Pollard dismissed Andre Russell in the final over of LAKR's innings, ending their challenge at 130 runs and giving his team a clear path to chase down the target.

**Pollard's Performance:**
Pollard took 1 wicket in the final over, dismissing Russell, and then scored an unbeaten 33 off 12 balls to finish the chase in style, securing a four-wicket win for MI New York.

**Impact:**
The win guaranteed MI New York's advancement to the playoffs, while LAKR's elimination was sealed due to their net run rate.

**Other Performances:**
Dewald Brevis scored 27 to provide a solid foundation for MI New York's chase, while Nicholas Pooran contributed 35 runs off 28 balls before being dismissed LBW by Ali Khan. Andre Russell scored 35 off 20 deliveries for LAKR, but was ultimately dismissed by Pollard.

title: Watch: Kieron Pollard goes berserk with wild celebration after removing Andre Russell in MLC 2024
body:
Mumbai Indians New York skipper Kieron Pollard led from the front in the game against Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. The 19th match of the tournament between the teams took place at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday (22nd July).

Kieron Pollard was at the top of his game with the bat and ball in the game against Los Angeles Knight Riders. In a game where qualification was at stake, the all-rounder came up with a clutch performance and helped his team win the game and enter the playoffs of the second edition of the Major League Cricket.

Kieron Pollard first gave himself the responsibility to bowl the last over of the innings against Andre Russell, who was going great guns. The Mumbai Indians New York skipper, however, made sure he stepped up for his team and removed his Carribean teammate to put his team in a strong position.

On the first ball of the last over, Kieron Pollard banged in a short ball on middle stump. Andre Russell got rushed by it as he tried to pull the ball which hit the splice and went up. Keeper Nicholas Pooran covered a lot of ground to his left and took a good catch.

What caught the attention of many was the celebration of Kieron Pollard after he took the wicket of Andre Russell. The Mumbai Indians New York skipper got pumped up as he got rid of a dangerous batter. He celebrated aggressively and the video of that went viral on the internet.

Here's the video:

After removing Andre Russell with the ball, Kieron Pollard came up with a magical effort with the bat. Mumbai Indians New York needed to chase the target of 131 runs in 18.2 overs and his team was left tottering at 91/5. But it was the skipper who came up with a magical effort and took his team home.

Kieron Pollard scored an unbeaten 33 runs off 12 balls as he did the carnage on the bowlers. The all-rounder batted with a strike rate of 275 and slammed 2 fours and 3 sixes in his innings. His knock ensured that Mumbai Indians New York chased the target in 17 overs and qualified for the playoffs.

It was a plan that worked out in the end - Kieron Pollard on his bowling

Kieron Pollard talked about the win after the game and claimed that he was relieved. He talked about the pride he takes in performing for Mumbai Indians. The all-rounder also opened up about his bowling and stated that his plan worked out. Speaking at the post-match presentation, he explained:

"Very relieved, congrats to the entire team. The way we fought, everyone chipped in usefully. If we look at the history of how we've batted, 130 was a tough ask. But we got another opportunity, and the attitude shown by everyone was fantastic. I've had some experience, Nosthush came to me after one game and said that things would turn out well, my family was always backing me, coming from a young player, it meant a lot. I always pride myself on performing for the franchise and I'm glad it came off today.

"It was a plan that worked out in the end (on bowling the 20th over), I could've gone for 20 and they could have got past 150. I could have gone for the young guy (Rushil Ugarkar), but it was one of the days when we got what we wanted. I heard that one of the supporters in the crowd got hit, I hope she's OK and I hope we can do something for her on our part to make her happy," he concluded.
summary: In the 19th match of MLC 2024, Mumbai Indians New York skipper Kieron Pollard led his team to victory against Los Angeles Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, securing a spot in the playoffs. Pollard starred with both bat and ball, first removing Andre Russell with a clever short ball in the last over of the innings, and then scoring an unbeaten 33 off 12 balls to chase down the target of 131 runs in 17 overs. Pollard's all-round performance helped Mumbai Indians New York recover from 91/5 and win the game. In the post-match presentation, Pollard expressed relief and pride in performing for his franchise, attributing the win to team effort and a well-executed plan.

title: Cricket: How Aussies are faring in Major League Cricket
body:
3 minute read

Australia skipper Pat Cummins has joined the party at Major League Cricket as he features for a San Francisco Unicorns side well stacked with Baggy Greens stars.

Cummins has a number of fellow Aussies taking part in the 20-over competition in the United States, with Washington Freedom currently leading the way inspired by Steven Smith, Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell.

Freedom - 2.40 to secure the MLC title - have won all five of their completed fixtures, with a washout the only thing robbing them of a 100 per cent record, while Cummins features for a Unicorns outfit who lie second in the standings with three wins from five games.

Freedom march on thanks to Aussie batters

In the most recent fixture Washington saw off Texas Super Kings by 42 runs to maintain their unbeaten record, with Smith and Head both making half-centuries at the top of the order.

It's fair to say Head dominated the partnership as he was dismissed for 53, having added 59 for the first wicket with Smith, with Maxwell later smacking three sixes in his 34 and then taking three wickets with his off-spin.

Head (194) and Smith (191) have certainly been enjoying themselves with the bat, as they lie third and fourth respectively; in the runscorers' chart in MLC, with South African Faf du Plessis leading the way with 264 runs for Super Kings.

Du Plessis is one of two century-makers in MLC so far this season, with fellow South African Ryan Rickelton the other player to reach three figures, for Seattle Orcas.

Aussie pair back up Du Plessis

Playing alongside former Proteas skipper Du Plessis at Super Kings are Baggy Greens pair Marcus Stoinis and Aaron Hardie, with the former having made more of an impression with the ball than he has with the bat so far.

In fairness, neither player has excelled to date and both will want to deliver more for their side, with 6.00 Texas currently well-placed to ensure a top-four finish and a place in the play-offs - only two of the six teams miss out on the end-of-season finale.

Tim David has also yet to fire for reigning champions MI New York in his three appearances, while both Alex Carey and Adam Zampa have yet to feature for Los Angeles Knight Riders.

Left-arm quick Spencer Johnson has sparked for the 9.00 Knight Riders, however, taking eight wickets at 19.75 in his five games to date, although that wickets tally is one less than Maxwell has snapped up for Freedom.

Cummins adds to the Aussie mix

That leaves us with Unicorns, who have added Cummins to a roster which already features his fellow Aussies Matt Short, Josh Inglis and Jake Fraser-McGurk and who are 3.75 to be crowned champions.

Short has passed 50 twice in his four knocks so far this season in MLC, but neither Inglis nor Fraser-McGurk have made significant contributions to date, while Cummins has taken just one wicket across his two appearances.

He will want to help San Francisco make certain of a play-off place, with Unicorns having missed out during the inaugural MLC season last year, with New York eventually defeating Orcas by seven wickets in the final.
summary:
**Current Standings:** Washington Freedom is leading the tournament with a 5-0 record, followed by San Francisco Unicorns in second place with a 3-2 record.

**Australian Players:** Several Australian players are participating in the tournament, including Steven Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell for Washington Freedom, and Pat Cummins, Matt Short, Josh Inglis, and Jake Fraser-McGurk for San Francisco Unicorns. Marcus Stoinis and Aaron Hardie are playing for Texas Super Kings.

**Notable Performances:** Steven Smith and Travis Head have been in good form, with both making half-centuries in their recent match. Faf du Plessis is the leading run-scorer with 264 runs, and Ryan Rickelton is the other century-maker in the tournament so far.

**Teams' Chances:** Washington Freedom is favored to win the title at 2.40, while San Francisco Unicorns has a good chance at 3.75. Texas Super Kings is well-placed to make the playoffs at 6.00, and Los Angeles Knight Riders has an outside chance at 9.00.

**Playoffs:** The top four teams will make it to the playoffs, with two teams missing out.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom fall short against San Francisco Unicorns in a rain
body:
Washington Freedom lost to San Francisco Unicorns by six wickets in their rain-shortened final league stage match of the Major League Cricket 2024 season at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

Travis Head and captain Steve Smith jointly top-scored for us as we reached 174/3 in 15.3 overs before rain prematurely ended our batting essay. Smith scored 56 off 31 balls and his knock was laden with four sixes and five fours. Whereas Head hit three sixes and five boundaries for his 36-ball 56, his fourth straight fifty in the competition.

Chasing a revised target of 177 in 14 overs, the San Francisco Unicorns got to the target in just 13.4 overs. Sanjay Krishnamurthi remained unbeaten on 79 off 42 balls for SFU while Josh Inglis hit 45 from 17 balls.

Meanwhile, Andrew Tye finished as the top wicket-taker in the match with figures of 3/41.

Batting first, Head and Smith did what they have done throughout the season, by providing us a rollicking start. Smith took the role of the aggressor smashing three sixes and five fours in the powerplay as we raced to 70/0 after the first six overs, the fourth fifty-plus stand for the Aussies together this season.

Smith powered to a 25-ball fifty in the eighth over and soon the duo got to our first 100-run partnership in the history of MLC before the skipper departed. Head shifted gears to get to his half-century in just 34 balls continuing his purple patch this season.

Rachin Ravindra and Andries Gous kept the scoring rate high with an entertaining partnership of 33 off only 15 balls. Just as we were looking to go past the 200-run mark for the second consecutive game, rain halted proceedings, cutting short our batting essay with 27 balls remaining.

Akeal Hosein gave us a great start after the rain delay, striking with the first ball of the chase to send back Finn Allen. Andrew Tye dismissed the big fish, Jake Fraser-McGurk, leaving both openers back in the hut by the fifth over with the score at 45.

The experienced Tye brought us back into the match with two wickets in an over after Krishnamurthi and Inglis added 77 runs in just 30 balls for the third wicket. In the end, the San Francisco Unicorns chased down the target with two balls to spare.

Hassan Khan contributed a cameo of 32 from 11 balls, while Krishnamurthi remained unbeaten on 79. Apart from Tye, Hosein picked up 1/39 from his three overs.

However, the result had no bearing on the points table of MLC 2024 as we finished on top with 11 points from seven games after all our group engagements.

We will meet the San Francisco Unicorns again in the Qualifier of MLC 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday.

Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns MLC 2024 brief scores: WF 174/3 in 15.3 overs (Steve Smith 56, Travis Head 56, Corey Anderson 2/20) vs SFU 177/4 in 13.4 overs (Sanjay Krishnamurthi 79*, Josh Inglis 45, Andrew Tye 3/41, Akeal Hosein 1/39).

Washington Freedom lost by six wickets by DLS method.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom lost to San Francisco Unicorns by six wickets in a rain-shortened match in the Major League Cricket 2024 season.

**Scorecard:** Washington Freedom scored 174/3 in 15.3 overs, with Steve Smith and Travis Head top-scoring with 56 each. San Francisco Unicorns chased down the target of 177 in 14 overs, with Sanjay Krishnamurthi remaining unbeaten on 79 and Josh Inglis scoring 45.

**Notable Performances:** Andrew Tye was the top wicket-taker in the match with figures of 3/41, while Akeal Hosein picked up 1/39. Travis Head scored his fourth straight fifty in the competition.

**Tournament Standings:** Despite the loss, Washington Freedom finished on top of the points table with 11 points from seven games. They will face San Francisco Unicorns again in the Qualifier of MLC 2024 on Thursday.

title: Major League Cricket is on the rise in the US
body:
After the ICC Mens T20 World Cup thrilled American sports fans with top-tier cricket matches at venues in Florida, New York and Texas, Major League Cricket is gearing up for an exciting second season of progress.

Major League Cricket will conclude its 21-match season this week, culminating in a thrilling four-team play-off to crown a new champion. Despite having six teams spread across the country, all competitions are being held on dedicated cricket grounds in Texas and North Carolina. Remarkably, attendances are on track to surpass the impressive 70,000 fans who turned out for the inaugural season in 2023.

A key strategy Major League Cricket has employed to attract a broader audience is its media rights arrangement with Cricbuzz’s Willow, a specialist cricket channel. Willow has established partnerships with regional sports networks in each team’s local market, including Bally Sports SoCal for Los Angeles, Monumental Sports Network for Washington, DC, and NBC Sports Bay Area for San Francisco, among many others. This tactic mirrors Willow’s successful approach during the T20 World Cup, where it focused on increasing visibility.

In terms of finances, Major League Cricket operates within a salary cap of $1.15 million per team. While this figure is below the generous budgets seen in global leagues such as the Indian Premier League, which allows franchises to spend around $12 million annually, it remains competitive with leagues such as Cricket Australia ($2 million) and The Hundred ($1.3 million) in the UK.

Liam Plunkett, a bowler for the San Francisco Unicorns and member of the England team that won the 2019 Cricket World Cup, praises the quality and competitiveness of the competition. “The money is good. But the product is good too,” Plunkett notes, highlighting the high standard of play that attracts fans and players alike.

San Francisco’s signing of Australian national team captain Pat Cummins on a four-year contract ahead of the season was a major move that reflects the league’s ambition. Unicorns co-owner Anand Rajaraman reveals that such contracts have proven surprisingly feasible given the excitement surrounding the emerging US cricket market.

Looking ahead, the league has ambitious plans for expansion, aiming to establish stadiums in each team’s market and expand the schedule to 34 games by 2025. With the intention of increasing the number of franchises to 10, Major League Cricket is poised for continued growth and success in the American sports landscape.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 - Match 18, SFU vs SO - Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 20th
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 18- San Francisco Unicorns vs Settle Orcas, which will be played on the 20th of July at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

Points Table

Match 18- San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas (Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas)

Current Form San Francisco Unicorns:

San Francisco Unicorns are currently placed at the 2nd position on points table with 3 wins and 1 loss to their credit.

The top run scorer for San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket is Matthew Short with 151 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket is Liam Plunkett with 5 scalps under his belt.

San Francisco Unicorns have won their previous match against MI New York by 3 runs.

San Francisco Unicorns batted first and they posted a total of 148 for 7 in 20 overs. The top order struggled a lot. Their prime form batters including Matthew Short and Josh Inglis got out cheaply. They were under a lot of pressure from that moment on. The middle order of San Francisco Unicorns came good as Corey Anderson and Hassan Khan smashed 59 and 44 runs respectively to help San Francisco Unicorns get to a strong total of 148 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Seattle Orcas lost Ruben Clinton quite early into the innings. Dewald Brevis played like a champion and he smashed 56 runs off 36 balls. He instilled the hope for a successful chase. Nicholas Pooran also supported him well, he scored 26 runs but consumed too many balls to get going. It cost the team dearly. The rest of the middle order batters including Romario Shepherd and Monank Patel failed terribly and despite the efforts of Heath Richards, who smashed 24 off 13 balls, Seattle Orcas failed to achieve the target and fell short by 3 runs in the end.

Current Form Seattle Orcas:

Seattle Orcas are currently placed at the bottom most position on points table with 1 win and 4 losses to their credit.

The top run scorer for Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket is Ryan Rickelton with 225 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket is Cameron Gannon with 9 scalps under his belt.

Seattle Orcas have lost their previous match against LA Knight Riders by 4 wickets.

Seattle Orcas batted first and they posted a total of 142 for 6 in 20 overs. Except for Ryan Rickelton, no other batter showed any promise whatsoever. The big names like Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen and Aaron Jones, all failed to get going. Rickelton smashed 89 off 52 balls but he barely got any support at the other end. Once he got out in the 19th over, it was all clear that Orcas will not reach a decent total. They were littled and only scored 142 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Sunil Narine as usual got out cheaply. Jason Roy tried his best to take control but he consumed too many balls for his knock of 27 runs. A real game changing innings was played by Unmukt Chand, who smashed 62 runs off 47 balls. He was aided by the lower order batters who contributed healthily and helped LA Knight Riders get over the line in the 20th over with 4 wickets in hand.

title: San Francisco Unicorns secure top-two spot with dominant six-wicket win, oust Seattle Orcas
body:
Hassan Khan delivered an outstanding bowling performance, while Finn Allen contributed a rapid half-century to lead the San Francisco Unicorns to a six-wicket victory over the Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Saturday.

Match Summary

San Francisco Unicorns 156/4 (14.2 ov)

Seattle Orcas 152/7 (20 ov)

San Francisco Unicorns won by 6 wickets

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

After losing their openers in the first over, Quinton de Kock anchored the innings with 62 off 33 balls, helping the Seattle Orcas post a total of 152/7. However, Finn Allen's explosive 77 off 30 balls took the San Francisco Unicorns to a comfortable six-wicket win.

With this victory, the San Francisco Unicorns remain in second place on the points table with nine points from six matches, while the Seattle Orcas have been officially eliminated from the second season of Major League Cricket.

Already qualified for the playoffs, the San Francisco Unicorns began their run chase of 153 runs at a blistering pace. They smashed 79 runs in the Powerplay, thanks to Finn Allen's 21-ball fifty. He struck 26 runs in the fifth over, bowled by Lungi Ngidi, which featured two sixes and three fours.

Matthew Short, on the other hand, was dismissed by Imad Wasim in the seventh over after scoring 19 off 14 balls. Allen continued in the same vein, hitting two sixes off Harmeet Singh before being caught by Ryan Rickelton on the fifth ball of the eighth over. He scored 77 off 30 balls, leaving San Francisco at 98/2 after eight overs.

The Unicorns then lost two more wickets in consecutive overs. Sanjay Krishnamurthi was dismissed for 10 off 16 balls in the 13th over, followed by Sherfane Rutherford in the 14th, who scored 17 off 8 balls. However, Josh Inglis and Corey Anderson guided San Francisco to a comfortable six-wicket win with 34 balls to spare.

In a must-win game, the Seattle Orcas faced a disastrous start after being invited to bat first. They lost both openers in the very first over: Ryan Rickelton was caught by Finn Allen on the first ball, and Aaron Jones was trapped LBW by Carmi le Roux.

Despite an early setback, Seattle managed to score 48 runs in the Powerplay, thanks to an aggressive counter-attack by Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya. They added 34 runs in the last two overs of the Powerplay, bringing the score to 48/2.

De Kock reached his half-century off 28 balls by the 10th over. Alongside Jayasuriya, he added 31 runs off Pat Cummins' first two overs, pushing Seattle to 98/2 after 11 overs. However, the momentum shifted dramatically in the 12th over as both de Kock (62 off 33) and Jayasuriya (31 off 33) were dismissed in quick succession by Brody Couch.

Hassan Khan then delivered a decisive blow to Seattle Orcas, as he struck thrice in his two consecutive overs. He dismissed Heinrich Klaasen (8 off 8) in the 14th over, and Harmeet Singh (3 off 7) and Keemo Paul (0 off 1) in the 16th over, reducing Seattle to 116/7.

It was Shubham Ranjane, who came to the rescue as he played a crucial unbeaten knock of 26 runs off 25 balls, helping Seattle post a total of 152/7 in their 20 overs.

Match Stats

Seattle Orcas Fall of wickets: 1-0 (Ryan Rickelton - 0.1 ov), 2-1 (Aaron Jones - 0.3 ov), 3-98 (Quinton de Kock - 11.1 ov), 4-99 (Shehan Jayasuriya - 11.4 ov), 5-108 (Heinrich Klaasen - 13.1 ov), 6-116 (Harmeet Singh - 15.5 ov), 7-116 (Keemo Paul - 15.6 ov)

San Francisco Unicorns Fall of wickets: 1-84 (Matthew Short - 6.4 ov), 2-98 (Finn Allen - 7.5 ov), 3-124 (Sanjay Krishnamurthi - 12.1 ov), 4-144 (Sherfane Rutherford - 13.5 ov)

Wagon Wheel

Matthew Short

Sanjay Krishnamurthi

Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas

Toss: San Francisco Unicorns elected to bowl
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Scorecard:** San Francisco Unicorns scored 156/4 in 14.2 overs, while Seattle Orcas scored 152/7 in 20 overs.

**Key Performances:** Finn Allen scored a rapid 77 off 30 balls, and Hassan Khan delivered an outstanding bowling performance to lead the San Francisco Unicorns to victory.

**Tournament Standings:** The San Francisco Unicorns remain in second place on the points table with nine points from six matches, while the Seattle Orcas have been officially eliminated from the tournament.

**Playoff Implications:** The San Francisco Unicorns have already qualified for the playoffs.

title: MLC 2024 Match 18, SF vs SEA | Playing 11 Prediction, Cricket Tips, Preview & Live Streaming
body:
Seattle Orcas will face San Francisco Unicorns (X.com)

In the 18th fixture of the Major League Cricket 2024 season, San Francisco Unicorns will face Seattle Orcas at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 21 at 6.00 AM IST.

SF vs SEA: Team Previews

San Francisco Unicorns

San Francisco Unicorns confirmed a berth in the playoffs of the MLC 2024 after they sealed a three-run thrilling victory over MI New York.

After a top-order collapse, Corey Anderson and Hassan Khan’s 90-run partnership helped the Unicorns post a respectable 148-run total on the board.

Meanwhile, MI New York had a blazing start, courtesy of Dewald Brevis’ half-century, before witnessing a middle-order collapse.

With 20 needed off the final over, Haris Rauf survived the scare with a last-ball wicket as New York fell short by four runs.

The Unicorns climbed to second spot on the points table with 7 points in 5 games. Still, SFU will try to finish in top two to earn that extra chance of redemption.

Seattle Orcas

Meanwhile, the tournament is fairly over for the Seattle Orcas, as they are seated at the bottom of the table with only 2 points in five games.

The Orcas have failed to click this year, and their shortcomings were exposed in the previous four-wicket loss against Los Angeles Knight Riders.

Seattle Orcas, despite a blazing 89 (52) knock from Ryan Rickleton, succumbed to a 142-run total in the first innings.

Harmeet Singh and Keemo Paul tried their best to put a stoppage on the flow of runs in the chase.

But Unmukt Chand’s 62-run knock set the stage right for LAKR. They finished the chase with five balls to spare, leaving the Orcas in tatters.

With just two games left on the league schedule, the playoff dream is more or less lost for the Orcas.

Grand Prairie Stadium features a hybrid pitch that provides a balanced playing field, catering to both batters and bowlers.

The pitch generally offers an even bounce. However, the degree of bounce can vary depending on weather conditions and the level of maintenance. 145-150 is the average first-innings score on this surface.

title: Fast bowler critical after batsman hits ball straight on his head, watch shocking video
body:
Fast bowler Carmi le Roux was rendered critical after he was hit on the head by a hard shoot by batsman Ryan Rickleton. The ball hit straight on his head, leaving him critically injured. Roux fell directly on the ground with the whole pitch turning into a pool of blood. The scary moment unfolded during the Major League Cricket (MLC).

San Francisco Unicorns bowler le Roux was bowling his second over to Seattle Orcas batsman Ryan Rickleton. He delivered a speed bowl to which Ryan hit and the ball returned back and hit on his head.

The incident left Roux critically injured with blood oozing out of his head. His face was completely covered with blood. Thankfully, the ball did not hit his eyes and Roux managed to save himself. With severe injuries and blood flowing, Roux had to leave the game and was taken into the dressing room.

Medical team rushed to his aid soon, but to everyone’s relief, Roux was able to walk on his own.

Talking about MLC, Seattle Orcas are currently on just one victory in five games. The tournament started on July 5 and the final is set to be played on July 28.

title: tuning his game ahead of Windies challenge
body:
While seven other squad members are in the US competing in the Major League Cricket tournament, Temba Bavuma and Co will be getting together for the first time since the New Year’s Test at Newlands.

TEST captain Temba Bavuma will be alongside Wiaan Mulder, Matthew Breetzke, Tony de Zorzi, Lungi Ngidi, Kyle Verreynne, Dane Paterson and Tristan Stubbs at Kingsmead Stadium in Durban this week as the first day of the pre-Caribbean tour camp gets under way.

While seven other squad members are in the US competing in the Major League Cricket tournament, Bavuma and Co will be getting together for the first time since the New Year’s Test at Newlands.

Coming on the back of a lot of white-ball cricket recently, the objectives of the camp will be for the players to polish their red-ball skills, and remind themselves of the team’s philosophy.

Despite the Proteas’ 2-0 Test series victory during their last visit to the Caribbean three years ago and the West Indies’ innings defeat to England in the first Test at Lord’s earlier this week, they are a formidable unit in their backyard.

“We’re looking forward to a competitive West Indies team,” Bavuma said.

“About three years ago, their bowling attack put us under pressure. I think the Duke ball in those conditions does talk a bit, it does move around and they have the resources to do that. As inexperienced as some of their players will be, we’ll still need to be on our A-game in all disciplines.

“It will also be a good challenge where we also have newer faces, some inexperience within our team, to see how those guys go about their international careers within the red-ball space. That’s something that we’re looking forward to.

“Every series is an important one. We don’t have the privilege of looking too far ahead with us being placed at No.7 (in the World Test Championship). It’s for us to look to play our best cricket in those conditions and take the confidence from that.

“We know that winning breeds confidence and it can become a habit as well.

“If we can start doing that in the West Indies, that would be good for us. But again, we’re not looking too far ahead. We want to get there, understanding that we haven’t played Test cricket for a while.

“It’s about us reminding ourselves of our philosophy as a team, building that winning culture again and carrying that throughout the season.”

With Dean Elgar having called time on his career during the drawn series against India earlier this year, this means Bavuma is now the senior batter within the team with 97 innings under the belt.

Bavuma feels no added pressure.

“It’s just an awareness in terms of knowing that you’re the senior statesman within the team and not an added pressure or anything like that,” he said.

“I will still try to fulfil my role as a batter and put the team in winning positions. Nothing is going to change from that.”

With the likes of Aiden Markram and some of the Proteas T20 World Cup finalists set to join the Test side before the start of the Windies series, there will be some confidence that they will bring into the Test space.

“There’s a lot of confidence that will emanate within the group seeing the success of the boys in the T20 side,” he said.

“We’ll take the confidence that will come with the guys who were at the World Cup and have them lead things from that perspective.

“But I think within the Test space we’re not as far ahead as the T20 players are and even the 50-over space. There are a couple of hurdles that we need to get through as a Test team.

“We’re still finding ourselves, if we’re being honest. That’s really where our focus is within the Test team.”

The camp will run until Friday. The first Test is scheduled to start on August 7 in Port of Spain. It will be preceded by a warm-up match, starting on July 31.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Sponsors Watch
body:
As the second season of the Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) approaches its conclusion, the competition has become increasingly competitive and heated.

Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns have won five and three games, respectively, and have already qualified for the playoffs. Texas Super Kings are third with six points and will look to finish in the top two, while Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR), with five points, will aim to just win their last game and qualify.

The MLC’s second season has been a big success, both on and off the pitch. The promoters’ decision to broadcast the league in India simultaneously on Sony Sports Network and JioCinema proved to be a major hit. The fact that Indian Premier League (IPL) franchisee-owned teams are being televised on the former IPL broadcasting network is a call for nostalgia, which was a big smash.

MLC is rapidly becoming one of the world’s best T20 competitions, and it will undoubtedly develop more in the future. Additionally, players like Marcus Stoinis, Kieron Pollard, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Quinton de Kock, Faf du Plessis, Pat Cummins, Shakib Al Hasan and others are delivering their best in the competition and rightfully receiving deserving appreciation. Interestingly, the league had offered 500 more tickets for the final match owing to high demand.

With teams competing for the renowned trophy and cricket gaining popularity in the US following the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024, organisers also had an easy time attracting sponsors for the T20 competition staged in the US.

Title Partner:

Cognizant: Cognizant is a multinational American information technology services and consulting company. Its headquarters are located in Teaneck, New Jersey, United States. Cognizant is a NASDAQ-100 corporation that trades under the ticker name CTSH. It was established in 1994 as Dun & Bradstreet’s in-house technology arm, and it began serving external clients in 1996.

Official Partners:

Stake: Stake is a top sportsbook and cryptocurrency platform known for its creative approach to online betting and devotion to customer satisfaction. With an emphasis on offering a simple and safe betting experience, Stake continues to transform the world of online gaming. As part of the agreement, Stake supports contests all season long, concluding in its sponsorship of the MVP award.

Willow by Cricbuzz:

Lexus: Lexus, the premium car business of Toyota Motor Corporation, is based in Japan and is one of the most popular premium automobile brands across the globe. Lexus is sold in over 90 countries and territories globally and in terms of market value, it is one of the top ten Japanese worldwide brands.

Signature Partners:

Royal: Royal Brand, an Indian food company located in the United States, is well-known in America for its Sona Masoori and Basmati rice.

Remitly: Remitly is a Seattle-based internet remittance company that provides international money transfers to more than 150 countries. Throughout the season, Remitly will run unique promotions, which include exclusive deals at certain games and savings on international money transfers.

NTT Data: NTT DATA, a subsidiary of NTT Group, is a trusted global pioneer of IT and business services based in Tokyo. The firm assists customers in transforming their businesses through advisory services, industry solutions, business process services, IT advancement, and managed services.

Official Umpire Apparel Supplier:
summary:
**Current Standings and Playoff Picture**: Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns have qualified for the playoffs with 5 and 3 wins, respectively. Texas Super Kings are third with 6 points, and Los Angeles Knight Riders need to win their last game to qualify.

**Tournament Success**: The second season of MLC has been a huge success, with the decision to broadcast the league in India on Sony Sports Network and JioCinema proving to be a major hit.

**Player Performances**: Top players like Marcus Stoinis, Kieron Pollard, and Andre Russell are performing well in the competition and receiving deserving appreciation.

**Final Match Tickets and Popularity**: Due to high demand, 500 more tickets have been made available for the final match. The tournament has also led to an increase in cricket popularity in the US following the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.

**Sponsors and Partners**: The tournament has attracted various sponsors and partners, including Cognizant (Title Partner), Stake, Willow by Cricbuzz, Lexus, Royal, Remitly, NTT Data, and an Official Umpire Apparel Supplier.

title: Watch: Shehan Jayasuriya takes the catch of MLC 2024 to dismiss Sanjay Krishnamurthi in SOR vs SFU clash
body:
Seattle Orcas (SOR) cricketer Shehan Jayasuriya took a spectacular one-handed catch during the match against the San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. Shehan Jayasuriya's excellent catch sent San Francisco Unicorns batter Sanjay Krishnamurthi to the pavilion in the recent game.

The San Francisco Unicorns opted to bowl first at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Sunday, July 21 (India time). The Seattle Orcas scored 152 runs for the loss of seven wickets in 20 overs. Shehan Jayasuriya struggled to score runs as he was dismissed after scoring 31 runs off 33 deliveries with four boundaries.

The San Francisco Unicorns chased down the target with six wickets and more than five overs to spare. Opener Finn Allen scored 77 runs off 30 deliveries, including eight boundaries and six maximums. The Orcas recorded their fifth loss out of six matches in the tournament and are at the bottom of the six-team table.

Watch: Shehan Jayasuriya Takes Catch of MLC 2024

During the first ball of the 13th over of the San Francisco Unicorns' innings, Sanjay Krishnamurthi attempted a drive against a slower, wider delivery from left-arm spinner Harmeet Singh. Sanjay Krishnamurthi connected the ball but didn't get the desired elevation to go over the fielder inside the circle.

Shehan Jayasuriya was positioned at short cover on the field. The Sri Lankan international made a perfectly timed full-length jump to catch the ball with his outstretched right hand. Sanjay Krishnamurthi was dismissed after scoring 10 runs off 16 balls with one boundary.

We Have Been Poor In This Season - Heinrich Klaasen

The Seattle Orcas were eliminated from the MLC 2024 after their heavy defeat to the San Francisco Unicorns. The runner-ups from the inaugural season have won only one of their first six matches. They will face the Texas Super Kings (TSK) in their final match at the Grand Prairie Stadium on Wednesday, July 24.

Orcas skipper Heinrich Klaasen expressed his disappointment, noting their poor batting and lack of firepower. Klaasen acknowledged that their total was 15-20 runs short, which ultimately cost them the match.

"Disappointing, we were in the final last year, this year we didn't bat well, not a lot of firepower. The bowlers were good and did what best they could do. A bit under par, maybe 15-20 runs short and that cost us in the end. We've been poor in this season, disappointing for the franchise and the owners," Klaasen said.

Heinrich Klaasen's team has struggled with form and finding the right combination this season. Shehan Jayasuriya has performed decently in the middle order, with his standout moment being a remarkable ramp shot against Haris Rauf in an earlier match against the San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC 2024.
summary:
* The Seattle Orcas (SOR) lost to the San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) in a recent match, with SFU chasing down the target of 152 runs with six wickets and over five overs to spare.
* The match was played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 21, and SFU opener Finn Allen scored 77 runs off 30 deliveries to lead his team to victory.
* SOR's Shehan Jayasuriya took a spectacular one-handed catch to dismiss SFU's Sanjay Krishnamurthi, but struggled to score runs himself, getting dismissed for 31 off 33 balls.
* The loss marked SOR's fifth defeat in six matches, leaving them at the bottom of the six-team table and eliminating them from the tournament.
* SOR captain Heinrich Klaasen expressed disappointment with his team's performance, citing poor batting and a lack of firepower as the reasons for their struggles.
* SOR will play their final match of the tournament against the Texas Super Kings (TSK) on July 24.

title: 5 Highest wicket-takers in MLC 2024
body:

Talking about the most wickets, some bowlers who are far ahead from the other bowlers to take most wickets in the ongoing season. Here is the list top five highest wicket-takers in MLC 2024.

Most wickets in MLC 2024

USA cricketer, Harmeet Singh is the fifth highest wicket-taker in MLC 2024. Playing for Seattle Orcas, Harmeet has taken eight wickets from six matches in the season so far with an economy rate of 7.70.

4. Lockie Ferguson - 9 wickets

Washington Freedom pacer, Lockie Ferguson has been impressive with his bowling in MLC 2024. The Kiwi pacer has taken nine wickets from six matches at an economy rate of 7.27.

Another bowler from Washington Freedom is in the list of highest wicket-takers in MLC 2024. The right-arm spin bowler, Glenn Maxwell has been effective in reducing the run rate and taking wickets in middle overs. Maxwell has taken nine wickets from six matches in MLC 2024 at an economy rate of 6.66.

Seattle Orcas fast bowler, Cameron Gannon is the second-highest wicket-taker in the 2024 Major League Cricket. The right-arm bowler has taken 10 wickets from six matches at an economy rate of 9.15.

USA’s hero in the 2024 T20 World Cup, Saurabh Netravalkar is currently the highest wicket-taker in the 2024 Major League Cricket. The left-arm pacer has taken 12 wickets from just four matches at an economy rate of 7.17.

title: MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns Prediction
body:
MI New York will take on the San Francisco Unicorns in the 16th match of Major League Cricket 2024.

MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns Match 1 Preview

This match will be a battle between two teams looking to secure a place in the playoffs.

The MI New York is the team in the worst form in the tournament. After winning the opening game of the season against the Seattle Orcas, they have lost three matches and one was washed out. This has put them fifth on the table with three points in five matches. Having not found a win in four games, MI needs to win this one to stay in contention for a top-four finish.

On the other hand, the San Francisco Unicorns are currently in the top four, in third place to be precise despite having five points in four matches. A win here would confirm a top-four finish for them, making it a crucial game for the Unicorns

MINY Vs SFU Match 1 MLC 2024: Match Details

Match: MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns, Major League Cricket Match 16

Venue: Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium, Dallas, Texas

Date & Time: Friday, July 19, 6:30 AM (IST)/ July 18, 7:30 PM (local time)

Live Broadcast and Streaming: Sony Sports Network, JioCinema App & Website

MINY Vs SFU Announced Squads

MI New York Announced Squad

Kieron Pollard (C), Dewald Brevis, Steven Taylor, Monank Patel (wk), Nicholas Pooran (wk), Heath Richards, Ruben Clinton, Sheyan Jahangir (wk), Tim David, Rashid Khan, Romario Shephard, Kagiso Rabada, Trent Boult, Anrich Nortje, Nosthush Kenjige, Ehsan Adil, Rushil Ugarkar

San Francisco Unicorns Announced Squad

Corey Anderson (C), Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGrk, Matthew Short, Sherfane Rutherford, Josh Inglis (wk), Jahmar Hamilton (wk), Tajinder Dhillon, Pat Cummins, Wiaan Mulder, Hassan Khan, Haris Rauf, Liam Plunkett, Matt Henry, Karima Gore, Carmi le Roux, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Brody Couch, Abrar Ahmed

MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns Pitch Report

It is a solid batting pitch that can generate 200+ scores on any day, although targets of 180 are much more realistic. Fast bowlers will find some movement, especially early in the inning.

The ball starts sticking to the pitch as the match proceeds, which might help medium pacers with a lot of variations. Quality spinners too can muddle the middle overs.

MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns Weather Report

The skies will be cloudy with some chance of rain, but not too much, the winds will also hardly pick up.

It will be a warm and pleasant evening, with temperatures in the mid 20s. The humidity will also be very high.

MINY Vs SFU Predicted Playing XI

MI New York Predicted Playing XI

Steven Taylor, Shayan Jahangir, Monank Patel (wk), Dewald Brevis, Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard (C), Rashid Khan, Romario Shephard, Trent Bould, Nosthush Kenjige, Ehsan Adl

San Francisco Unicorns Predicted Playing XI

Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Josh Inglis, Corey Anderson (C), Hassan Ali, Pat Cummins, Liam Plunkett, Haris Rauf, Carmi de Roux

MINY Vs SFU Head To Head Record

Matches Played: 01

MI New York Won: 00

San Francisco Unicorns Won: 01

No Result: 00

First Played: July 14, 2023

Last Played: July 14, 2023

MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns Prediction

While this match will be highly affected by the toss, we can not keep that in mind while making a prediction. So instead, we will look back at the recent record of these two teams, which has been fairly similar in this tournament. It is clear that both these sides do not compete with the better team this season, seeing how they have lost most of their matches by a big margin.

In their game earlier this season, the MI New York won their one and only match, this team also seems to have a better bowling attack as a whole. But, the Knight Riders have a better spin attack, giving them a distinct advantage on this dry track.

The San Francisco Unicorns also seem to have a better batting order, making them the favorites to win this one.

MI New York Vs San Francisco Unicorns Prediction: San Francisco Unicorns will defeat MI New York in the 1st Match of Major League Cricket 2024

title: WATCH: Scary scenes witnessed in Major League Cricket 2024 after bowler is left bloodied due to injury
body:
Major League Cricket 2024 is heading to its finale as the group phase matches are getting to its end. There was a massive injury scare that happened during the San Francisco Unicorns versus Seattle Orcas match.

The incident occurred when Carmi Le Roux, who was bowling to Ryan Rickelton, was hit on his head. The ball came towards the bowler at high speed and he couldn’t put up his hands on time and was hit on his head.

The rest of the players, including Ryan Rickelton, ran up to the bowler to check on his well-being. The bowler was badly injured as there was a lot of blood on his face. It was a gory sight to watch but the one positive that came out of it was that Carmi Le Roux was able to walk off the field on his own accord.

MI New York on the verge of elimination

Meanwhile, defending champions MI New York took on San Francisco Unicorn in a massive game on Thursday night. At the end of the game, the Unicorns managed to hold onto a three run win over the MI side.

Batting first, the Unicorns scored 148/7 with skipper Corey Anderson top scoring with 59 not out. The knock came off 44 balls with four boundaries and two sixes as he added a crucial 87 runs for the 6th wicket with Hassan Khan who scored 44.

Chasing 149 to win, MI lost Ruben Clinton early for a duck. Dewald Brevis and Nicholas Pooran then added 57 runs for the 2nd wicket. Dewald Brevis scored 56 runs from 36 balls before he was out to Brody Couch.

Matthew Short was the best bowler with 3/27 from his 4 overs as he combined well with Hassan Khan and Brody Couch to help the Unicorns win by 3 runs. The result will have a massive bearing on the MI side who are struggling at the bottom half of the table and could miss out on the playoffs.

Speaking at the end of the game, Kieron Pollard the MI skipper said “I believe it was the middle period of 15 balls, we didn't get any boundaries and let them get back. But I think we still had a chance and didn't take it. I thought we bowled well to have them at 33 for 5, Boult bowled well, but they had a good partnership to get around 148. I think we should have restricted them to 120, I don't want to blame anyone, luck wasn't on our side at various stages of the tournament”
summary:
**Injury Scare**: A serious injury occurred during the San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas match when bowler Carmi Le Roux was hit on the head by a ball while bowling to Ryan Rickelton. Although badly injured, Le Roux was able to walk off the field on his own accord.

**MI New York on the Verge of Elimination**: Defending champions MI New York are struggling at the bottom of the table after a 3-run loss to San Francisco Unicorns. The Unicorns scored 148/7, with Corey Anderson top-scoring with 59 not out, while MI New York's chase was hindered by the loss of Ruben Clinton early on and ultimately fell short of the target. The result puts MI New York's playoff hopes in jeopardy.

**Key Performances**: Corey Anderson (59 not out) and Hassan Khan (44) had a crucial 87-run partnership for the Unicorns, while Matthew Short (3/27) was the best bowler for the Unicorns. Dewald Brevis scored 56 runs for MI New York.

**Post-Match Reaction**: MI New York skipper Kieron Pollard attributed the loss to a 15-ball middle period where they failed to score boundaries, and also cited luck not being on their side throughout the tournament.

title: San Francisco Unicorns’ bowler suffers brutal injury in Major League Cricket match
body:
During a Major League Cricket match, fast-bowler Carmi le Roux suffered a frightening incident when he was struck in the head by a powerful shot from batter Ryan Rickelton. As le Roux was bowling his second over for the San Francisco Unicorns, a powerful shot from Seattle Orcas batter Rickelton caught the bowler by surprise and slammed directly into his head.

The vicious impact left le Roux’s face covered in blood, but remarkably the bowler remained conscious and walked off the field unassisted.

In the third over, South African bowler Le Roux was struck in the head by a powerful shot from his compatriot Rickelton. The southpaw, had intended to play the ball straight, but the shot ended up going directly towards the bowler.

Fortunately, le Roux was able to walk off the field under his own power, much to the relief of the medical staff and spectators.

With le Roux unavailable, former New Zealand and current USA all-rounder Corey Anderson stepped in to complete the over as the San Francisco Unicorns defended their total of 165 against the Seattle Orcas. Despite le Roux’s absence, the Unicorns were able to restrict the Orcas to just 142 runs.

Veteran England pacer Liam Plunkett delivered an impressive performance, claiming 3/26 in his 4-over spell to emerge as the standout bowler.

The Seattle Orcas’ misfortunes continued as they suffered another defeat, this time to the Los Angeles Knight Riders, just two days after their previous loss. The back-to-back defeats have left the Orcas languishing at the bottom of the Major League Cricket (MLC) season two table – a stark contrast to their table-topping performance in the previous season.

The Orcas have only managed one win in their last five matches, putting them in a precarious position. Defending champions MI New York are also struggling, sitting fifth in the standings and outside of the playoff positions.
summary:
* In a match between San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas, fast-bowler Carmi le Roux was hit in the head by a powerful shot from Ryan Rickelton, but fortunately, he remained conscious and walked off the field unassisted.
* The incident occurred in the third over, and Corey Anderson completed the over in le Roux's absence.
* Despite le Roux's absence, the San Francisco Unicorns went on to win the match, restricting the Seattle Orcas to 142 runs while defending a total of 165.
* Liam Plunkett was the standout bowler, taking 3/26 in his 4-over spell.
* The loss marked the second defeat in two days for the Seattle Orcas, who are now at the bottom of the Major League Cricket season two table with only one win in their last five matches.
* Defending champions MI New York are also struggling, sitting fifth in the standings and outside of the playoff positions.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 - Match 17, TSK vs WF - Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 19th
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 17- Texas Super Kings vs Washington Freedom, which will be played on the 19th of July at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

Points Table

LIVE SCORES - Match 17 - Texas Super Kings vs Washington Freedom (Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas)

Current Form Texas Super Kings:

Texas Super Kings are currently placed at the 3rd position on points table with 2 wins and 1 loss to their credit.

The top run scorer for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket is Faf du Plessis with 209 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket is Marcus Stoinis with 6 scalps under his belt.

Texas Super Kings have won their previous match against MI New York by 15 runs.

Texas Super Kings batted first and they posted a total of 176 for 6 in 20 overs. Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis were simply superb at the top of the order. The scored 40 and 61 runs respectively. The middle order failed to capitalise on the start they got and Texas Super Kings had to settle for an average total of 176 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, MI New York lost 4 wickets for just 39 runs and looked in deep waters. Nicholas Pooran also perished within the powerplay overs to the bowling of Zia-ul-Haq. Monank Patel and Rashid Khan then led the fightback as they scored 61 and 50 runs respectively but the required rate was impossible to achieve. MI New York were eventually restricted to 161 for 7, as they lost the match by 15 runs.

Current Form Washington Freedom:

Washington Freedom are currently placed at the 1st position on points table with 4 wins to their credit.

The top run scorer for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket is Travis Head with 141 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket is Saurabh Netravalkar with 12 scalps under his belt.

Washington Freedom have won their previous match against MI New York by a huge margin of 94 runs.

Washington Freedom batted first and they posted a total of 182 for 5 in 20 overs. Travis Head and Andries Gous took the game on and smashed 54 and 59 runs respectively to get Washington Freedom off to a flier. Rachin Ravindra in the lower middle order then smashed 31 runs in just 14 balls to take Washington Freedom to a massive total of 182 on a tough pitch to bat on.

During the chase, the key players of MI New York including Steven Taylor, Monank Patel and Nicholas Pooran got out cheaply. MI New York were 25 for 6 at one stage. title: MLC Match 17: Washington Rides on strong openers and bowlers to defeat Texas Super Kings
body:
Washington Freedom continued their winning streak, securing a 42-run victory over the Texas Super Kings to remain at the top of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket points table.

Match Summary

Texas Super Kings 164/10 (19.5 ov)

Washington Freedom 206/5 (20 ov)

Washington Freedom won by 42 runs.

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

The Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas witnessed a dominant performance, as Rachin Ravindra’s four wickets bowled out the Texan team for 164 runs. However, led by Faf du Plessis’ quickfire half-century – the fastest by a batter this season -- the Texas Super Kings had a strong start to their run-chase.

Du Plessis propelled his team to 76 runs in the powerplay. However, Washington's bowlers executed a brilliant comeback in the middle overs. Jasdeep Singh, Glenn Maxwell, and Ravindra shared the 10 wickets among them, but it was Lockie Ferguson's crucial over to Du Plessis after the powerplay that turned the tide. Lockie conceded only 2 wides in that over, eventually leading to Faf's dismissal.

Soon after, the Super Kings' batting lineup crumbled, losing 4 wickets for just 15 runs between overs 7.1 and 11.6, ultimately costing them the match. While Calvin Savage managed to strike a few powerful blows towards the end, it only served to narrow the margin of defeat.

Earlier in the clash, Washington Freedom posted a formidable target of 206 for the Texas Super Kings. The fireworks began early with Travis Head delivering a scintillating performance in the powerplay. He hammered 53 runs off just 22 balls, dismantling the seamers with ease and giving Washington a flying start.

As spin was introduced, the scoring rate slowed slightly, thanks to some purchase on the used pitch. However, Maxwell played a pivotal role in maintaining the momentum, contributing crucial runs in the middle overs. Towards the tail end of the innings, Pienaar provided a valuable boost, ensuring a strong finish for the team.

Meanwhile, Steve Smith (57) also continued his consistent performances, nearly batting through the entire innings and securing a well-earned fifty. His steady presence at the crease anchored the Washington innings and kept the scoreboard ticking.

The start given by the two Australian batters was more than enough for the middle order of the Washington-based side to take on the rest of the bowlers. Maxwell (34) and Obus Pienaar (33) both scored crucial runs to ensure their team put up a tough target that the Texas Super Kings were eventually unable to chase down.

Match Stats

Texas Super Kings Fall of wickets: 1-59 (Travis Head - 4.3 ov), 2-74 (Andries Gous - 5.6 ov), 3-79 (Rachin Ravindra - 6.5 ov), 4-137 (Glenn Maxwell - 13.5 ov), 5-186 (Steven Smith - 18.5 ov)

Washington Freedom Fall of wickets: 1-37 (Devon Conway - 3.3 ov), 2-90 (Aaron Hardie - 7.1 ov), 3-96 (Joshua Tromp - 9.4 ov), 4-98 (Faf du Plessis - 10.5 ov), 5-105 (Milind Kumar - 11.6 ov), 6-132 (Marcus Stoinis - 14.6 ov), 7-141 (Dwayne Bravo - 15.5 ov), 8-161 (Mohammad Mohsin - 17.5 ov), 9-163 (Noor Ahmad - 19.3 ov), 10-164 (Calvin Savage - 19.5 ov)

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom Keep Their 'Unbeaten' Run Alive With Thrashing Of Texas Super Kings In Match 17
body:
MLC 2024: Washington Freedom beat Texas Super Kings by 42 runs in Match 17 of the Major League Cricket 2024, as the Steve Smith-led side extend their 'invincible' run in the tournament to 6 matches. Washington Freedom have won 5 out of their 6 matches, as the fixture against Texas Super Kings earlier in the tournament was abandoned due to rain.

Washington Freedom Vs Texas Super Kings MLC 2024 Match 17 Highlights

Electing to bowl first, the Texas Super Kings did not do justice to their decision, as the in-form opening pair of Steve Smith and Travis Head were off to a flying start, and the duo notched up 59 runs in 4.2 overs before the latter fell prey to Noor Ahmed. The partnership was indeed, a hilarious one, as Travis Head scored 53 runs out of those 59 runs, whereas, Steve Smith faced merely 5 balls, and scored 4 runs.

Texas Super Kings made a mini-comeback of their own, as Travis Head's departure was followed by quick dismissals of Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra inside the next 20 runs, ad Washington Freedom were reeling at 79/3 in 7 overs.

The small stutter did not halt the scoring rate, as the Australian duo of Glenn Maxwell and Steve Smith notched up a 58-run stand to resurrect the innings before Glenn Maxwell departed on the score of 138. Steve Smith held his guard until the last phase of the innings, as his excellent half-century enabled the Freedom to cross the 200-run mark.

In reply, the in-form Faf Du Plessis announced his arrival on the pitch in some style, as the Proteas legend unleashed his wrath on Washington Freedom bowlers, and TSK were 76/1 at the end of the powerplay. What followed later was a downhill journey for the side, as wickets fell in quick succession and intervals, and the target of 207 seemed even more improbable.

The Faf Du Plessis-led side bundled out for 164, as four wickets from Rachin Ravindra, and three wickets each from Glenn Maxwell and Jasdeep Singh saw Washington Freedom home in a winning cause.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom beat Texas Super Kings by 42 runs in Match 17 of the MLC 2024.

**Washington Freedom's Performance:** Steve Smith-led Washington Freedom extended their unbeaten run to 6 matches, with 5 wins out of 6 matches played so far. Steve Smith and Travis Head put up a 59-run opening partnership, with Head scoring 53 runs. Despite a mini-collapse, Glenn Maxwell and Steve Smith's 58-run stand helped Washington Freedom reach 207 runs.

**Texas Super Kings' Performance:** Texas Super Kings were bowled out for 164 runs in response, with Faf Du Plessis scoring well in the powerplay but failing to sustain the momentum. Washington Freedom's bowlers Rachin Ravindra, Glenn Maxwell, and Jasdeep Singh took 4, 3, and 3 wickets respectively to secure the win for their team.

title: MLC 2024: San Francisco Unicorns Edge Out MI New York in a Thrilling Finish; Confirm PlayOff Spot
body:
oi-Aditya K Halder

The San Francisco Unicorns emerged victorious with a narrow three-run win against MI New York in a gripping encounter at the 2024 Major League Cricket -- MLC 2024 -- held at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

Corey Anderson's unbeaten 59 played a pivotal role in anchoring the Unicorns' innings. Despite a shaky start, Anderson's composure helped his team post a competitive total of 148/7. Hassan Khan's valuable 44 complemented Anderson's effort, particularly their crucial 87-run partnership which salvaged the innings after early setbacks.

The Unicorns' innings began poorly, with Noshtush Kenjige wreaking havoc by dismissing Finn Allen (0) and Matthew Short (4) early on. Further losses of Sanjay Krishnamurthi and Josh Inglis left the team struggling at 28/4 by the end of the powerplay.

Sherfane Rutherford's brief 15 gave some momentum before being run out. Rashid Khan's dismissal of Hassan Khan in the 17th over and Trent Boult's double strikes kept MI New York in contention. However, Anderson's steady half-century ensured the Unicorns had a defensible score.

In response, MI New York's chase had a turbulent start as Matthew Short claimed the wicket of Ruben Clinton (0) in the second over. Dewald Brevis and Nicholas Pooran then steadied the ship, taking MI New York to 31/1 at the end of the powerplay. Brevis was particularly impressive, reaching his half-century in just 32 balls with an aggressive display against Pat Cummins.

Despite Brevis' heroics, MI New York's middle order crumbled under pressure. Brody Couch's twin strikes to remove Brevis and captain Kieron Pollard (4) shifted the momentum. Matthew Short further dented MI New York's chase by dismissing Pooran (26).

As the run rate escalated, Romario Shepherd and Monank Patel fell cheaply, leaving Rashid Khan and Heath Richards with a daunting task. Cummins' tight 19th over, conceding just five runs, was instrumental in tightening the screws.

The final over, bowled by Haris Rauf, saw a valiant effort from Heath Richards, who nearly pulled off a miraculous chase by hitting two sixes. However, his dismissal on the last ball sealed a dramatic win for the Unicorns.

The thrilling contest showcased exceptional performances on both sides but ultimately highlighted the importance of composure under pressure. Corey Anderson's stability with the bat and Pat Cummins' crucial bowling proved decisive in a match that kept spectators on the edge of their seats until the final delivery.

Brief Scores

San Francisco Unicorns 148/7 (Corey Anderson 59*, Hassan Khan 44; Noshtush Kenjige 2/13, Trent Boult 2/35) beat MI New York 145/7 (Dewald Brevis 56, Nicholas Pooran 26; Matthew Short 3/27, Brody Couch 2/27)
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won by 3 runs against MI New York in a thrilling match at the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC 2024) held at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Key Performances:**

* Corey Anderson's unbeaten 59 anchored the Unicorns' innings, while Hassan Khan's 44 complemented his effort.
* Dewald Brevis scored a half-century in just 32 balls for MI New York, but ultimately couldn't secure a win.
* Pat Cummins' tight bowling and Matthew Short's 3/27 were crucial in restricting MI New York's chase.

**Match Highlights:**

* The Unicorns had a shaky start, losing 4 wickets in the powerplay, but Anderson's composure helped them post a competitive total.
* MI New York's chase was turbulent, with Brevis' aggressive display being undone by the Unicorns' bowlers.
* The final over saw a dramatic finish, with Heath Richards hitting two sixes, but ultimately getting dismissed on the last ball to seal the Unicorns' win.

MLC 2024: The Major League Cricket 2024 has crossed its halfway stage, and the prime T20 league of USA has already sealed its two playoff teams in the form of Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns. Texas Super Kings could have become the third side today, but the 'invincible' Washington Freedom played the role of party-spoiler by handing the Faf Du Plessis-led side a thumping 42-run defeat.

"I think we are just getting better and better as the tournament goes on. Travis Head has been unbelievable on these slow wickets. Jasdeep, Lockie, and Marco have all been very good. Everyone is training hard and preparing for their roles and scenarios. There's a great vibe in the group, and securing a top-two spot is exciting. He (Jasdeep Singh) has exceeded expectations, picked up big wickets, and stuck to the plan. He has a bright future ahead," said Steve Smith, Washington Freedom captain.

READ HERE | MLC 2024: Washington Freedom Keep Their 'Unbeaten' Run Alive With Thrashing Of Texas Super Kings In Match 17

"I'm just enjoying myself and expressing my game. I didn't expect to be here for two weeks. The support staff is excellent, and Smudge (Steve Smith) and Ferguson are brilliant-they keep backing me. The wicket was a bit too paced. Faf was going well, so going off-pace was probably the right call at that stage. I watched Lockie in the previous over, and Smudge made it clear to me," said Jasdeep Singh, who was awarded the MVP of the Match.

title: [Watch] Sunil Narine's Rocket Throw Blows Quinton de Kock Away For Duck In MLC 2024
body:
Sunil Narine's direct hit to dismiss QDK for duck (X.com)

Sunil Narine, a man of many talents, is not known for his fielding abilities. However, on Wednesday (July 18), during the Major League Cricket (MLC 2024) fixture between Seattle Orcas and Los Angeles Knight Riders, the rare scene took all the limelight.

It took place during the fourth over of the innings when Quinton de Kock, coming at No. 3, played Corne Dry to long-on, and went for a quick single. Placed there, Narine went for a direct hit with a super-fast throw, and in the process, he completed a run out of nowhere, leaving everyone in absolute awe.

Narine's Throw Leaves De Kock Stunned

De Kock, on the other hand, was left stunned, as the replay showed he was just short of the crease.

Los Angeles Knight Riders defeated Seattle Orcas by four wickets, with Unmukt Chand making headlines with an excellent 47-ball 62. The Orcas posted 142/6 batting first, while the Knight Riders saw off the target in 19.1 overs, with Saif Badar and Dry finishing things off, scoring 18* and 0* respectively.

With the victory, the Knight Riders are placed fourth on the points table, while the Orcas are at the bottom of the chart.

title: WATCH: South African bowler badly injured by batter’s powerful hit in MLC
body:
