title: Washington Freedom Crushes MI New York By 94 Runs In MLC 2024 Clash
body:
Cricket

-OneArabia

Washington Freedom secured a dominant 94-run victory over MI New York in their fifth match of Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas. Travis Head and Andries Gous led the charge with impressive half-centuries, propelling Washington to a formidable total of 182/5 in their allotted 20 overs.

After being asked to bat first, Washington's openers, Steve Smith and Travis Head, provided a steady start. However, Smith was dismissed by Rashid Khan in the fifth over after scoring 8 off 10 balls. Head then took control and formed a crucial partnership with Andries Gous. Their combined efforts helped Washington cross the 100-run mark by the 11th over.

Head's aggressive innings of 54 off 33 balls included nine fours and two sixes before he was caught at long-on by Rashid Khan off Romario Shepherd’s bowling in the next over. Glen Maxwell followed soon after, despite being dropped earlier by Steven Taylor. Rashid Khan eventually dismissed Maxwell in the 16th over for 15 off 14 balls.

In the final overs, Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra accelerated the scoring rate. Gous reached his half-century in the 19th over, while Ravindra hammered two sixes and a four off Trent Boult in the same over, adding 23 runs. Ravindra was dismissed by Kieron Pollard for a quickfire 31 off 14 balls on the third ball of the final over. Gous ended his vital knock of 59 off 48 balls by getting caught on the last ball of the innings.

Washington Freedom's bowlers then delivered an exceptional performance to dismantle MI New York for just 88 runs. The win ensured Washington Freedom became the first team to qualify for the Playoffs this season, solidifying their lead at the top of the points table with nine points from five matches.

MI New York's Struggles

MI New York had a disastrous start to their chase as they lost five wickets within the Powerplay, scoring only 25 runs. Steven Taylor (0 off 3), Monank Patel (4 off 6), Dewald Brevis (2 off 5), Shayan Jahangir (3 off 9), and Nicholas Pooran (4 off 6) were all dismissed cheaply by Washington’s bowlers.

The situation worsened as skipper Kieron Pollard (4 off 9) and Rashid Khan (7 off 6) were also sent back to the pavilion by the ninth over with MI New York struggling at 56/7. Romario Shepherd and Trent Boult showed some resistance by adding a quickfire partnership of 33 runs from just 16 balls.

Maxwell Seals Victory

Shepherd’s valiant effort ended in the 11th over when he was dismissed for a brisk 25 off just 14 balls. Maxwell wrapped up proceedings for Washington Freedom by taking two wickets in the same over. He removed Boult (16 off 13) on his first delivery and Ehsan Adil (0 off 2) on his third ball, bowling out MI New York for just 88 runs.

Brief Scores: Washington Freedom (Andries Gous:59 off48; Travis Head:54off33; Kieron Pollard:2/14in2overs) beat MI New York(Romario Shepherd:25off14; Trent Boult:16off13; Jasdeep Singh:3/14in3overs)by94runs.

This comprehensive win highlights Washington Freedom's strong form this season as they continue their quest for glory in Major League Cricket.

Story first published: Wednesday, July 17, 2024, 14:33 [GST]
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs in their fifth match of Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Top Performers:**

* Travis Head (Washington Freedom): 54 off 33 balls with 9 fours and 2 sixes
* Andries Gous (Washington Freedom): 59 off 48 balls with a half-century
* Rachin Ravindra (Washington Freedom): 31 off 14 balls with 2 sixes and a four
* Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom): 3/14 in 3 overs
* Glen Maxwell (Washington Freedom): 2 wickets in an over, including Boult and Ehsan Adil

**Key Moments:**

* Washington Freedom posted a formidable total of 182/5 in 20 overs, thanks to half-centuries from Travis Head and Andries Gous.
* MI New York struggled in their chase, losing 5 wickets within the Powerplay and eventually being bowled out for 88 runs.
* Washington Freedom's bowlers, including Jasdeep Singh and Glen Maxwell, delivered an exceptional performance to secure the win.

**Tournament Implications:**

* Washington Freedom became the first team to qualify for the Playoffs this season, solidifying their lead at the top of the points table with 9 points from 5 matches.

title: WATCH: Andre Russell's Bat-Breaking Delivery to Travis Head; Head's Reaction Goes Viral
body:
In a thrilling match of the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC), Washington Freedom secured their third consecutive victory by defeating Los Angeles Knight Riders by eight wickets on Sunday. Opting to bowl first, Washington’s bowlers dominated as they bundled out Los Angeles for 129 runs. Saurabh Netravalkar and Glenn Maxwell led the attack, with Netravalkar taking 4 wickets and Maxwell claiming 3.

Washington’s chase was highlighted by a bizarre incident in the second over when Andre Russell’s fiery delivery broke Travis Head’s bat into two pieces, with the upper half flying towards mid-wicket. Despite this, Head and Steve Smith forged a brilliant opening partnership of 79 runs. Head smashed a quickfire 54, including six sixes, before being dismissed in the ninth over.

Steve Smith anchored the innings with an unbeaten 42, guiding Washington to reach the target comfortably in just 16 overs. Rachin Ravindra and Andries Gous provided support as Washington Freedom finished at 130/2.

Looking ahead, Washington Freedom will face MI New York in their next MLC encounter, while Los Angeles Knight Riders will take on Seattle Orcas in their upcoming match. The victory keeps Washington’s momentum strong in the league as they continue their quest for dominance in the season.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Saurabh Netravalkar shines bright for Washington Freedom yet again
body:
It is only four games into the new season of Major League Cricket, but Saurabh Netravalkar has already gone past his tally of 10 wickets in the previous campaign. He has picked up 12 wickets for us so far this season at an astonishing average of 9.16 runs per wicket and a strike rate of 7.66.

Netravalkar, who had a successful T20 World Cup 2024 campaign for the United States, has brought his rich vein of form into the MLC. The left-arm pacer was the USA’s top wicket-taker in the showpiece event with six wickets from six matches.

Netravalkar averaged 20.83 and took a wicket every three overs he bowled (strike rate of 18.83) in the T20 World Cup. In a group where the USA were not even favorites to proceed to the Super 8, he, along with our wicketkeeper-batter Andries Gous, who finished as the USA’s top run-getter, took the team to the next round in a fairytale start to the country’s journey at ICC events.

The Mumbai-born Netravalkar earned accolades for his performance against Pakistan, where he bowled a high-pressure super over to win a thriller, and against India, getting the prized wickets of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

Consistent Performances

Netravalkar had a tally of 10 wickets from six matches in MLC 2023, averaging 1.67 wickets per match. He picked up a wicket every 15.90 runs he conceded and for every 13.10 deliveries he bowled in the last edition.

Our pacer finished as the joint fourth-highest wicket-taker overall in MLC 2023, with his 6/9 against the San Francisco Unicorns being the best figures recorded by any bowler in the MLC to date.

Coming into a new season, Netravalkar has become more lethal and consistent for us. His average wickets per match has moved up to three from 1.67 last year. The runs conceded per wicket has come down from 15.90 to 9.16 and balls per wicket has also reduced sharply from 13.10 to 7.66 compared to last year.

Netravalkar’s economy has also marginally improved from 7.28 runs an over in 2023 to 7.17 currently. His clever variations and change of pace have made it difficult for batters to score against him with the dot-ball percentage going up from 42.75% last year to 52.17% this year.

Netravalkar has had an excellent season so far in the MLC this year and his performance in the upcoming matches will be vital for us to go the distance.
summary: Saurabh Netravalkar, a left-arm pacer, has already taken 12 wickets in just four games of the current MLC season, with an impressive average of 9.16 runs per wicket and a strike rate of 7.66. This surpasses his tally of 10 wickets in the entire previous campaign. Netravalkar's form has carried over from his successful T20 World Cup 2024 campaign, where he was the top wicket-taker for the United States. Compared to last year's MLC season, Netravalkar's average wickets per match has increased from 1.67 to 3, and his economy has improved from 7.28 runs an over to 7.17. His performance will be crucial for his team's success in the upcoming matches.

title: The Cognizant Major League Cricket season is here, but what exactly is Major League Cricket? We’ve got the scoop!
body:
Dallas-Fort Worth continues to expand its sports landscape and the state of Texas took a front row seat with the launch of Cognizant Major League Cricket in the United States in 2023.

Texas Super Kings, the Major League Cricket franchise based in Texas, is headlined by veteran South African and Top Order Batter Faf du Plessis, who returns for his second season. He will be joined by wicket-keeper Devon Conway, Australian power-hitter Marcus Stoinis, fast-bowler Naveen Ul Haq, and Team USA’s Milind Kumar.

What is Major League Cricket?

Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, which began in 2023. Exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC showcases superstar players from around the globe, bringing world-class T20 cricket to America.

As the 2024 season is underway, here’s some quick facts on MLC and what you can expect from T20 Cricket:

Where are the matches played?

Matches will take place at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina. The full schedule and available tickets can be viewed here.

Who are the teams?

There’s six teams currently in the MLC, representing different cities and regions within the United States - The Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.

Who won last year?

MI New York claimed victory in the inaugural 2023 MLC season, defeating the Seattle Orcas.

What is T20 Cricket?

T20, or Twenty20 is one format of cricket.

It is a shortened format (around 3 hours) where each team has 20 overs (this includes 120 balls) to score the most runs.

It’s known for its explosive batting as the time constraints means more incentive to hit big “sixes” and take risks. (Sixes are similar to homeruns for all the baseball fans out there).

An 'over' is the name given to six consecutive balls bowled by one ‘bowler’. There are 20 of these overs in an ‘inning’.There are two innings in a game.

What are the rules?

Each team has 11 batsmen that will attempt to score more runs (points) than their opponent.

The fielding side will be trying to get all the batsmen out as soon as possible to keep the runs total low.

A team earns one run when a batsman hits the ball and runs from one set of stumps to the other.

Teams earn four runs for hitting the ball out of bounds and six runs for hitting the ball out of bounds without it hitting the ground.

The bowler is the player who throws the ball at the stumps to try to knock the ‘bails’ off. (The bowlers are the equivalent of a pitcher in baseball).

Wickets/stumps are the three vertical sticks with two smaller ones called bails laid horizontally on top. The goal is to knock the bails off.

A player on the fielding team stands behind the stumps to catch the ball.

The white lines on the ground is the crease, this is where the wickets and batsman should be.

What has MLC done for Cricket in the USA?

MLC has revolutionized the cricket landscape in the USA. Cognizant Major League Cricket was recently awarded List-A status, recognized by the ICC as an official T20 league, making it America’s first world-class domestic tournament. The inaugural 2023 season was a huge success, with sold-out matches garnering millions of viewers worldwide. The recent T20 World Cup was played across the USA and West Indies and saw team USA both co-host and participate in the tournament for the first time. Forty-seven of the players who took part in the World Cup will remain in the USA for MLC.

MLC FAMILY DAYS - SUNDAY SPECIAL

Make your next family outing one to remember. Enjoy a world-class cricket match and save big with an MLC family value offer!

Watch the world's best cricketers this summer and take advantage of the new family special offer for Sundays only. Receive 30% off when purchasing four or more tickets by selecting the ‘Family’ option at checkout. Available for all Sunday games (excluding Championship match), valid on all GA tickets, and up to 12 tickets per transaction.
summary:
**Tournament Overview**

* Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, launched in 2023.
* MLC is exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket and features superstar players from around the world.

**2024 Season**

* The 2024 season is underway, with matches being played at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.
* There are six teams participating in the tournament, representing different cities and regions in the United States.

**Teams and Last Year's Winner**

* The six teams are: Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.
* MI New York won the inaugural 2023 MLC season, defeating the Seattle Orcas.

**T20 Cricket Format**

* T20 is a shortened format of cricket, lasting around 3 hours.
* Each team has 20 overs to score the most runs, with an emphasis on explosive batting and taking risks.

**Gameplay and Rules**

* Each team has 11 batsmen who attempt to score more runs than their opponent.
* The fielding side tries to get all the batsmen out as soon as possible to keep the runs total low.
* Runs can be scored by hitting the ball and running between stumps, or by hitting the ball out of bounds.

**Impact of MLC**

* MLC has revolutionized the cricket landscape in the USA, with the tournament being awarded List-A status by the ICC.
* The inaugural 2023 season was a huge success, with sold-out matches and millions of viewers worldwide.

title: San Francisco Unicorns secure finals spot with 10-run victory over Texas Super Kings
body:
Dallas, TX, the San Francisco Unicorns narrowly defeated the Texas Super Kings by 10 runs in a thrilling match at the Grand Prairie Stadium, marking the penultimate game of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket season.

Match Summary

Texas Super Kings vs San Francisco Unicorns, Challenger

Texas Super Kings 190/4 (20 ov)

San Francisco Unicorns 200/6 (20 ov)

San Francisco Unicorns won by 10 runs.

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

The San Francisco Unicorns posted a challenging total of 200/6, thanks to a vital innings from Finn Allen (101) that set the stage for a thrilling chase where the Texas Super Kings fell just short at 190/4. Following the day’s result, the Texas Super Kings will take on the Washington Freedom on Sunday.

Finn Allen's explosive 101 off 53, including nine boundaries and five sixes, set the tone for the Unicorns. Allen's aggressive play during the powerplay provided the Unicorns with the momentum they needed, bringing them to a powerplay score of 66/0. Despite Noor Ahmed’s quick wickets of Jake Fraser ‘McGurk (18) and Sanjay Krishnamurthi (0), Josh Inglis added a crucial 37 from 25 deliveries to support Allen through the innings. Finn Allen’s exploits included a 16 run over of Marcus Stoinis on two occasions, the second and the 13th over, and an 18 run over of Zia Ul Haq, comprising two consecutive sixes.

Hassan Khan’s quick 27 off 15 balls, was also vital in propelling the Unicorns to the 200-run mark. For the Texas Super Kings, Noor Ahmad was the standout bowler, capturing key wickets and finishing with figures of 3/27.

In response, the Texas Super Kings opened the batting strongly with Devon Conway (62*) leading the pursuit. Pushing the pace of the innings, Conway’s knock came in just 38 balls. The New Zealander struck four fours and two sixes in an innings where he did not see enough of the strike. Faf du Plessis contributed a brisk 45 off 22, but his dismissal derailed the Texas Super Kings’ momentum. While middle-order contributions from Aaron Hardie (19), Milind Kumar (2) and Marcus Stoinis (1) were lacking, Joshua Tromp scored a breezy 56 from 36 balls, and kept the Super Kings in the hunt until the final over.

Conway brought up his half century in only 30 balls, whereas Tromp powered his way to the milestone in 31 deliveries, including four fours and two sixes.

The match came down to the wire in the last five overs with the Texas Super Kings needing 64 runs. With the dangerous Conway and Tromp at the crease, Haris Rauf and Pat Cummins held their nerves for the San Francisco Unicorns, delivering tight overs under pressure. Cummins was pivotal in the 20th over, conceding only 7 runs when 18 were needed, showcasing experienced death bowling that ensured a Unicorns' victory. Juanoy Drysdale emerged as the leading wicket-taker of the innings with figures of 2/33.

title: Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns Highlights, Qualifier: Washington Freedom beat San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets, enter final
body:
Right then, that is it from the qualifier game of the Major League Cricket between San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom. It is Washingtom Freedom that have sealed their spot in the finals while the San Francisco will have another chance to make it there. The Challenger game will be played on the 27th of July 2024 at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT) where the Unicorns will face the Texas Super Kings. Our coverage will start an hour earlier so make sure to tune in for an exciting mactch. Until then, goodbye and cheers!

Steven Smith, the captain of Washington Freedom says that captaincy has been fun and the team works as a unit. Says that it has been a good campaign and appreciates his team for playing well. Mentions that he wanted wickets with the new ball to make it easier towards the later stages. Credits Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell for playing well. Adds that Head is confident and tries to hit every ball and targets all the pockets of the ground which works for him.

Corey Anderson, the captain of San Francisco Unicorns says that losing 4 wickets in the first innings was tough and that they were 20-30 runs short. Feels that they weren’t up to the mark throughout the game. Says that the batters need to take risks and they will bounce back stronger.

Travis Head is the Player of the Match for his scintillating knock. He says that batting in the Powerplay is fun for him. Adds that he tries to get that fast start and that is his role in the team. Mentions that the wicket here is good and the swing on offer here allows him to play some good shots. Says that the team has full faith in him and has given him free air to do his thing.

Rachin Ravindra is up for a chat. He says that he is happy with his bowling and it was a good day for them. Mentions that it is all about execution and is happy to fulfill the role of the backup bowler. Adds that he aims to be a genuine all rounder and help the teams that he is a part of. Says that he tries to soak it as much as he can and learn from the senior players and coaches. Feels that he is adjusting to the role and learns from every experience.

Earlier in the match, Washington Freedom won the toss and opted to have San Francisco bat first. The innings began with Marco Jansen claiming an early wicket, dismissing Finn Allen cheaply. Jake Fraser-McGurk followed suit, falling to Saurabh Netravalkar without scoring. Wickets kept on tumbling for them until Hassan Khan and Anderson joined hands. Hassan Khan played a commendable innings, scoring 57 runs, supported by Corey Anderson's 26 off 19, as they added 61 runs for the 6th wicket from just 35 balls. Once Anderson departed, the things kept falling apart for them. Rachin Ravindra was the standout bowler for the Washington Freedom with remarkable figures of 4 wickets for just 11 runs. Marco Jansen took three wickets but was expensive, while Saurabh Netravalkar ended up with 2 wickets in his kitty.

San Francisco Unicorns would have wanted a few more runs on the board in the first innings but Pat Cummins gave them a great start with the wicket of Steven Smith. Hassan Khan then worked his spin magic and sent Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra back in consecutive overs. After that, the bowlers just gave away some loose deliveries and got themselves under pressure. The poor overs by Haris Rauf and Corey Anderson didn't help their cause and they failed to break the partnership. In the end, the total was a bit low to defend. However, they will still have one more chance in the Challenger to give themselves a ticket to the finals.

Washington Freedom have beaten San Francisco Unicorns very confidently and established themselves in the finals directly! They had a shaky start with the early dismissal of Steven Smith and the initial struggle by Travis Head. However, Andries Gous came in to play a few shots while Travis Head too found his rhythm. His onslaught combined with Glenn Maxwell's power hitting gave the boost needed to this team. The positive intent got the opposition under pressure and sealed the game in their favor.

title: Washington Freedom secure emphatic 7-wicket win over San Francisco Unicorns to reach 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket Final
body:
The Washington Freedom secured an emphatic 7-wicket win over the San Francisco Unicorns in the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 Qualifier at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

Match Summary

Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns, Qualifier 1

Washington Freedom 149/3 (15.3 ov)

San Francisco Unicorns 145/10 (19.0 ov)

Washington Freedom won by 7 wickets

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

Rachin Ravindra's 4/11 helped the Washington Freedom bowl out San Francisco Unicorns for 145 before chasing down their target in 16 overs, thanks to unbeaten knocks from Travis Head (77* off 44) and Glenn Maxwell (54* off 23).

With this victory, the Washington Freedom became the first team to reach the final of the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024. The San Francisco Unicorns will now face the Texas Super Kings in the Challenger for a place in the summit clash.

After a challenging innings with the bat, Pat Cummins got the San Francisco Unicorns off to a great start with the ball. He removed Steve Smith (1 off 3) in the second over and bowled a maiden in the fourth over. However, Carmi le Roux was unable to provide the necessary support as Travis Head batted aggressively for Washington Freedom. Head scored 31 runs off le Roux's two overs and added another 13 runs off Haris Rauf to end the Powerplay at 52/1.

Andries Gous (9 off 14) lost his wicket cheaply to Hassan Khan in the seventh over, and Rachin Ravindra followed in the ninth over after scoring just 3 off 9, leaving Washington at 64/3.

Head brought up his fifth consecutive fifty in 28 balls during the 10th over. He, along with Glenn Maxwell, accelerated the run chase as Washington crossed the 100-run mark in the 13th over. They both kept finding timely boundaries and eventually took the Washington Freedom over the line in 16 overs.

Earlier in the day, the San Francisco Unicorns had a terrible start after being invited to bat first. They lost four wickets even before reaching the 50-run mark.

Marco Jansen struck twice, removing Finn Allen (6 off 4) in the very first over and dismissing Josh Inglis (8 off 7) in the sixth over. Meanwhile, Saurabh Netravalkar took the wicket of Jake Fraser-McGurk (11 off 11) in the fourth over, while Rachin Ravindra trapped Sanjay Krishnamurthi (19 off 19) LBW in the seventh over, leaving the Unicorns at 49/4 after seven overs.

Sherfane Rutherford (6 off 9) soon followed them back to the pavilion, but Hassan Khan and Corey Anderson tried to steady the ship, adding a crucial 61 runs off 35 balls. However, Anderson was dismissed on the last ball of the 16th over by Jansen after scoring 26 off 19, leaving the Unicorns at 127/6.

Khan, on the other hand, reached his half-century in 34 balls in the 19th over, but Ravindra, who took two wickets in the 18th over, dismissed him on the first ball of the last over. Khan played a vital knock of 57 off 36 balls, taking Unicorns to a respectable total of 145.

Match Stats

San Francisco Unicorns Fall of wickets: 1-7 (Finn Allen - 0.3 ov), 2-35 (Jake Fraser McGurk - 3.5 ov), 3-49 (Josh Inglis - 5.6 ov), 4-49 (Sanjay Krishnamurthi - 6.3 ov), 5-66 (Sherfane Rutherford - 10.1 ov), 6-127 (Corey Anderson - 15.6 ov), 7-132 (Pat Cummins - 16.5 ov), 8-135 (Haris Rauf - 17.3 ov), 9-135 (Carmi le Roux - 17.5 ov), 10-145 (Hassan Khan - 19.1 ov)

title: Texas Super Kings vs. Seattle Orcas: Memorable Clash| MLC 2024
body:
The stunning match of the American-based Major League Cricket (MLC) season was between the Texas Super Kings and the Seattle Orcas. While there was not much at stake in terms of qualification to the playoffs until the last games, it was still important for the Super Kings to score a victory in the game. This was a major decision that saw the Seattle Orcas take the field before the Texas Super Kings, though this did not take long. The Super Kings faced a lot of trouble on the field, which resulted in the collapse of the team at one point, and by the end of the second over, they were down 12/2.

While Faf du Plessis painstakingly tried to ensure a more sedate approach, wickets tumbled in a heap, and the Super Kings were in a state of disarray.

Mitchell Santner’s Heroic Moment For Texas Super Kings

While the Texas Super Kings struggled against the rising pressure of Seattle Orca’s bowling attack, Kiwi all-rounder Mitchell Santner rose to the occasion. The fifth delivery of the 11th over saw Santner come up with a shot, which must have been a huge relief for his team, who seemed to be teetering at that stage. This particular shot reminded me a lot of one of the legends of the Super Kings, Suresh Raina.

Ali Sheikh, the Orcas’ spinner, bowled the ball up on off-stump, and there was no nonsense about Santner, who started showing immense composure and accuracy and played a wonderful inside-out against the spinner over long-off for a giant six. It could also be seen as a soft skill for the analysis, and the timing for this shot was reminiscent of Raina’s famous move. Raina was famous for playing spinner, and this shot was famous with him when he played for Super Kings, while Santner did this well as a mimic to Raina.

A Tribute to Suresh Raina

It was not just a show of force, but it was all about Suresh Raina and his great contribution to the Indian cricket team. Raina, one of the superior strapping batsmen loved for his originality and hostility against spinners, was a part of the Super Kings’ legacy. Santner, in particular, mimicked Raina’s shot in the context of the match’s execution, where he went inside out to a spinner, thus giving the fans a memory to denote.

Over the courtesy of some fine fast bowling from the Orcas, Santner’s knock was the only bright spark for the Super Kings as the match went on. His capacity to embody the spirit of one of the squad greats established his worth within the lineup, becoming a symbol of strength at the touchdown poker site amid the team’s misfortunes.

While the result of the match was not decisive and seemingly did not change the position of the teams significantly, the moment when Mitchell Santner set for the ball and scored a long shot supported by Ali Sheikh was the moment that made cricket exciting and presented the essence of the Texas Super Kings. In such a lighter vein, as the Super Kings will turn their attention to the playoffs, Santner’s innings underlined the best virtues of this team.
summary:
**Match Details:** The match was played between the Texas Super Kings and the Seattle Orcas in the American-based MLC season.

**Key Moment:** The crucial moment in the match came when Kiwi all-rounder Mitchell Santner, playing for the Texas Super Kings, hit a giant six off Ali Sheikh's delivery in the 11th over, reminiscent of Suresh Raina's famous shot. This shot was a much-needed relief for the Super Kings, who were struggling against the Orcas' bowling attack.

**Texas Super Kings' Struggle:** The Super Kings faced trouble on the field, collapsing to 12/2 by the end of the second over. Despite Faf du Plessis' efforts to stabilize the innings, wickets continued to fall, leaving the team in disarray.

**Mitchell Santner's Impact:** Santner's knock was the only bright spark for the Super Kings, showcasing his composure and accuracy. His ability to embody the spirit of Suresh Raina, a Super Kings' legend, established his worth within the lineup and provided a rare moment of excitement in an otherwise struggling innings.

**Significance:** Although the match result did not significantly impact the teams' positions, Santner's innings highlighted the best virtues of the Texas Super Kings and provided a memorable moment in the tournament.

title: Things to do in Dallas-Fort Worth this weekend: Asian film festival, Black invitational rodeo and championship cricket match
body:
DALLAS — Back to school is just around the corner for some school districts, but Dallas-Fort Worth is still celebrating summer break with big events.

Watch a new movie at the Asian Film Festival of Dallas or giddy up to the Texas Black Invitational Rodeo. If you’re looking for even more activity and mystery, check out the Major League Cricket championship game where the Texas Super Kings might be playing.

Experience Texas and international culture with plenty of family fun to get you through the final weeks of summer.

Here’s a look at what is happening this weekend.

Friday, July 26

Since 2002, the Asian Film Festival of Dallas has given Asian and Asian American filmmakers and documentarians opportunities to showcase their cinematic vision on the big screen. Festivalgoers have a chance to experience other lives and cultures without leaving their theater seats.

Screenings will feature work from filmmakers across the world including student shorts, special Q&As and more. This year’s showcase films include “The Movie Emperor,” “Tokyo Cowboy,” “The Guest” and “Twilight of the Warriors: Walled In.”

The film festival is hosted by its associated nonprofit organization and is volunteer-run. It runs from Thursday, July 25 through Sunday, July 28 at the Angelika Film Center in Dallas. Tickets for each screening are available here. The films are not rated.

Other events:

Saturday, July 27

Put your cowboy hats on and shine your belt buckles for the 35th Texas Black Invitational Rodeo! The event presented by the African American Museum in Dallas features African American cowboys and cowgirls competing for cash prizes in bronc and bull riding, calf and steer roping, barrel racing and a Pony Express relay race.

Kick off the family fun with the Grand Entry Parade at 6:30 p.m., followed by other highlights like trick lasso performances, music and more. Concessions will be available inside the Fair Park Coliseum.

Proceeds from the event support the African American Museum of Dallas’ mission of preserving and displaying artistic, cultural and historical materials. The museum has one of the largest African American Folk Art collections in the country.

Tickets range from $30 to $40 and are available here.

Other events:

Sunday, July 28

The Major Cricket League championships are here to end the season!

While the teams playing each other in the final have not been decided yet, there’s a chance the Texas Super Kings will compete for the title. The two teams will be announced after Thursday’s qualifier game between the Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns and Friday’s challenger game between the qualifier loser and the Texas Super Kings.

Major League Cricket is the United States’ first professional T20 Cricket league, and this is only its second season. For attendees new to the sport, the stadium will have Cricket 101 flyers to explain how the game is played.

The match will be played at Grand Prairie Stadium at 7:30 p.m. Gates open 75 minutes before the game starts and parking is available onsite starting at $20. Tickets start at $30.
summary:
* The Major League Cricket championship game is taking place on Sunday, July 28.
* The teams playing in the final have not been decided yet, but the Texas Super Kings may be competing for the title.
* The teams will be announced after the qualifier game between the Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns on Thursday, and the challenger game between the qualifier loser and the Texas Super Kings on Friday.
* The match will be played at Grand Prairie Stadium at 7:30 p.m.
* Gates will open 75 minutes before the game starts, and parking is available onsite starting at $20.
* Tickets start at $30.
* Cricket 101 flyers will be available at the stadium to explain how the game is played for attendees new to the sport.
* Major League Cricket is the United States' first professional T20 Cricket league, and this is only its second season.

title: SFU vs TSK MLC 2024: Finn Allen's Century Guides San Francisco To 10-Run Win Over Texas, Setting Up Final Clash vs Washington
body:
SFU vs TSK MLC 2024: San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) defeated Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 10 runs to enter the Major League Cricket 2024 final on Saturday, July 27 (as per the Indian Standard Time). Pat Cummins held his composure in the final over to lead SFU to a win, paving the way for a championship clash against the Washington Freedom on July 28. Finn Allen's impressive 101, along with significant performances from Hassan Khan (27 off 15 and 1-25) and Juanoy Drysdale (2-33), secured a thrilling win for the Unicorns.

Choosing to bat first, Finn Allen quickly got into his stride, hitting two boundaries in the opening over and continuing his aggressive approach.

ALSO ON ABP Live | IND vs SL 1st T20I Match Preview: Probable Playing 11s, Pitch & Weather Report, Head-To-Head Record & More

Allen maintained his form throughout the Powerplay, guiding the team to 66 without loss. He reached his half-century with a four off Aaron Hardie, but Noor (3 for 27) broke the partnership by dismissing McGurk, with Sanjay Krishnamurthi following soon after.

Allen continued to score freely, striking boundaries off Stoinis and Mohammad Mohsin, and reached his century before being dismissed by Mohsin. Noor maintained his impressive form by dismissing Rutherford. Despite a strong start, the Unicorns ended their innings at 200 for 6, as TSK managed to tighten their defence and restrict the scoring.

TSK Fall Short Despite Conway & Tromp's Strong Fightback

In response, TSK came out aggressively, with Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway showcasing their intent with early boundaries. Le Roux eventually dismissed du Plessis and Hardie carried on the attack until Drysdale ended his innings. TSK faced challenges as wickets fell frequently and they went 33 balls without hitting a boundary.

Conway and Joshua Tromp staged a comeback, with the latter reaching his half-century. Tromp also scored his fifty in the 19th over. Despite their late push, Cummins controlled the final over effectively, conceding just seven runs and ensuring the Unicorns' spot in the MLC 2024 final.
summary:
**Match Summary:** San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) defeated Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 10 runs to reach the MLC 2024 final.

**Key Performances:**

* Finn Allen scored an impressive 101 for SFU.
* Hassan Khan contributed 27 off 15 and took 1 wicket for 25 runs.
* Juanoy Drysdale took 2 wickets for 33 runs.
* Devon Conway and Joshua Tromp staged a late fightback for TSK, but fell short.

**Match Details:**

* SFU batted first and scored 200 for 6, with Allen reaching his century.
* TSK came close but fell short, with Conway and Tromp's late push not enough to secure a win.
* Pat Cummins held his nerve in the final over, conceding only 7 runs to ensure SFU's win.

**Next Match:** SFU will face Washington Freedom in the MLC 2024 final on July 28.

body:

title: Mumbai Indians star pacer out of upcoming Test series due to an injury
body:
South African pace sensation Gerald Coetzee picked up an injury while playing in the US-based T20 league named Major League Cricket. He has still not recovered from the injury and will miss the tour to West Indies. He picked a side strain while playing for the Chennai Super Kings-based franchise, the Texas Super Kings, and immediately went back home so that Proteas medical staff could examine his injured left side. According to Cricket South Africa’s confirmation on Thursday, Coetzee is unavailable for the Test Series against West Indies.

Uncapped pacer Migael Pretorius has been announced as Coetzee’s replacement. Pretorius has an experience of 64 first-class games behind him. He was last selected in the team in March 2021 for a T20 series against Pakistan, however, he did not play any games. He was also called for the Test Side against Sri Lanka but was unfortunate to miss out on his debut due to a shoulder injury. Gerald Coetzee impressed everyone with his performance in the 2023 edition of the ODI World Cup, where he picked up 20 wickets. He was the highest wicket-taker for his country and the joint fourth-highest overall. This later also got him a spot in the five-time IPL-winning franchise Mumbai Indians. He grabbed 13 wickets in 10 matches and was the joint second-highest wicket-taker for the MI side.

title: Watch: Corey Anderson grabs A sensational one-handed catch to dismiss Faf du Plessis in Major League Cricket
body:
San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) all-rounder Corey Anderson showcased his brilliant fielding during the match against the Texas Super Kings (TSK) in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. Corey Anderson took a sensational catch to get rid of Faf du Plessis in the Challenger match of the ongoing T20 tournament.

The San Francisco Unicorns posted a formidable 200/6 in 20 overs against the Texas Super Kings. The knockout match took place at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Saturday, July 27 (IST). Opener Finn Allen scored an impressive century of 101 runs off 53 balls with the help of nine boundaries and five maximums.

Josh Inglis scored 37 runs from 25 balls, and Hassan Khan added 27 off 15 balls. Left-arm wrist spinner Noor Ahmad was the standout bowler for the Super Kings, claiming three wickets for 27 runs. The Faf du Plessis-led team needed to chase down the target to reach the final match of the Major League Cricket.

Watch: Corey Anderson Takes Sensational Catch To Dismiss Faf du Plessis

Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway provided a flying start for the team as they added 50 runs in just 4 overs. Du Plessis scored 45 runs off 22 deliveries, including seven boundaries and one six. However, the TSK skipper's innings ended with a spectacular one-handed catch by Corey Anderson during the fifth over.

The right-handed batter mistimed a shot off pacer Carmi le Roux. The former New Zealand all-rounder, who was positioned at mid-off, timed his jump perfectly to make a stunning catch with his left hand. The Super Kings lost their first wicket with 55 runs on the board in 4.2 overs during the recent MLC match.

Devd Conway (62 off 38 balls) and Joshua Trump (56 off 36 balls) scored unbeaten half-centuries during the run chase. However, the Texas Super Kings lost the match by just 10 runs. Juanoy Drysdale picked up two wickets for 33 runs in his four overs, while Hassan Khan and Carmi le Roux each took one wicket.

That Catch Helped Us - Corey Anderson

San Francisco Unicorns skipper Corey Anderson stated that they managed to secure victory due to crucial moments, including Juanoy Drysdale’s performance and his spectacular catch. Anderson said that his catch of Faf du Plessis was pivotal in disrupting the Super Kings' momentum.

"I thought they kept going (TSK batters), but we kept hanging in and we had runs on the board. He was incredible tonight, won us the moments in the middle (on Drysdale), was a bit underdone coming into the tournament, but has got better with games. It was moments like that which will help us going further (on his one-handed catch), Faf has been playing well right through the tournament, so that catch helped us to stall some of the momentum away from them," Anderson said.

The San Francisco Unicorns will face the Washington Freedom in the final game at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday, July 29 (IST).
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) defeated Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 10 runs in the Challenger match of the MLC 2024.

**Key Performances:**

* Finn Allen scored a century (101 off 53 balls) for SFU.
* Corey Anderson took a sensational one-handed catch to dismiss Faf du Plessis.
* Faf du Plessis scored 45 runs off 22 deliveries for TSK before being caught by Anderson.
* Devon Conway and Joshua Trump scored unbeaten half-centuries (62 off 38 balls and 56 off 36 balls respectively) for TSK.
* Juanoy Drysdale picked up two wickets for 33 runs in his four overs for SFU.

**Quotes:** SFU skipper Corey Anderson credited his team's win to crucial moments, including his spectacular catch and Juanoy Drysdale's performance.

**Next Match:** SFU will face Washington Freedom in the final game at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday, July 29 (IST).

title: WATCH: Glenn Maxwell’s mammoth six against Hassan Khan in the Qualifier of MLC 2024
body:
In a match that will be etched into Major League Cricket (MLC) folklore, Glenn Maxwell‘s colossal six propelled the Washington Freedom to a thrilling seven-wicket victory over the San Francisco Unicorns in Qualifier of the MLC 2024. Chasing a modest 146, Freedom were in trouble at 64/3 before Maxwell unleashed his power-hitting prowess to turn the game on its head.

San Francisco Unicorns have a stick

Batting first, the San Francisco Unicorns posted a competitive total of 145 runs in their allotted 19 overs. Hassan Khan, the tournament’s standout bowler, once again showcased his talent with a quickfire 57. However, the Unicorns’ innings was derailed by a brilliant spell from Rachin Ravindra, who claimed four wickets for just 11 runs to stifle the Unicorns’ momentum. Marco Jansen also chipped in with three wickets as the Freedom bowlers kept a tight leash on the Unicorns’ batting.

Glenn Maxwell’s masterclass

With the bat, Washington Freedom were off to a shaky start, losing their top three batters cheaply. The pressure was mounting on the Freedom, but then, Maxwell arrived at the crease. The Australian maverick wasted no time in asserting his dominance, launching into the Unicorns’ bowlers with reckless abandon.

The highlight of the innings, and perhaps the entire tournament so far, came when Maxwell deposited a Hassan delivery into orbit during the 15th over. The ball cleared the boundary with disdain, going a staggering 103 meters away. The crowd at the Grand Prairie Stadium was left in awe as they witnessed a shot that will be replayed for years to come.

Here’s the video:

Maxwell’s brutal hitting took the game away from the Unicorns. He raced to a fifty, providing the much-needed impetus to the Freedom chase. With Travis Head providing steady support, the duo ensured that Washington Freedom crossed the line with seven wickets in hand and three balls to spare.

Also WATCH: Pat Cummins dismisses Steve Smith on the very first ball of his spell in MLC 2024

Washington Freedom advance to the Final

The victory propels Washington Freedom into the final of the MLC 2024. They will be brimming with confidence after Maxwell’s match-winning heroics. On the other hand, the San Francisco Unicorns will be disappointed to miss out on the final, but they can take solace from their impressive performance throughout the tournament.

Hassan, despite conceding the longest six of the tournament, has been a revelation and will undoubtedly be a key player for the Unicorns in the future. The final promises to be a blockbuster clash and cricket fans around the world will be eagerly anticipating the showdown between the two best teams in the tournament.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom won by 7 wickets against San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier of MLC 2024.

**Score:** San Francisco Unicorns scored 145 runs in 19 overs, while Washington Freedom chased it down with 7 wickets in hand and 3 balls to spare.

**Key Performances:**

* Glenn Maxwell delivered a match-winning performance, scoring a fifty and hitting a 103-meter six, the longest of the tournament, to turn the game in favor of Washington Freedom.
* Rachin Ravindra took 4 wickets for 11 runs to restrict San Francisco Unicorns' innings.
* Hassan Khan scored 57 runs for San Francisco Unicorns, but conceded the longest six of the tournament to Maxwell.

**Tournament Implications:** Washington Freedom advances to the final of MLC 2024, while San Francisco Unicorns are eliminated from the tournament.

title: 2 franchises which might target Faf du Plessis for IPL 2025 if he is released by RCB
body:
Despite being 40, Faf du Plessis is the best batter in the Major League Cricket 2024. He was also brilliant in IPL 2024. There is no reason why he cannot play a few more years in the IPL. However, Royal Challengers Bengaluru may not retain him. He may not be worth the retention amount, especially because of his game. That said, a few other teams will target to sign him. On that note, here, we take a look at the list of two franchises which might target Faf du Plessis for IPL 2025 if he is released by RCB.

1) Chennai Super Kings

It is for the Texas Super Kings that Faf du Plessis played so well in MLC 2024. He was decent for the Joburg Super Kings in SA20 2024. Considering his past success at CSK, it is not a surprise if CSK goes back for him again in the IPL 2025 Mega Auctions.

At the moment, CSK needs an opener who can make the best use of the powerplay. Both Faf and Devon Conway combined well for TSK in MLC 2024. CSK will look to have both of them back again in the side. Faf is a CSK legend and it is best that he gets his farewell at this franchise as per the fans of CSK. It needs to be seen if this could happen, though.

Advertisement

2) Punjab Kings

Punjab Kings is one of the franchises which might target Faf du Plessis for IPL 2025 if he is released by RCB. It needs to be noted that Faf du Plessis is the skipper of St Lucia Kings in the CPL, a franchise which is also owned by the owners of Punjab Kings.

Plus, Faf is in great form and would provide a captaincy choice straightaway. The home venue for PBKS might also suit Faf’s style although it might not be perfect for him. Under him, the franchise can adopt a better structure and streamline their progress.
summary:
* Faf du Plessis, 40, is currently the best batter in the MLC 2024.
* He played well for the Texas Super Kings in MLC 2024 and was decent for the Joburg Super Kings in SA20 2024.
* Du Plessis' success in MLC 2024 could lead to interest from other franchises, including Chennai Super Kings and Punjab Kings, if he is released by Royal Challengers Bengaluru.
* Chennai Super Kings might be interested in re-signing du Plessis due to his past success with the franchise and his ability to pair well with Devon Conway, his opening partner for the Texas Super Kings.
* Punjab Kings might also target du Plessis due to his captaincy experience with St Lucia Kings in the CPL, which shares the same owners as Punjab Kings.

title: ROOT Sports and Willow by Cricbuzz Team Up to Air Seattle Orcas’ MLC Matches
body:
Story Highlights

Willow by Cricbuzz, offering more live, streaming and on-demand cricket than any other sports service, announces a strategic partnership with ROOT SPORTS, the television home of the Seattle Mariners, Portland Trail Blazers, Seattle Seahawks, Seattle Seawolves, and Gonzaga Bulldogs. Under this agreement, ROOT SPORTS will broadcast Major League Cricket (MLC) matches live, delivering high-octane cricket action to fans across the Pacific Northwest.

Starting July 5, 2024, cricket enthusiasts in the Pacific Northwest can tune into live broadcasts of electrifying MLC matches on ROOT SPORTS, the network delivering more than 330 live events each year across a five-state footprint that includes Washington, Oregon, Montana, Idaho, and Alaska. After a tremendous showing of support and engagement nationwide during the ICC T20 World Cup, this partnership will increase accessibility to the sport in the Pacific Northwest and help grow the game in America in unprecedented ways.

“ROOT SPORTS is an ideal partner to bring the exhilarating action of Major League Cricket to the Pacific Northwest,” says Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “The T20 World Cup sparked a tremendous surge in cricket enthusiasm across the nation, and through this partnership, we aim to harness that excitement to engage existing fans and create new ones. By providing unprecedented access to live cricket and bringing fans closer to the heart of the game, we look forward to making cricket a central part of the sports experience in the Pacific Northwest and inspiring a broader appreciation for the game.”

Willow by Cricbuzz will distribute all MLC matches this season on TV and its dedicated streaming app.

2024 MLC Matches on ROOT SPORTS:
summary:
* ROOT SPORTS has partnered with Willow by Cricbuzz to broadcast Major League Cricket (MLC) matches live in the Pacific Northwest region.
* The live broadcasts will start on July 5, 2024, and will be available to cricket enthusiasts in Washington, Oregon, Montana, Idaho, and Alaska.
* This partnership aims to increase accessibility to the sport in the Pacific Northwest and help grow the game in America.
* Willow by Cricbuzz will distribute all MLC matches this season on TV and its dedicated streaming app.

Note: There is no information in the article about the teams, schedules, or other details specific to the MLC tournament itself, only about the broadcasting partnership.

After his dismissal, San Francisco Unicorns simply surrendered to the phenomenal bowling performance by Texas Super Kings and they were bowled out for a small total of 127. title: Washington Freedom Edges Over Seattle Orcas by 5
body:
Ferguson and Netravalkar starred with the ball, while Milantha and Pineaar played a crucial part with the bat in Washington’s win.

Dallas, Texas (July 12,2024)- Washington Freedom edged out Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets in a low-score match in the Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on Thursday.

Lockie Furgueson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) took seven wickets in shred way to clear out Seattle Orcas on 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pineaar (31* off 30) then made a crucial partnership of 63 runs to guide Washington Freedom across their 125 run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this victory, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the table with 5 points from three matches, standing as the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

Seattle Orcas came out blazing to defend a low total of 125 runs. Imad Wasim dismissed Travis Head for a duck on the second ball of the innings, ending his over with a wicket and a maiden. Steve Smith and Rachin Ravindra then tried to rebuild the score with a counter attack, and they scored as many as 18 runs in the 3rd over. Ravindra was looking dangerous with his bat, but Nandre Burger dismissed him in the fifth over for 26 off 16 balls. Smith followed him back to pavilion in the over that followed with 12 off 13, leaving the Orcas at 47/3 after 6 overs.

Both Mukhtar Ahmed and Glenn Maxwell were given lifelines as both of their catches were dropped once, but they couldn’t make use of their second chances. Ahmed(8 off 8) was dismissed by Burger in 8th over, and Maxwell(10 off 11) fell to Harmeet, leaving their team struggling at 68/5 after 10 overs.

Despite the situation, Washington Freedom batters showed their agility as they carefully approached their target.

Earlier in the contest, Seattle Orcas had a slow start to their innings. The Seattle batters struggled to accelerate on the slow batting track, only getting 35 runs in the powerplay.

Heinrich Klaasen and Shubham Ranjane carefully made a crucial partnership that somewhat steadied Seattle’s innings. They crossed 100-run mark in the 15th over.

Meanwhile, Washington bowlers didn’t allow the batters to score big. Ferguson took 2 wickets in the 27th over, finishing his spell with 4 wickets, leaving Seattle struggling at 112/8 after 18 overs.

Seattle managed to get 9 runs in penultimate over. Cameron Gannon struck a six, but was dismissed on his second attempt as Ferguson caught him out. Netravakar then removed Nandre Burger, thus bowling out Orcas at 124 in 19.4 overs.
summary:
* The Washington Freedom team defeated the Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets in a low-scoring match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.
* Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) were the top performers with the ball, helping to restrict Seattle Orcas to 124 runs in 19.4 overs.
* Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pineaar (31* off 30) played a crucial role with the bat, guiding Washington Freedom to their target of 125 runs with 10 balls to spare.
* With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the table with 5 points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament so far.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom Edge Seattle Orcas by 5 Wickets in a Low-Scoring Thriller
body:
oi-Avinash Sharma

Dallas(TX), Jul 12: Washington Freedom clinched a nail-biting victory over the Seattle Orcas by five wickets in a low-scoring encounter of the Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, on Thursday (July 11).

Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) were the standout bowlers, sharing seven wickets to restrict the Seattle Orcas to 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pienaar (31* off 30) then anchored a crucial unbeaten 63-run partnership to guide Washington Freedom past their 125-run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the points table with five points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

Seattle Orcas Innings:

Seattle Orcas struggled from the start, with Nauman Anwar falling cheaply for 3 off 9 balls to Saurabh Netravalkar in the second over. The batters found it difficult to accelerate on a slow batting track, managing only 35 runs in the Powerplay. Ryan Rickelton was dismissed for 4 off 11 balls by Lockie Ferguson in the sixth over.

Quinton de Kock (24 off 19) started well but was bowled by Ferguson in the eighth over, leaving Seattle at 44/3. Heinrich Klaasen (51 off 29) tried to stabilize the innings with a half-century but was caught by Mukhtar Ahmed at long-off off Marco Jansen in the 15th over. Despite Klaasen's efforts, the rest of the batting lineup faltered, with Ferguson and Netravalkar dismantling the lower order.

Seattle Orcas were eventually bowled out for 124 in 19.4 overs, with Cameron Gannon's brief attempt to add runs falling short as he was dismissed for 8 off 5 balls.

Washington Freedom Innings

Chasing a modest total, Washington Freedom faced early setbacks. Imad Wasim removed Travis Head for a duck on the second ball, finishing the over with a wicket maiden. Steve Smith and Rachin Ravindra tried to rebuild with an aggressive approach, but Ravindra was dismissed by Nandre Burger for 26 off 16 balls in the fifth over, and Smith followed shortly after for 12 off 13 balls.

Mukhtar Ahmed and Glenn Maxwell were both given lifelines with dropped catches but couldn't capitalize. Ahmed fell for 8 off 8 balls, and Maxwell was dismissed for 10 off 11 balls, leaving Washington at 68/5 after 10 overs.

However, Milantha and Pienaar displayed resilience, carefully steering the innings towards the target. They brought Washington Freedom to the 100-run mark in the 16th over, eventually surpassing the target with an unbeaten 63-run partnership, ensuring a win with 10 balls remaining.

MLC 2024 Points Table Status after Washington Freedom win

With this victory, Washington Freedom climbed to the top of the points table, maintaining their unbeaten streak with five points from three matches.

Brief Scores:

Seattle Orcas: 124 all out in 19.4 overs (Heinrich Klaasen 51, Quinton de Kock 24; Lockie Ferguson 4/26)

Washington Freedom: 125/5 in 18.2 overs (Lahiru Milantha 33*, Obus Pienaar 31*; Nandre Burger 2/27).
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets in a low-scoring match at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Scores:** Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 124 in 19.4 overs, with Heinrich Klaasen top-scoring with 51. Washington Freedom chased down the target with 10 balls to spare, finishing at 125/5 in 18.2 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33*) and Obus Pienaar (31*) shared an unbeaten 63-run partnership to guide their team to victory.

**Standout Performers:** Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) were the standout bowlers for Washington Freedom, while Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar were the heroes with the bat.

**Points Table:** With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the points table with five points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament.

body:
LAS vs SF, MLC 2024: Dream11 Predictions for Match 10 [X]

The Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAS) will be playing against the San Francisco Unicorns (SF) in the 10th match of the Major League Cricket (MLC 2024). This match will be played at Church Street Park in Morrisville, United States, on July 14th at 12:30 AM IST.

Ahead of the game, here is a look at the Dream11 predictions, the pitch report, fantasy tips, the top player picks and the best-predicted XIs for the fantasy contests of the match.

LAS vs SF Head-to-Head Stats

The Los Angeles Knight Riders and the San Francisco Unicorns have played two matches against each other so far. Both the games have been won by the Unicorns.

LAS vs SF Pitch Report

The wicket at Chruch Street Park has looked good for batting. The batters have enjoyed the surface and have got full value for their shots. As for the bowlers, the pacers have had to rely on their cutters and variations in pace to be effective on this track. The spinners have also got some help from this wicket.

However, with the incessant rain that has been happening here for the past 24 hours or so, there might be a might of moisture on the wicket and in the air, helping the new ball bowlers at the start of the innings.

Church Street Park Ground Stats (MLC 2024)

Matches: 5

Matches won batting first: 0

Matches won batting second: 3

No Result or Abandoned: 2

Fantasy value from the pitch report

The pitch has been the best for batting in the first few overs when the ball is hard and coming on nicely to the bat. So, the top-order batters from both teams will be good picks for the game. Notably, the wicket has been easier to bat on in the second innings. So, keeping more batters from the team that is chasing could be a beneficial choice.

The spinners will be the best pick for this match. However, you can also back the faster bowlers who try to bowl into the wicket and mainly rely on the change of pace to deceive the batters.

LAS vs SF Fantasy Cricket Tips

Los Angeles Knight Riders Heavy Fantasy XI

Jason Roy, Unmukt Chand, and David Miller have been the inform batters for the Knight Riders. You can keep all three or at least two of these batters in your team if you are backing Los Angeles to win this game.

Spencer Johnson has been in a great rhythm with the ball in this tournament so far. He is currently the wicket-taker for his team and will be a must-pick for the game. Andre Russell and Sunil Narine have not yet proved themselves with the ball in this tournament. However, the wicket at Church Streek Park might suit them, and the West Indian duo can give you high points.

San Francisco Unicorns Heavy Fantasy XI

Matthew Short has been the man in for with the bat for the Unicorns. He has looked in supreme touch and will be one of the safest picks for the game. Finn Allen has also been in decent form and played a brilliant knock in the first game. Allen could also be a highly rewarding choice for the game.

Jake Fraser-McGurk has not yet found his rhythm with the bat in this tournament. However, the potential of this young Aussie batter is known to all, and he could be a decisive choice in the fantasy contests.

Brody Couch has looked good with the ball and will be one of the safer picks from the Unicorns' bowling. You can also keep Haris Rauf in your team, as his ability to hit the deck could prove to be beneficial on this track. However, the game changer in this game could be the young Paksitanin spinner, Abrar Ahmed.

LAS vs SF Winner Prediction

The wicket will favour the batters, and we can expect to see a match where both the teams will go past the 160 mark. In the games that have already taken place here in this edition of the MLC, we have seen that batting has got relatively easier in the second innings, and hence, the team chasing the target will have the advantage in the game.

LAS vs SF Top Player Picks

Unmukt Chand (LAS)

The Indian-origin US batter has looked in a decent touch with the bat. Although Unmukt Chand has not fired after the first game of the tournament, the form that he seems to be in makes him one of the safer choices from the Los Angeles batting line-up.

Spencer Johnson has been the best bowler for the Los Angeles in MLC 2024 [X]

Spencer Johnson (LAS)

The young Aussie speedster from this team looked the most impressive with the ball. Spencer Johnson has the most number of wickets in the tournament for his team and will be one of the better picks for the fantasy contests.

Matt Short (SF)

The Australian top order batter has been in prime touch and has looked ominous in both the games. Matt Short has the form and rhythm with him and will be looking to build on that on a track that will encourage his audacious stroke play.

Abrar Ahmed (SF)

Though this Pakistan leggie has not picked up wicket, he has looked impressive with the areas the he has bowled. On a pitch, that might provide a bit of assistance to the spinners, Abrar Ahmed could be a good choice for the game.

LAS vs SF Differential Picks

Andre Russell (LAS)

This Jamaican all-rounder has not yet been at his best in the tournament. But there is no questioning the match-winning abilities of Andre Russell with both the bat and the ball. If he gets a bit of rhythm going for himselft, Russell could prove to be a game-changing pick for the match.

Jake Fraser-McGurk has not yet fired in MLC 2024 [X]

This young Aussie batter is known for his explosive batting style. Though Jake Fraser-McGurk has not found form in this edition of the MLC so far, he could be a decisive choice for the fantasy contests if he starts finding the middle of the bat.

Wait for the toss and keep more top-order batters from the team that bats second. A 2-2-4-3 or a 1-2-3-5 combination could work well for the game.

title: despite nicholas pooran Cricket News
body:
MI New York: In a rain-marred third match of the ongoing Major League Cricket 2024 at the Church Street Park in Morrisville, Washington Freedom prevailed over MI New York by four runs via the DLS Method.

The match was a tightly contested one. In the second innings, Washington Freedom faced an early setback with the dismissal of Travis Head (1). Steve Smith initially took a couple of overs to settle in, but once he found his rhythm and struck his first boundary on his seventh ball, the New York bowlers struggled to contain him. The Australian star batter smashed four fours and three sixes, racing to an impressive 46* off 28 balls.

With 7.4 overs of the Washington Freedom innings done, the match took a turn for the worse as rain and lighting brought on the covers. However, Smith’s power-hitting in the final over of the powerplay took them ahead on DLS with a score of 55/1. In the end, that proved enough to seal the match as rain played spoilsport.

title: Latest Cricket News on Lahiru milantha on Cricketnmore
body:
Major League Cricket: Washington Freedom edged out Seattle Orcas by five wickets in a tense low-scoring match of the 2024 Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on Thursday.

Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) shared seven wickets between them to bundle out Seattle Orcas to 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pienaar (31* off 30) then anchored a crucial unbeaten 63-run partnership to guide Washington Freedom past their 125-run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the points table with five points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

title: MINY vs TSK Match Prediction Who Will Win Today’s Match 9 Major League Cricket 2024
body:
The Match 9 of the Major League Cricket 2024 will see the clash between MI New York and Texas Super Kings at the Church Street Park, Morrisville on Saturday, 13 July 2024. Keep reading to find out the MINY vs TSK Match Prediction Match 9 Major League Cricket 2024.

Match Preview

In the third match of the Major League Cricket series, MI New York batted first and set a target of 154/9 in their allotted 20 overs. Nicholas Pooran, showcasing his skill behind the stumps and with the bat, contributed a solid 44 runs off 30 balls. Rashid Khan added a quickfire 31 runs from just 15 deliveries, injecting momentum into the innings. Ruben Clinton played a steady hand with 28 runs off 22 balls, consolidating the middle order.

On the bowling front, Ehsan Adil bowled economically, conceding just 14 runs and taking a crucial wicket in his 2 overs. Trent Boult proved equally effective, restricting the scoring with an impressive spell that yielded only 3 runs in his 2 overs. Nosthush Kenjige maintained tight control, giving away a mere 3 runs in his 0.4 overs, adding pressure on the opposition.

In Match 7, the San Francisco Unicorns faced the Texas Super Kings and posted a total of 127 all out in 17.5 overs. In response, the Texas Super Kings chased down the target comfortably, reaching 128/3 in just 12.5 overs. Captain Faf du Plessis led from the front with a brisk 34 runs off 17 balls, setting the tone early in the innings. Aaron Hardie matched his captain’s tempo, contributing an identical 34 runs off 23 deliveries, ensuring a steady flow of runs.

Devon Conway, displaying his prowess behind the stumps and with the bat, played a pivotal role with 32 runs from 19 balls, guiding the innings towards victory. Mohammad Mohsin starred with the ball for the Texas Super Kings, dismantling the opposition with an impressive haul of 4 wickets for just 13 runs in 3.5 overs. Dwayne Bravo supported him well, claiming 2 wickets for 20 runs in his 3 overs. Zia-ul-Haq also contributed with 2 wickets, although conceding 41 runs in his 3 overs.

Both matches showcased thrilling performances, with MI New York and Texas Super Kings displaying their prowess in batting and bowling respectively, setting the stage for an exciting season ahead in Major League Cricket.

Team News

MI New York Team News:

The MI New York have delivered consistent performances throughout the tournament without any injury worries. Stay tuned for live updates and comprehensive coverage to catch all the exciting moments from their matches.

Texas Super Kings Team News:

The Texas Super Kings have shown strong form and outstanding performances throughout the tournament, free from any injury setbacks. Stay tuned for live updates to catch all the exciting moments from their matches.

The present form of teams

MI New York:

In their recent five matches, MI New York has shown a mixed performance. They started with a loss in their latest match, followed by a string of victories. Despite their recent setback, they displayed resilience with a series of wins, indicating strong form leading up to their upcoming fixtures. The team will aim to build on their earlier successes and address the areas that led to their recent defeat.

Texas Super Kings:

title: WATCH: Cameron Gannon cleans up Steve Smith during SO vs WF game in MLC 2024
body:
In a gripping encounter of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, the Seattle Orcas faced off against the Washington Freedom at a packed stadium. Washington Freedom emerged victorious, chasing down a target set by the Orcas with five wickets in hand.

Steve Smith looks visibly upset on his dismissal

The match witnessed a standout moment when Cameron Gannon, bowling for the Seattle Orcas, delivered a stunning blow to dismiss the renowned Steve Smith of Washington Freedom. Gannon’s delivery, clocking in at 135 kmph, landed on a perfect length angled towards the off-stump. Smith, known for his aggressive stroke play, charged down the pitch aiming to drive through the off-side.

However, Gannon’s deceptive movement caught Smith off-guard. The ball nipped back slightly, kissing the under edge of Smith’s bat before dislodging the off bail. The dismissal left Smith visibly frustrated as he departed the crease after contributing just 12 runs to his team’s chase.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Mitchell Santner hits a mammoth 106-metre six during SFU vs TSK match in MLC 2024

Washington Freedom gets the better of Seattle Orcas

Seattle Orcas, after being put into bat, struggled to build partnerships against a disciplined bowling attack from Washington Freedom. They managed to post a total of 124 all out in 19.4 overs, with Heinrich Klaasen‘s brisk 51 off 30 deliveries being the highlight of their innings. Lockie Ferguson was the chief tormentor for Washington Freedom, claiming impressive figures of 4/26, while Saurabh Netravalkar supported well with 3/18.

In response, Washington Freedom achieved the target comfortably in 18.2 overs, reaching 127/5. Lahiru Milantha anchored the innings with an unbeaten 33, supported by Obus Pienaar‘s crucial 31 not out. Their partnership ensured that Washington Freedom crossed the finish line without much trouble, securing a significant victory in the MLC 2024 season.

The match showcased thrilling moments of skill and strategy, reaffirming the competitive spirit of the exciting tournament. With more exciting clashes scheduled ahead, fans can expect further exhilarating action in the ongoing tournament.

* In response, Washington Freedom reached the target in 18.2 overs, with Lahiru Milantha scoring an unbeaten 33 and Obus Pienaar contributing 31 not out.

* The win is a significant one for Washington Freedom in the ongoing MLC 2024 season, and fans can expect more exciting clashes ahead in the tournament.

title: WATCH: 6,4,6- Rachin Ravindra turns the tide with explosive batting against Imad Wasim in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling encounter at the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, Washington Freedom emerged victorious against Seattle Orcas, thanks to an outstanding performance by Rachin Ravindra. The match held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas saw Washington Freedom successfully chase down Seattle Orcas’s target of 125 runs in the first inning.

Rachin Ravindra’s spectacular onslaught against Imad Wasim

Seattle Orcas, batting first, scored 124 runs before being bowled out. This set Washington Freedom’s target of 125 runs to achieve victory. Chasing the set total, the Washington side faced an early setback as Travis Head was dismissed in the very first over, leaving them at 6/1.

However, Ravindra’s entry into the game proved to be a turning point. Coming in to bat, Ravindra faced Wasim in the third over of the 2nd innings.

Ravindra hammered 17 runs off Wasim in a single over, comprising two sixes and a four. This onslaught boosted Washington Freedom’s run rate and rattled the opposition. Wasim, who had earlier taken the wicket of Head in his first spell, struggled against Ravindra’s aggressive batting. Despite finishing his 4-over spell with a total of 31 runs, Wasim’s over to Ravindra stood out for its impact on the match.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Cameron Gannon cleans up Steve Smith during SO vs WF game in MLC 2024

Rachin Ravindra’s dominance secures Washington Freedom’s convincing victory

Ravindra’s innings was pivotal as he went on to score 26 runs off just 16 balls at a striking rate of 162.50, including three fours and two sixes. Both of his sixes came off Wasim’s bowling in that memorable over, showcasing his dominance over the experienced bowler. In the end, Washington Freedom comfortably reached the finish line in the 19th over , finishing with a score of 127 for the loss of 5 wickets. This comprehensive victory underscored Washington Freedom’s dominance and resilience throughout the match.

* In the MLC 2024, Washington Freedom defeated Seattle Orcas at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.
* Seattle Orcas scored 124 runs in the first inning before being bowled out, setting a target of 125 runs for Washington Freedom.
* Washington Freedom successfully chased down the target, thanks to an outstanding performance by Rachin Ravindra.
* Ravindra scored 26 runs off 16 balls, including three fours and two sixes, at a striking rate of 162.50.
* His innings included a memorable over against Imad Wasim, in which he scored 17 runs with two sixes and a four.
* Washington Freedom comfortably reached the target in the 19th over, finishing with a score of 127 for 5 wickets.

Overall, the summary highlights the key moments and performances that led to Washington Freedom's convincing victory over Seattle Orcas in the MLC 2024 tournament.
