title: Du Plessis, Stoinis Shine In Texas Super Kings' Win Over MI New York
body:
Texas Super Kings: Texas Super Kings (TSK) registered a 15-run win over MI New York (MINY) despite a spirited fightback from Rashid Khan and Monank Patel during their Major League Cricket fixture at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

Chasing 177 for the win, MI New York faced early setbacks courtesy of Marcus Stoinis’ bowling onslaught. They lost three wickets in quick succession, including that of the dangerous Nicholas Pooran (1), inside the powerplay. The situation worsened when skipper Kieron Pollard (5) fell cheaply, leaving MINY at 52/5 in 11.2 overs.

At this stage, the match appeared firmly in Texas Super Kings's grasp. However, Rashid (50) walked out to the middle and injected much-needed energy into the innings. His aggressive approach stabilised the innings and brought out the best in Monank (61). The pair found boundaries at regular intervals, turning the tide on Texas Super Kings.

Trending

The duo held on to a 97-run stand for the 6th wicket, giving MI New York a glimmer of hope. However, Dwayne Bravo's experience came to the fore. In the crucial penultimate over, he conceded just 8 runs, which effectively sealed the game for the Texas Super Kings. Despite the late scare, Texas Super Kings managed to hold their nerve and secure a 15-run win.

Earlier, Faf du Plessis took full advantage of the powerplay, smashing the MI New York bowlers across the field. His aggressive approach paid off with a quickfire fifty, setting a strong foundation for the Super Kings as they ended up scoring 176/6.

The breakthrough for MI New York came in the 9th over when left-arm spinner Nosthush Kenjige was introduced into the attack. Despite being expensive, Kenjige managed to dismiss du Plessis, who was caught at long-on by Tim David while attempting another big hit, having scored 61 in 38 balls.

New Zealand’s Devon Conway provided valuable support with a handy knock before Faf’s dismissal, but he fell short of his fifty, getting dismissed for 40 by Ehsan Adil in the 14th over. The Super Kings then faced a mini-collapse, losing key wickets. Then, Marcus Stoinis stepped up towards the end with some lusty blows, propelling the Super Kings past the 175-run mark.

The breakthrough for MI New York came in the 9th over when left-arm spinner Nosthush Kenjige was introduced into the attack. Despite being expensive, Kenjige managed to dismiss du Plessis, who was caught at long-on by Tim David while attempting another big hit, having scored 61 in 38 balls.

title: WF vs LAKR Match Prediction Who Will Win Today’s Match 11 Major League Cricket 2024
body:
Match 11 of the Major League Cricket 2024 will see the clash between Washington Freedom and Los Angeles Knight Riders on Monday, 15 July 2024, at Church Street Park, Morrisville. Keep reading to find out the WF vs LAKR Match Prediction for Match 11 of the Major League Cricket 2024.

Washington Freedom vs Los Angeles Knight Riders (WF vs LAKR) Match 11 Match Preview

In the 8th encounter of the Major League Cricket series, the Seattle Orcas faced a daunting challenge against the Washington Freedom. Opting to bat first, the Orcas struggled to find their rhythm and were eventually bowled out for 124 runs in 19.4 overs. Washington Freedom, in response, displayed a disciplined batting performance, successfully chasing down the target of 125 runs with 7 balls to spare. Lahiru Milantha anchored the innings with a composed 33 off 30 balls, while Obus Pienaar contributed a steady 31 off 30 deliveries. Rachin Ravindra’s brisk 26 off just 16 balls added impetus to their chase, ensuring they secured victory by 5 wickets.

On the bowling front, Lockie Ferguson emerged as the standout performer for Washington Freedom, wreaking havoc with figures of 4 for 26 in his spell of 4 overs. His fiery pace and accuracy troubled the Orcas’ batting lineup throughout. Saurabh Netravalkar complemented Ferguson’s efforts with a disciplined display, claiming 3 crucial wickets for 18 runs in 3.4 overs. Marco Jansen also contributed to restricting the Orcas, picking up 1 wicket for 28 runs in his allotted 4 overs.

In stark contrast, the 10th match scheduled between the Los Angeles Knight Riders and the San Francisco Unicorns ended in disappointment due to unforeseen circumstances. Despite extensive preparations and anticipation from both sides, the game was abandoned without a single ball being bowled. This decision, made with player safety as the top priority, left fans and teams equally disheartened. Nevertheless, the focus now shifts to future fixtures as both teams regroup and prepare to bounce back with renewed vigor.

As the Major League Cricket series progresses, the Washington Freedom’s clinical win and the unfortunate abandonment highlight the unpredictable nature of the sport. Each match brings its own narrative, blending moments of triumph and challenges, adding to the excitement and unpredictability that cricket aficionados cherish.

Los Angeles Knight Riders Team News:

Washington Freedom:

Washington Freedom has shown a fluctuating form in their recent five matches. They secured victories in their two most recent outings, showcasing resilience and strategic prowess. However, prior to these wins, they faced consecutive defeats, highlighting vulnerabilities that they later managed to address effectively. The team’s ability to bounce back from losses is evident in their consistent performance, culminating in a positive trend with a recent win.

Los Angeles Knight Riders:

title: Pat Cummins Set To Play For San Francisco Unicorns In The Middle Of MLC
body:
The Major League Cricket 2024 is going on in the USA, with popular players from different nations joining in the play. The tournament started on 5 July, 2024, the day after USA celebrated its independence and will go on until 28 July. While the season is midway, Australia‘s star cricketer Pat Cummins is set to join San Francisco Unicorns in MLC.

Cummins signed a four-year deal with the franchise. The 31-year-old has mainly played in the IPL among overseas T20 leagues and has been absent from Australia’s Big Bash League since the 2018–19 season due to his international commitments.

Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns midway during the MLC

Pat Cummins is set to return to the USA for the MLC 2024. Cummins played the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 in the USA and West Indies for Australia. Cummins’ arrival comes as Sherfane Rutherford departs. The hard-hitting West Indies allrounder, who has not participated in any of the Unicorns’ matches this season, will miss the rest of the Major League Cricket (MLC) due to a bereavement in his family.

This change marks a significant shift for the team, which hopes Cummins will fill the gap left by Rutherford’s absence.

Other teams in the MLC are also experiencing roster changes. Ottneil Baartman will replace Gerald Coetzee in the Texas Super Kings. Gerald is sidelined due to an injury.

Baartman’s inclusion is to bolster the team’s bowling attack as they navigate through the remainder of the season. Coetzee’s injury has been a setback, but the team is optimistic about Baartman’s potential contributions.

Similarly, the Seattle Orcas have made a key substitution, with Lungi Ngidi taking over from Wayne Parnell, who withdrew from the tournament.

Ngidi’s addition is a strategic move to strengthen the Orcas’ lineup. Parnell’s withdrawal required a swift response, and the team believes Ngidi’s experience and skills will be crucial in maintaining their competitive edge as they advance in the MLC.

San Francisco Unicorns look for a fate change

Pat Cummins’ arrival in the team is expected to mark the comeback for the San Francisco Unicorns. The Unicorns have won just one of their three games this year, and they will benefit greatly from the addition of Cummins.

Known for his impressive performances, Cummins made history by securing back-to-back hat-tricks at the T20 World Cup. Before that, he led Sunrisers Hyderabad to the IPL final.

His experience and skill will help provide a much-needed boost to the team. Sun Risers Hyderabad got to the IPL 2024 finals but lost the season to Kolkata Knight Riders.

Cummins brings a wealth of experience, having played 151 T20 matches and taken 172 wickets with an average of 26.66 and an economy rate of 8.11.

His consistent performance in T20 cricket makes him a valuable asset for the Unicorns. The team hopes his presence will enhance their bowling attack and improve their standings as the season progresses.
summary:
* The MLC 2024 tournament is currently underway in the USA, running from July 5 to July 28.
* Australia's star cricketer Pat Cummins has signed a four-year deal with the San Francisco Unicorns and will join the team midway through the tournament.
* Cummins' arrival comes as Sherfane Rutherford departs due to a bereavement in his family, and the team hopes Cummins will fill the gap left by Rutherford's absence.
* Other teams in the MLC are also experiencing roster changes, with Ottneil Baartman replacing Gerald Coetzee in the Texas Super Kings due to an injury, and Lungi Ngidi taking over from Wayne Parnell in the Seattle Orcas.
* The San Francisco Unicorns, who have won only one of their three games this year, are expecting a turnaround with Cummins' arrival, given his impressive T20 cricket record of 151 matches, 172 wickets, and an economy rate of 8.11.
* The team hopes Cummins' experience and skill will enhance their bowling attack and improve their standings as the season progresses.

title: Watch - Travis Head's stunning reaction after his broken bat goes flying in the air to the square leg umpire in MLC 2024
body:
Dashing Australian opener Travis Head is currently playing for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. The batter gave a stunning reaction during his team's match against Los Angeles Knight Riders at Morrisville on July 14.

During the second over of Washington Freedom's innings, a rare incident happened when his bat got broken into two pieces. In the fifth ball of the second over, fast bowler Andre Russell hit the pitch hard and bowled a short of a good length ball on Head's body from over the wicket.

The ball bounced towards Head who tried to pull it hard off the backfoot. The ball hit the upper half of his bat as Head was beaten for pace. The bat broke into two pieces and it flew towards the square leg umpire as the handle remained in the hands of Travis Head. Head's reaction after the ball connected the bat was a stunning one as the ball was fielded by the fielder at midwicket.

Also read: "It's a tough place to be Sanju Samson in Indian cricket"- Former Indian batsman

Watch - Travis Head's stunning reaction after his broken bat goes flying in the air

Travis Head had a good day with the bat following the incident. He top-scored in the match with 54 off 32 balls, which included 2 fours and 6 sixes. He stitched a partnership of 79 runs for the first wicket with captain and his Aussie teammate Steve Smith, who remained unbeaten on 42 off 36 balls.

Head was dismissed in the ninth over of the innings but he had already done his job by then. Washington Freedom chased down the modest target of 130 runs with four overs to spare and 8 wickets in hand. Smith and Andres Gous remained not out till the end for Washington.

Saurabh Netravalkar and Glenn Maxwell shine for Washington Freedom

Earlier, Washington Freedom won the toss and elected to field first on a tricky pitch. Washington's bowlers bowled beautifully and used the conditions well. Left-arm seamer Saurabh Netravalkar continued his stunning form from the T20 World Cup 2024 as he showed his skills with the new ball to pick up two early to restrict Los Angeles Knight Riders to 18-4 in 4.2 overs.

There was a brief partnership between Saif Badar and Nitish Kumar for the fifth wicket but Knight Riders' innings could not get going at any time. Saif Badar top-scored for the team with 35 off 28 balls, which included 1 four and 3 sixes. Andre Russell looked good for a big one but was dismissed for 20 off 12 balls by Glenn Maxwell.

Saurabh Netravalkar picked up 4-35 in 3.4 overs while off-spinner Glenn Maxwell picked up 3-15 in four overs. Maxwell was adjudged Player of the Match for his brilliant bowling performance.

title: WATCH: Steve Smith smashes Andre Russell for a massive six out of the park in MLC 2024
body:
Washington Freedom captain Steve Smith delivered a memorable performance in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, smashing a colossal six off Los Angeles Knight Riders’ Andre Russell at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Monday (July 15).

Steve Smith’s spectacular six against Andre Russell

On the final delivery of the fourth over of the Freedom innings, Smith showcased his immense power by launching a spectacular 94-meter six. The ball soared high and handsome, clearing the park effortlessly during Freedom’s run chase. Facing a back-of-a-length delivery from Russell, Smith unleashed a powerful shot over deep mid-wicket, thrilling the crowd as the ball rocketed into the stands.

Here’s the video:

Also WATCH: Steve Smith grabs a screamer off Glenn Maxwell’s bowling in WF vs LAKR game at MLC 2024

Smith’s unbeaten knock and Travis Head’s crucial contribution

Smith remained unbeaten on 42 runs off 36 balls, showcasing his mastery with the bat. His composed yet aggressive innings featured two sixes and two boundaries. His clinical batting, coupled with Travis Head‘s explosive knock, ensured Freedom’s comfortable victory by eight wickets. Head played a pivotal role in the chase, scoring a blistering 54 runs off just 32 deliveries. His knock was laced with six massive sixes and two boundaries.

Los Angles Knight Riders’ struggle with bat

The Sunil Narine-led Knight Riders were bundled out for 129 in 18.4 overs, struggling to build partnerships. Saif Badar top-scored with 35 off 28 balls, while Russell (20 off 12) and Spencer Johnson (16 off 9) made useful contributions. Freedom’s bowlers excelled, with Saurabh Netravalkar taking 4/35 and Glenn Maxwell and Lockie Ferguson claiming three and two wickets respectively, stifling Knight Riders’ batting lineup.

MLC 2024 points table position

With this victory, Freedom solidified their top position in the MLC 2024 points table. The Smith-led side boasts three wins from four games, along with a no-result against Texas Super Kings. In contrast, the Knight Riders are struggling, positioned fifth in the six-team tournament with only one win from their first five games.

title: WATCH: Steve Smith grabs a screamer off Glenn Maxwell’s bowling in WF vs LAKR game at MLC 2024
body:
Washington Freedom extended their unbeaten run in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 with a comprehensive eight wicket victory over Los Angeles Knight Riders in Morrisville. Opting to bowl first on a slow pitch, Freedom’s bowlers capitalized on the conditions, restricting Knight Riders to a modest total of 129.

The decision to bowl first proved to be a masterstroke, as the pitch offered just enough assistance to keep the Knight Riders batters in check, leading to a comfortable chase for Freedom.

Saurabh Netravalkar’s bowling masterclass

Saurabh Netravalkar, who had been a standout performer in the recent T20 World Cup, showcased his prowess with a phenomenal spell, returning figures of 4/35. He struck twice in his opening over, removing Sunil Narine with a perfect full length delivery that knocked over his stumps and Unmukt Chand with a short pitched ball.

By the fifth over, Knight Riders were reeling at 18/4, with Jason Roy and Shakib Al Hasan also back in the pavilion. Roy was caught at deep midwicket trying to clear the boundary, while Shakib was bowled through the gate by a beautifully disguised slower ball. Saif Badar attempted to stabilize the innings with a cautious 35, playing some elegant shots and rotating the strike effectively. However, his dismissal – trapped LBW by a skidding delivery from Rachin Ravindra – triggered another collapse.

Also READ: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Complete squads of all six teams

Steve Smith’s remarkable catch off Glenn Maxwell’s bowling

Glenn Maxwell then tightened the screws with his accurate off-spin, finishing with figures of 3/15. His spell included the crucial wicket of Andre Russell, who looked dangerous during his brief stay at the crease. Russell, trying to accelerate the scoring, was caught at long-on, failing to clear the boundary. And then, Steve Smith‘s exceptional fielding claimed the wicket of Nitish Kumar.

On the third ball of the eleventh over, Maxwell bowled a delivery pitched on a length at middle stump. Nitish attempted to clear the ropes but failed to achieve the desired elevation. The ball went towards short mid-wicket, where Smith timed his jump perfectly and took a stunning airborne catch.

Here’s the video:

Powerful batting seals the win for Washington Freedom

After that Lockie Ferguson added to the pressure with his express pace, taking two wickets in quick succession, ensuring that LAKR folded with eight balls left in their innings.

In the chase, Travis Head and captain Smith provided a solid start, amassing 61 runs in the powerplay. Head was particularly aggressive, scoring 40 off just 23 balls, smashing six sixes in his 32-ball 54. Despite his dismissal, which led to a slight dip in the scoring rate, Smith anchored the innings with an unbeaten 42. His composed knock ensured that Freedom chased down the target comfortably, with eight wickets and four overs to spare, maintaining their perfect start to the season.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders by 8 wickets in Morrisville.

**First Innings:** Los Angeles Knight Riders were bowled out for 129 runs, thanks to a brilliant bowling performance by Washington Freedom. Saurabh Netravalkar took 4/35, Glenn Maxwell took 3/15, and Lockie Ferguson took 2 wickets.

**Key Performances:** Saif Badar top-scored for Knight Riders with 35 runs. Steve Smith took a remarkable catch off Glenn Maxwell's bowling to dismiss Nitish Kumar.

**Second Innings:** Washington Freedom chased down the target comfortably, with Travis Head scoring 54 off 32 balls and Steve Smith scoring an unbeaten 42. Freedom won with 8 wickets and 4 overs to spare.

**Tournament Update:** Washington Freedom extended their unbeaten run in MLC 2024, maintaining their perfect start to the season.

title: Watch: 'Flying' Steve Smith takes stunning diving catch to send back Nitish Kumar in MLC 2024
body:
Australia superstar Steve Smith is currently plying his trade for Washington Freedom in the ongoing second season of the Major League Cricket (MLC).

The tournament marked his return to competitive cricket as a player after a long time. Steve Smith had not played a competitive game since the Christchurch Test against New Zealand in March. He did not play in the IPL as he was not picked up by any franchise in the auction but he did ply his trade as a commentator. The right-handed batsman was also not a part of Australia's squad for the T20 World Cup last month.

He finally returned to action earlier this month in the ongoing MLC 2024. The former Australia skipper has looked in good touch with the bat so far. And on Sunday (July 14), he once again showed that he is still one of the sharpest fielders in the game as he pulled off a stunning catch during the game between Washington Freedom and Los Angeles Knight Riders.

On the second ball of the 11th over, Glenn Maxwell bowled a flighted delivery on the pads to Nitish Kumar and the Knight Riders batter decided to hit the ball through the mid-wicket area. However, the USA batter failed to keep his shot down and paid a price for it as Steve Smith came up with a brilliant effort to catch the ball and send him back.

Watch the catch from Steve Smith:

Talking about the game, Washington Freedom thrashed the Knight Riders by 8 wickets. Asked to bat first, the Knight Riders were bowled out for just 129 runs. At one stage, they were reeling at 89 for 8 before the lower-order players guided them to a respectable total.
summary:
* The article reports on Steve Smith's return to competitive cricket with Washington Freedom in the ongoing MLC 2024.
* Smith, the former Australia captain, has been in good form with the bat and also took a stunning catch during a game against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* The catch was off a delivery by Glenn Maxwell and helped Washington Freedom restrict the Knight Riders to 129 runs, which they eventually chased down with 8 wickets in hand.
* Washington Freedom won the game comfortably, with the Knight Riders struggling at 89 for 8 at one stage before the lower-order batsmen added some runs.

Overall, the article focuses on Steve Smith's impressive performance in the MLC, marking his return to competitive cricket after a long break.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom Aiming to Extend Unbeaten Streak Against Los Angeles Knight Riders
body:
Table-toppers Washington Freedom face the Los Angeles Knight Riders in their fourth match of Major League Cricket 2024 at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, on Sunday.

Our match against LAKR on July 14 is scheduled to start at 3:30 PM ET (July 15, 1:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch via LIVE streaming and broadcast.

We are unbeaten in MLC 2024 and currently sit at the top of the points table with five points from three games.

We beat the Seattle Orcas by five wickets in our last match in Dallas on Thursday. Lockie Ferguson was the star of the match with a four-wicket haul. Saurabh Netravalkar also supported well with three wickets as we restricted SO to a modest total before chasing it down.

WF vs LAKR form in MLC

Washington Freedom have won two of their last five matches in the MLC coming into this game. We emerged victorious by six wickets in our last match against LAKR, the only match against them, in the MLC 2023.

WF vs LAKR, MLC 2024: Players to watch out

Ferguson was clinical with the ball against the Seattle Orcas in our last match, picking up crucial wickets at the start of the innings to put the brakes on their runs. He picked up 4/26 in four overs to restrict the SO, bowling a total of 12 dot balls and conceding just 10 runs in boundaries.

Netravalkar continued his ominous form this season, getting his second three-wicket haul in three matches. With 3/18 in the last match, he moved to the top of the bowling charts of MLC 2024.

The left-arm seamer has eight wickets from three matches so far this season at an average of 9.37 and a strike rate of 8.75.

The middle-order duo of Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar took us out from a slippery position with an unbeaten sixth-wicket partnership to see us home in a tricky chase against the SO. The wicketkeeper-batter Milantha top-scored for us with 33 from 30 balls whereas Pienaar gave him company with a 30-ball 31.

Coming to our game against LAKR last year, Marco Jansen had played a key role with the ball picking up 2/29 in his spell before Andries Gous hit a quickfire 40 off just 15 balls to power us during the chase.

Washington Freedom squad: Steven Smith (c), Akhilesh Reddy, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra, Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Where to watch WF vs LAKR MLC 2024 LIVE

LIVE telecast and streaming of the Washington Freedom vs Los Angeles Knight Riders match will be available on Monumental Sports Network and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA. The match will start at 3:30 PM ET on July 14.

The WF vs LAKR match will be streamed LIVE on the Jio Cinema App and website in India starting at 01:00 AM IST on July 15.

title: Cricket Takes Center Stage in the Bay Area as Willow by Cricbuzz and NBC Sports Bay Area & NBC Sports California Partner To Present Major League Cricket
body:
Let's Get Started

NBC Sports Bay Area & NBC Sports California to Televise Five Live San Francisco Unicorns MLC Matches to Fans Starting July 10

Willow by Cricbuzz, offering more live, streaming and on-demand cricket than any other sports service, today announced a partnership with NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California, to present five live San Francisco Unicorns Major League Cricket (MLC) matches this season.

Starting tomorrow, Wednesday, July 10, fans in Northern California can enjoy live coverage of high-octane MLC matches featuring the San Francisco Unicorns on NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California. The networks, which already televise over 600 live events annually, will enhance their diverse sports programming by including these high-energy cricket matches, catering to the growing appetite for cricket in the region.

“NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California are perfect platforms to showcase the San Francisco Unicorns’ Major League Cricket matches,” said Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “The unforgettable run by USA Cricket in the T20 World Cup ignited a nationwide cricket fandom, and we’re ready to keep that flame burning. Fans can now watch their World Cup heroes play for their hometown team. This partnership will bring these electrifying matches directly to fans, attracting new audiences and further integrating cricket into the Northern Californian sports scene.”

“We are the home for Northern California sports and the Unicorns, along with their Major League Cricket opponents, deliver unique and exciting content for our viewers and partners,” said Ben Rodrigues, Senior Director of Multiplatform Programming for NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California. “We’re pleased to partner with the Unicorns to build on our already robust portfolio of live sports content and further our position as the top source of live sports in the Bay Area and beyond.”

Willow by Cricbuzz will distribute all MLC matches this season on TV and its dedicated streaming app. To learn more, please visit www.willow.tv.

2024 San Francisco Unicorns on NBC Sports Bay Area & NBC Sports California:

Wednesday, July 10: Unicorns vs. Texas Super Kings at 12 PM PT – NBC Sports Bay Area

Saturday, July 13: Los Angeles vs. Unicorns at 12 PM PT – NBC Sports Bay Area

Monday, July 15: Orcas vs. Unicorns at 12 PM PT – NBC Sports Bay Area

Thursday, July 18: MI New York vs. Unicorns at 5:30 PM PT – NBC Sports Bay Area

Saturday, July 20: Unicorns vs. Orcas at 5:30 PM PT – NBC Sports California

Monday, July 22: Unicorns vs. Washington Freedom at 5:30 PM PT – NBC Sports Bay Area Plus

About Willow by Cricbuzz

Willow by Cricbuzz is the premier destination for cricket in the United States and Canada, boasting the most comprehensive live, streaming, and on-demand cricket coverage available. Guided by its mission to make cricket globally accessible, Willow by Cricbuzz combines cricket’s rich heritage with innovative broadcasting to offer an unmatched viewing experience.

Dedicated to excellence and innovation, Willow by Cricbuzz provides cricket enthusiasts with HD-quality live streaming, interactive scorecards, and extensive coverage from nearly every major cricket board and tournament worldwide.

Willow by Cricbuzz’s TV network is also available through top providers such as DISH, Sling, Fios, Spectrum, Xfinity, Optimum, DIRECTV, DIRECTV Stream, and FuboTV, and also offers a dedicated streaming app available on all major CTV devices, including Apple TV, Roku, Samsung Smart TVs, Amazon Fire TV, Xbox One, Android TV, Chromecast, Google TV, and more, ensuring fans never miss a moment of the action.

Explore the ultimate cricket experience at www.willow.tv.

About Cricbuzz

Cricbuzz is the global leader in cricket content, accessible across the web, iOS, and Android platforms on mobile and connected TV. Offering 360-degree comprehensive cricket coverage, Cricbuzz delivers ball-by-ball text commentary, compelling video analysis by the best cricket experts worldwide, timely news, match reports, editorials, statistics, rankings, and live match streaming in several regions. With over 125 million monthly active users globally and more than 495 million downloads as of January 2024, Cricbuzz is the largest single sport app in the world.

About NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California

NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California, both part of NBC Sports Regional Networks, serve more than four million households in Northern California, Nevada, Southern Oregon, and Hawaii. NBC Sports Bay Area, the television home of MLB’s San Francisco Giants, NBA’s Golden State Warriors and NBA G-League’s Santa Cruz Warriors, and the official regional sports network of the San Francisco 49ers, also features a robust lineup of Emmy Award-winning news, analysis, and original programming. NBC Sports California offers live coverage of MLB’s Oakland Athletics, NBA’s Sacramento Kings, NHL’s San Jose Sharks and NWSL’s Bay FC. Collectively, these networks deliver more than 600 live game broadcasts per year. The NBC Sports app provides live steams of the games and pre-and postgame shows, digital coverage of the hometown teams with original stories and content from a team of “Insiders,” breaking news, up-to-the-minute game previews/recaps, highlights, and multimedia video clips. Follow both networks on social media –Twitter: @NBCSAuthentic; Instagram: NBCSAuthentic; and Facebook: facebook.com/NBCSAuthentic.
summary:
* NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California have partnered with Willow by Cricbuzz to broadcast five live San Francisco Unicorns MLC matches starting July 10.
* The matches will be televised to fans in Northern California, catering to the growing interest in cricket in the region.
* The Unicorns' MLC matches will be part of the networks' diverse sports programming, which already includes over 600 live events annually.

About the event Minor League Cricket - Seattle Orcas vs. San Francisco Unicorns

After two years of Minor League Cricket, Major League Cricket — the most high-profile professional cricket league in US history — is ready to launch this July. Overall, fan interest, both here and internationally, is uniformly high as cricket fans around the world want to see if the US can become a serious player in the franchise T20 world. Oddly, one area where folks here are showing the most concern has pretty much nothing to do with what happens out on the pitch. A lot of controversy has popped up over some of the names of the six teams that will compete in the league’s inaugural season…especially those teams connected to Indian Premier League ownership. While most fans have no trouble with the Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, or Seattle Orcas, there’s been criticism of how MI NY, Texas Super Kings, and Los Angeles Knight Riders ownership didn’t do their part in trying to lure in local fans with their team names and marketing. title: Andre Russell’s Delivery Breaks Bat, But Travis Head Leads Washington Freedom to Victory
body:
During the Major League Cricket match between the Los Angeles Knight Riders and Washington Freedom at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Sunday, Andre Russell delivered a powerful ball that struck Travis Head’s bat with such force it broke the bat in two. Despite this, Head showed incredible resilience, continuing his impressive performance to score 54 runs off just 32 balls, hitting 2 fours and 6 sixes.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders, having been sent in to bat by Washington Freedom’s captain Steve Smith, managed to score only 129 runs in 18.4 overs. This was largely due to superb bowling by Saurabh Netravalkar, who took 4 wickets for 35 runs, and Glenn Maxwell, who took 3 wickets for 15 runs.

While chasing the target of 130 runs, Washington Freedom’s openers Head and Smith provided a strong start with a partnership of 79 runs, making the run-chase easy. However, in the second over of their innings, Russell bowled a fast, short-pitched delivery that broke Head’s bat into two pieces as he attempted a pull shot. The ball hit the upper part of the bat, leaving Head with just the handle while the rest of the bat flew towards mid-wicket.

This unexpected incident left Head visibly surprised, and his reaction went viral on social media. Nonetheless, Head went on to score 54 runs off 32 balls, helping Washington Freedom secure a magnificent eight-wicket win.

After the match, Head commented, “The pitch was on the slower side and took more spin than previous games. It was nice to get a few good shots and secure a win. It felt great to play the entire match and get some luck. The crowd’s energy was amazing, and it helped us maximize our performance when Smithy and I were batting. I’m looking forward to the rest of the tournament.”

Major League Cricket Teams

Ready to dive into the action with the best Major League Cricket betting sites? Here, we give the lowdown on all the MLC 2024 teams, including their strengths and weaknesses, to enable you to place more informed bets on the tournament. Importantly, to stay abreast of the latest news and team updates, check out this space on ESPNcricinfo.

1. MI New York

Captain: Kieron Pollard

Overseas players: Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran and Romario Shepherd (West Indies), Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis and Anrich Nortje (South Africa), Tim David (Australia), Rashid Khan (Afghanistan), Trent Boult (New Zealand)

2023 Standing: Champion

2023 Highest runscorer: Nicholas Pooran (388)

2023 Highest wicket-taker: Trent Boult (22)

Key players: Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, Rashid Khan

Team analysis: The defending champions have the most balanced squad on paper, which consists of several hard hitters, quality pacers, and a spin wizard in Rashid Khan. They have retained most of their core squad from last season and have also roped in USA national team captain Monank Patel. They are the frontrunners to retain the trophy for the second successive season.

2. Los Angeles Knight Riders

Captain: Sunil Narine

Overseas players: Spencer Johnson and Alex Carry (Australia), Jason Roy (England), Sunil Narine and Andre Russell (West Indies), Shakib Al Hasan (Bangladesh), Waqar Salamkheil (Afghanistan), Joshua Little (Ireland), David Miller (South Africa)

2023 Standing: Last

2023 Highest runscorer: Andre Russell (206)

2023 Highest wicket-taker: Adam Zampa (9)

Key players: Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Ali Khan

Team analysis: They had a disappointing season last year, finishing at the bottom of the table and winning only one match. This year, however, they have made some good signings. Most of their overseas players are in great form, with many of them winning T20 leagues around the world. With a perfect combination of aggressive batters, all-rounders, and domestic talent, they have a great chance of turning things around and becoming the Major League Cricket champions in 2024.

3. Washington Freedom

Captain: Steve Smith

Overseas players: Marco Jansen (South Africa), Lockie Ferguson and Rachin Ravindra (New Zealand), Akeal Hosein (West Indies),

Steve Smith, Jack Edwards, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head and Andrew Tye (Australia)

2023 Standing: 3rd

2023 Highest runscorer: Matthew Short (152)

2023 Highest wicket-taker: Saurabh Netravalkar (10)

Key players: Saurabh Netravalkar, Akeal Hosein, Travis Head

Team analysis: Washington Freedom came in third last season, losing to MI New York in the eliminator. In a total revamp, they have filled their squad with bona fide T20 stars, including as many as five Australians who can destroy any opponent on a given day. With the induction of Lockie Ferguson, Andrew Tye, and Akeal Hosein, they have also bolstered their bowling lineup. Importantly, they also have an excellent domestic crop of players.

4. San Francisco Unicorns

Captain: Corey Anderson

Overseas players: Finn Allen and Matt Henry (New Zealand), Haris Rauf and Abrar Ahmed (Pakistan), Sherfane Rutherford (West Indies), Matthew Short, Josh Inglis, Pat Cummins and Jake Fraser-McGurk (Australia)

2023 Standing: 5th

2023 Highest runscorer: Corey Anderson (190)

2023 Highest wicket-taker: Liam Plunkett (7)

Key players: Jake Fraser-McGurk, Sherfane Rutherford, Pat Cummins

Team analysis: Having finished fifth last season, the San Francisco Unicorns have made some sweeping changes to their overseas roster. They have got all their bases covered this season, signing aggressive openers, excellent middle-order batters, and T20 specialist pacers in their ranks. However, when it comes to their domestic recruits, the team does look slightly weak on paper.

5. Texas Super Kings

Captain: Faf du Plessis

Overseas players: Faf du Plessis and Aiden Markram (South Africa), Dwayne Bravo (West Indies), Devon Conway and Mitchell Santner (New Zealand), Noor Ahmad and Naveen ul Haq (Afghanistan), Marcus Stoinis (Australia), Matheesha Pathirana (Sri Lanka)

2023 Standing: 2nd

2023 Highest runscorer: Devon Conway (221)

2023 Highest wicket-taker: Mohammad Mohsin (9)

Key players: Mohammad Mohsin, Marcus Stoinis, Faf du Plessis

Team analysis: A star-studded side with quality players, the Texas Super Kings came in second in the group stage last year, eventually losing to MI New York in the challenger. They have an excellent bowling lineup; however, they seem to have missed the bus when it comes to choosing their batsmen. With Devon Conway an uncertain starter due to his injury, they hardly have any T20 specialist batters this time around.

6. Seattle Orcas

Captain: Wayne Parnell

Overseas players: Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen, Wayne Parnell, Nandre Burger and Ryan Rickelton (South Africa), Zaman Khan and Imad Wasim (Pakistan), Obed McCoy (West Indies), Michael Bracewell (New Zealand)

2023 Standing: Runner-up

2023 Highest runscorer: Quinton de Kock (264)

2023 Highest wicket-taker: Cameron Gannon (11)

Key players: Heinrich Klaasen, Cameron Gannon, Imad Wasim

Team analysis: The 2023 Major League Cricket runner-up, the Seattle Orcas had to let go of many overseas players this time. Yes, they have a good bowling department, but their batters, barring Heinrich Klaasen, are either not in form or at the tail end of their careers. Everything considered, we do not expect the Orcas to reach the playoffs.

Major League Cricket (2024): Overview

The 2024 MLC (also called the Cognizant Major League Cricket for sponsorship reasons) is only the second edition of this franchise T20 cricket league, and will be held from (IST) July 6 – 29, 2024.

The league was established by the American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) in the United States in 2019. The first season of the competition was played in 2023.

Much like the previous season, the 2024 chapter of the Major League Cricket will be hosted across two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas (Texas) and Church Street Park in Morrisville (North Carolina).

In May 2024, MLC announced it had obtained a List A status (one of the three major forms of the sport recognised by the ICC) for all the fixtures in the tournament.

A total of six teams will participate in the competition: Los Angeles Knight Riders (captained by Sunil Narine), MI New York (Kieron Pollard), San Francisco Unicorns (Pat Cummins), Seattle Orcas (Wayne Parnell), Texas Super Kings (Faf du Plessis), and Washington Freedom (captain TBD).

The tournament will follow this structure: a total of 21 round-robin matches, followed by the playoffs.

There will be three playoff matches: eliminator (3rd vs 4th), followed by a qualifier (1st vs 2nd, the team that wins qualifies for the final), and finally the challenger (the loser of the qualifier meets the winner of the eliminator, with the winner going to the final).

The final will be played on July 29 (IST).

Each team can choose a minimum of 16 and a maximum of 19 players in its squad, including a maximum of nine overseas players.

MI New York are the defending champions, having won the inaugural MLC season in 2023.

Nicholas Pooran (388) and Trent Boult (22) are the tournament's top run-getter and wicket-taker, respectively. Both play for MI New York.

2023 Major League Cricket Summary

The 2023 Major Cricket League, held from July 13–30, was the inaugural edition of the USA's own franchise-based T20 cricket league. It was a resounding success that surpassed financial expectations and garnered an optimistic outlook on the future of US cricket. It has already earned the tag of being the most valued T20 league among associate ICC member nations.

The 2023 MLC was played in a single round-robin format, with MI New York emerging as the champions, defeating the Seattle Orcas in the final by two wickets. Nicholas Pooran and Trent Boult of MI New York were the tournament's leading runscorer (388) and wicket-taker (22), respectively.

title: Watch: Pat Cummins Smashed For Six Off First Ball In Major League Cricket
body:
Earlier this year, the World Cup-winning Australia captain confirmed that he had signed a deal to play in the second season of Major League Cricket in the USA, with the San Francisco Unicorns.

Cummins missed the side's first three matches as he took an extended rest following the 2024 T20 World Cup, which saw Australia fail to make the semifinals. He arrived in time to make his MLC debut in the Unicorns' fourth match of the campaign, against Seattle Orcas.

San Francisco batted first and scored 165-7. Matthew Short top-scored with a solid 56, and quickfire contributions came from Finn Allen (34) and Sanjay Krishnamurthi (30). Cummins batted at No.8, and remained not out on six.

In the run chase, Seattle had made a sedate start, getting to 22-0 in 4 overs. Cummins came on to bowl the fifth over, and started with a fullish off-cutter on leg-stump. Left-hander Ryan Rickleton duly obliged the loosener, swinging through the line and sending the ball over long-on to welcome Cummins.

The over ended up going for 14 runs. Cummins did recover, though, and finished with 1-35 from his four overs, dismissing Shehan Jayasuriya in the 11th over. San Francisco ended up winning by 23 runs, with Liam Plunkett named Player of the Match for his 3-26.

Watch Pat Cummins get hit for six off his first ball in Major League Cricket here
summary:
* Australian captain Pat Cummins made his debut in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in the USA, playing for the San Francisco Unicorns.
* Cummins missed the first three matches of the season due to an extended rest after the 2024 T20 World Cup.
* In his debut match against the Seattle Orcas, San Francisco batted first and scored 165-7, with Matthew Short top-scoring with 56.
* Cummins batted at No.8 and remained not out on six.
* In the run chase, Cummins bowled his first over, conceding 14 runs, but recovered to finish with 1-35 from four overs, dismissing Shehan Jayasuriya.
* San Francisco won the match by 23 runs, with Liam Plunkett named Player of the Match for his 3-26.

title: Seattle Orcas vs San Francisco Unicorns Live Score:
body:
Right then, this is it from Match number 13 where the momentum shifted back and forth in favor of both sides, but eventually, it was the San Francisco Unicorns who held their nerves and emerged victorious. Up next in the Major League Cricket, 2024 is another exciting clash in Match number 14. It will be MI New York going tooth and nail against Washington Freedom at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas. That game will be played on July 17th, Wednesday and the first ball will be bowled at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT). Till then take care, and cheers!

Corey Anderson, the victorious skipper of San Francisco Unicorns says that it was a good outing overall. Says that the new ball came on nicely but mentions that when it slowed down, it got tough to play the strokes. Appreciates Sanjay Krishnamurthi and says that he is a young lad and he played a good crucial cameo. On Pat Cummins, he says that Cummins is a world class player and just to have him in the group is a huge luxury. Adds they will plan how to plan the next game at Dallas and would look to get on a roll now.

Heinrich Klaasen, the captain of Seattle Orcas says that they didn't bat well once again and lost key players at the back end. Says they need to close games out responsibly. Says the bowlers have been fantastic but the batters need to step up big time. He says a win here and there can hopefully flip things for them.

Liam Plunkett wins the PLAYER OF THE MATCH Award for his brilliant bowling figures (4-0-26-3). He says that the way the Seattle Orcas batted inside the powerplay, it looked like going one way but after the break, they came back strongly. Adds it got more and more tough to get along as the ball got older. Ends up saying it was all about trying to execute their plans and maximizing that phase.

Matthew Short is in for a chat. He says that it felt nice to bat there. Adds that he feels good about batting in the first six overs. Mentions that Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock were in form but the wicket was in his favour. Says that Rickelton was in fine form but thinks the wicket was spinning and was a bit skiddy as well. Adds they have been a bit unlucky with the rain. Says in a short tournament like this, every game is critical. Says that they are looking forward to their following games and will look to win them.

Earlier in the game, the Unicorns were asked to bat first and had a bit of a rocky start. JFM was gone in a flash, but then Matthew Short and Finn Allen teamed up for a fireworks display, smashing 75 runs together and sending the score rocketing. But the game twisted as both fell in quick succession and suddenly the boundaries dried up. Cameron Gannon and Imad Wasim spotted their chance and pounced. While their teammates were getting a bit of a hammering. They snagged three wickets each, tightening the screws on the Unicorns' innings. Just when it looked like the Unicorns might fizzle out, Krishnamurthy charged in for some last-minute heroics. His late blitz helped push the total to a respectable 165, which realistically made the difference in the end.

On the flip side, the Unicorns must have felt that they were short of 10-15 runs. They needed a wicket desperately but couldn't get any breakthrough inside the restrictions. As many as six bowlers were used in the powerplay but they couldn't find that scalp. But the tide turned dramatically when Plunkett finally cracked the code, grabbing the first wicket. Short quickly followed suit, and then Cummins, despite leaking runs, struck gold by dismissing the well-set Jayasuriya. This trio of wickets swung the momentum, with the Unicorns cleverly using slower deliveries to keep the Orcas off-balance. The bowlers then literally ran through the opposition lineup giving away next to nothing and closed up in fine fashion.

However, as the innings progressed, the Orcas found themselves lagging behind the asking rate with Jayasuriya too, back in the hut. Just when they needed a steady partnership to ease the mounting pressure, they kept losing quick wickets with all the hitters back in the hut without any impact. The inning that once looked in absolute command suddenly lost its momentum in a jiffy in the mid overs and just couldn't recover from the collapse.

Done and dusted! The San Francisco Unicorns seal the deal winning this clash by 23 runs and climbing to the third spot. A job well done by the Men in Orange and Blue. The Seattle Orcas on the other hand will be gutted with the way things panned out for them towards the second half of the chase. The Seattle Orcas kicked off their chase of 166 with a measured approach. Shehan Jayasuriya and Ryan Rickelton got things rolling nicely, forming a steady opening partnership and pouncing on any loose deliveries. Jayasuriya, in particular, was the aggressor in chief as he was timing the ball to perfection, making it look effortless. Even as wickets tumbled at the other end, Jayasuriya stood firm, notching up a solid resilient half-century.

The Orcas are heading up for their third defeat of the season here and it would be interesting to see how they recover from this in their latter games. However, this game was really under control in the first half with Jayasuriya going hammer and tonks, but they certainly lost the momentum in the next half.

Pat Cummins (3-0-30-1) is back into the attack to bowl the last over of his quota. With 33 runs needed off the 11 remaining deliveries, and all the recognised batters into the sheds, the chances of Orcas getting through have zeroed now.

With Harmeet Singh back in the hut, the tensions further deepen and things have gotten precarious for the Orcas now. They still need 38 off the last 18 remaining deliveries. Cameron Gannon is the next batter in at number 8. Haris Rauf (2-0-23-0) is back into the attack.

W

Overs16.6

Score128 - 6

Liam Plunkett to Harmeet Singh, OUT! TAKEN! Matthew Short with an excellent running catch at deep mid-wicket. Short, on middle, Singh pulls it from closer to the body and hence, he fails to generate the requisite power and the distance as gets the timing completely wrong. It carries towards deep mid-wicket where Matthew Short takes a sharp catch running to his left.

4

Overs16.5

Score128 - 5

Liam Plunkett to Harmeet Singh, FOUR! Edgy but they will take it! Short, on off, Singh looks to pull it but gets a top edge as the ball flies over short fine for a boundary.

Strategic Break! This has been a fabulous comeback from the San Francisco Unicorns with the ball. What looked like a lopsided affair at the beginning of the chase, has turned out to be a nail biting one. With all the big hitters back in the hut, Orcas are still in the hunt of 53 off the last 30 remaining deliveries. Every bowler from the Unicorns has struck timely scalps and helped their team sneak back into the contest. Will Corey Anderson and Co manage to squeeze their opposition further, or will Harmeet Singh play a heroic here? Let's find out together. Corey Anderson (2.2-0-13-1) to continue after the break.

1

Overs14.5

Score110 - 5

Pat Cummins to Harmeet Singh, On a length and on off, Singh looks to flick it but gets a leading edge as the ball carries and lands safely at mid on. They cross.

4

Overs14.3

Score109 - 5

Pat Cummins to Harmeet Singh, FOUR! They need more of these! Touch short and on off, Harmeet Singh looks to pull it but gets a top edge as the ball goes over the keeper's head for a boundary.
summary:
Match 13: San Francisco Unicorns won against Seattle Orcas by 23 runs. The Unicorns batted first and set a target of 166, which the Orcas failed to chase down. Liam Plunkett was awarded Player of the Match for his excellent bowling figures of 4-0-26-3.

In the match, the Unicorns had a rocky start but recovered thanks to a partnership between Matthew Short and Finn Allen. Sanjay Krishnamurthi's late cameo helped push the total to 165. The Orcas struggled to chase down the target, losing wickets regularly, and eventually fell short.

The Unicorns' captain, Corey Anderson, praised his team's performance and credited Liam Plunkett and Pat Cummins for their crucial contributions. On the other hand, Seattle Orcas' captain, Heinrich Klaasen, lamented his team's batting woes and hoped for a turnaround in their next games.

Next up is Match 14 between MI New York and Washington Freedom at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, scheduled for July 17th, at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT).

title: Prime Video snags exclusive 2024 MLC season broadcast rights for ANZ
body:
Prime Video and Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) today announced a partnership to grant Prime Video exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season. All 25 matches will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand from 6 July – 29 July local time (5 July – 28 July in the USA) at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

The announcement comes off the back of a hugely entertaining ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, which saw co-host USA progress to the Super Eight stage in their tournament debut. The second season of MLC will provide a stage for the best international T20 superstars to compete alongside the USA’s top domestic players from six major cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. Across the six teams, eight Australian players and five New Zealander players have been confirmed to participate in the tournament. Key signings include:

Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns alongside bowler Josh Inglis, batter Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand all-rounder Matt Henry.

Seattle Orcas have nabbed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

Washington Freedom have secured Ricky Ponting as coach, as well as Australian batters Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell. New Zealand’s bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson are also named in the squad.

MI New York will see batter Tim David and bowler Trent Boult return for a second season.

Australian bowler Adam Zampa will join the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

“At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series and live sports offerings,” said Hushidar Kharas, head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand. “The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” said MLC’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan. “This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in it’s second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test. MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

Prime Video is a premier entertainment destination where millions of viewers around the world can enjoy their favourite content. It has demonstrated its commitment to delivering premier sports viewing to Australian and New Zealand audiences through a series of acclaimed documentaries. These include The Test S1-S3, Making Their Mark, Shane, Warriors on the Field, and Kick Like Tayla. In Australia, Prime members cheered on the Australian team in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, who made it to the Super 8. The T20 World Cup Women’s tournament will commence in October this year.

Since 2019, Prime Video has commissioned 29 Amazon Originals in Australia — The Test S1-S3, LOL: Last One Laughing Australia with Rebel Wilson, a series of 10 stand-up comedy specials, Back to the Rafters, Luxe Listings Sydney S1 – S3, The Moth Effect, Making Their Mark, Warriors on the Field, Kick Like Tayla, award-winning, feature-length documentary Burning, Head Above Water, Class of ’07, Deadloch, The Lost Flowers of Alice Hart, the lifestyle special Hugh van Cuylenburg: G.E.M, a series of five stand-up comedy specials, Hot Potato: The Story of the Wiggles, Neighbours, Five Blind Dates, Dance Life, the upcoming The Office, The Narrow Road to the Deep North and Top End Bub.

Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand will be able to watch all live MLC matches anywhere and anytime on their Prime Video app for smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, Fire TV stick, Fire tablets, Apple TV, and stream online. In the Prime Video app, Prime Video customers can download matches on their mobile devices and tablets and watch anywhere offline at no additional cost.
summary:
**Partnership and Broadcast Rights**: Prime Video has secured exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season, with all 25 matches available on Prime Video at no extra cost to Prime or Prime Video membership.

**Tournament Details**: The second season of MLC will begin on July 6th in Australia and New Zealand (July 5th in the USA) and will feature six teams from six major cities in the USA: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

**Player Signings**: Notable players participating in the tournament include:

* Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins (San Francisco Unicorns)
* Australian players Jake Fraser-McGurk, Josh Inglis, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, and Adam Zampa
* New Zealand players Matt Henry, Michael Bracewell, Lance Morris, Rachin Ravindra, Lockie Ferguson, and Trent Boult
* Ricky Ponting will coach the Washington Freedom team

**Availability**: Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand can watch all live MLC matches on the Prime Video app on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, and tablets, with the option to download matches for offline viewing at no additional cost.

title: MLC: MI New York Suffer Huge 94-run Loss Against Washington Freedom
body:
MI New York: Impressive half-centuries by Travis Head and Andries Gous, backed by a dominant bowling performance helped Washington Freedom thrash MI New York by 94 runs in their fifth match of the Major League Cricket 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

Head scored 54 off 33, while Gous smashed 59 off 48 to power Washington Freedom to 182/5 in 20 overs. Their bowlers then ran riot, skittling MI New York for just 88 runs, securing a commanding victory by 94 runs. With this win, Washington Freedom became the first team to qualify for the Playoffs of the second season, consolidating their lead at the top of the points table with nine points in five matches.

MI New York had a terrible start to their run chase as Washington Freedom bowlers ran riot. They were 25/5 by the end of the Powerplay. Steven Taylor (0 off 3), Monank Patel (4 off 6), Dewald Brevis (2 off 5), Shayan Jahangir (3 off 9) and Nicholas Pooran (4 off 6) had lost their wickets cheaply by the sixth over. Skipper Kieron Pollard (4 off 9) and Rashid Khan (7 off 6) followed them back to the pavilion as by the ninth over MI New York had scored 56/7.

Trending

Romario Shepherd and Trent Boult displayed some resilience, as they added 33 runs off 16 balls. Shepherd, the last hope for New York, was dismissed in the 11th over after scoring 25 off 14 balls. Maxwell then wrapped things up for Washington, taking two wickets in the 14th over. He removed Boult (16 off 13) on the first ball and Ehsan Adil (0 off 2) on the third to bowl out MI New York to just 88.

After being asked to bat first, the Washington team had a decent start, thanks to their openers, Steve Smith and Travis Head. However, Smith couldn't capitalize as he was dismissed by Rashid Khan in the fifth over, scoring 8 off 10. Head then took charge and built a solid partnership with Andries Gous. Their timely boundaries and steady play helped Washington cross the 100-run mark in the 11th over.

However, Head's blistering knock of 54 off 33 balls, featuring nine fours and two sixes, came to an end in the next over when he was caught by Rashid Khan at long-on off Romario Shepherd. Glen Maxwell soon followed Head back to the pavilion, despite being given a lifeline in the 15th over when Taylor dropped him at mid-off. Rashid Khan eventually dismissed Maxwell in the 16th over, with him managing to score 15 off 14 balls. After 16 overs, Washington stood at 133/3, with Andries Gous still in the middle.

Washington finished their innings strongly, as they scored 49 runs in the last four overs, thanks to the free-flowing strokes of Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra. Gous reached his half-century in the 19th over, while Ravindra smashed two sixes and a four off Boult in the same over, producing as many as 23 runs.

However, Head's blistering knock of 54 off 33 balls, featuring nine fours and two sixes, came to an end in the next over when he was caught by Rashid Khan at long-on off Romario Shepherd. Glen Maxwell soon followed Head back to the pavilion, despite being given a lifeline in the 15th over when Taylor dropped him at mid-off. Rashid Khan eventually dismissed Maxwell in the 16th over, with him managing to score 15 off 14 balls. After 16 overs, Washington stood at 133/3, with Andries Gous still in the middle.

Also Read: Akram ‘hopes’ Indian Team Will Travel To Pakistan For Champions Trophy

Brief Scores: Washington Freedom 182/5 (Andries Gous 59 off 48, Travis Head 54 off 33, Kieron Pollard 2-14 in 2 overs) beat MI New York 88/10 (Romario Shepherd 25 off 14, Trent Boult 16 off 13, Jasdeep Singh 3-14 in 3 overs) by 94 runs.

title: [Watch] Maxwell's Stumps Go For A Cartwheeling As Rashid Khan Outfoxes Him In MLC 2024
body:
Maxwell was bowled by Rashid [X]

Afghanistan's legendary spinner Rashid Khan weaved his magic in MI New York's group-stage encounter against Washington Freedom in the ongoing Major League Cricket.

The talismanic tweaker got the prized scalps of Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell, proving MI New York with crucial breakthroughs.

Watch - Rashid bamboozles Maxwell with a beauty!

After dismissing Washington's skipper Steve Smith, Rashid Khan outfoxed destructive batter Glenn Maxwell with a peach.

The incident occurred during the 16th over of Washington's innings when they were cruising towards a fighting total, courtesy of blistering knocks from Travis Head and Andries Gous. However, Rashid's timely strike brought a sigh of relief to the MI camp as he castled Maxwell.

From over the wicket, Rashid bowled a well-disguised googly, which Maxwell failed to read. The batter had already made his mind to play an aggressive reverse sweep shot.

However, as he couldn't read the variation, the Aussie batter was early onto his shot, with the ball sneaking past his bat to disturb the furniture.

Despite losing Maxwell at the stroke of death overs, Washington Freedom powered themselves to 182/5 in 20 overs, thanks to Rachin Ravindra's hitting masterclass.
summary:
* The match was a group-stage encounter between MI New York and Washington Freedom in the ongoing Major League Cricket tournament.
* Rashid Khan, playing for MI New York, took crucial wickets of Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell, providing breakthroughs for his team.
* Rashid Khan bowled a well-disguised googly to dismiss Maxwell, who failed to read the variation and was early onto his shot, resulting in him being bowled.
* Despite Maxwell's dismissal, Washington Freedom managed to score 182/5 in 20 overs, thanks to Rachin Ravindra's hitting.

title: MLC 2024 Match 15, SEA vs LAKR | Playing 11 Prediction, Cricket Tips, Preview & Live Streaming
body:
LAKR are fourth on the MLC points table (Twitter)

The upcoming clash in Match 15 of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 will see Seattle Orcas (SEA) lock horns with Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Thursday, July 18.

In their previous meeting earlier in the tournament, the Orcas overpowered the Knight Riders, clinching a decisive nine-wicket victory.

SEA vs LAKR: Team Previews

Seattle Orcas

Seattle Orcas have been floundering in troubled waters throughout the tournament, managing to scrape together only a single win from their four outings, accompanied by three defeats.

Currently anchored at the bottom of the MLC 2024 points table, their previous game added to their woes as they fell short by 23 runs against the San Francisco Unicorns.

Despite a promising start, where openers Ryan Rickelton and Shehan Jayasuriya stitched together a 76-run stand, the team's innings capsized after their dismissal, limping to 142/6 in their pursuit of chasing 166-run target.

The Orcas need their key players like Quinton de Kock and captain Heinrich Klaasen to stabilize their middle order with better performances and steer the team towards calmer waters.

With their backs against the wall, they must pull out all the stops in this must-win game, especially since their sole victory came against the Knight Riders.

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Meanwhile, Los Angeles Knight Riders haven't fared much better, eking out just one win from their five matches, along with three losses and one washout.

Positioned fourth in the standings, they are captained by Sunil Narine, but their last outing was a forgettable affair, as they crumbled to 129 all out against Washington Freedom.

The team's heavy hitters, including Jason Roy, Narine, Shakib Al Hasan, and David Miller, failed to light up the scoreboard, leading to an easy chase by Washington in just 16 overs.

The Knight Riders boast a formidable bowling attack and need their batters to step up to the plate if they hope to salvage their playoff aspirations.

Facing a critical juncture, the Knight Riders must win this clash or risk their playoff dreams slipping through their fingers.

SEA vs LAKR: Church Street Park Pitch Report

Church Street Park has presented a challenging wicket for batters this MLC season, with its slow nature and tendency to favour spinners. Teams have generally struggled to rack up high scores here. title: Australia Selector Backs Morris, Richardson For Summer Season Despite Injury Concerns
body:
Major League Cricket: Australia selector George Bailey has long-term plans for pacers Lance Morris and Jhye Richardson, after missing out on the white-ball tour of the UK. The duo were given Cricket Australia central contracts earlier this year.

Morris missed the whole winter season due to a stress fracture in his back, and he is currently undergoing further rehabilitation for the same. It is a recurrence of what transpired following his exclusion from the Ashes trip in the 2022–2023 season.

The pacer had earlier sustained a side strain in his second ODI match, which curtailed his summer. He had been due to play for Seattle Orcas in ongoing Major League Cricket before scans revealed a hot spot in his back and as a result, he was not selected for the Scotland and England trip.

Trending

"Lance is still working through his return to play and getting himself right recovering from that stress fracture of the back," ESPNcricinfo quoted national selector George Bailey as saying. "Know he's progressing well, he's feeling good, he's starting to get to that point where he wants some cricket and think he's going to get a hell of a lot of it over the summer and that will be really exciting to see him back.

"Felt a little bit like with him, that we wanted to set him up for success in the long term as opposed to pushing that too early then potentially risking what we think is something that could be really exciting across this summer and beyond," he added.

On the other hand, Richardson is "fit and firing" as per Bailey after his disrupted stints in the Indian Premier League and domestic season due to a side strain. He last played for Australia against Sri Lanka in mid-2022.

"Jhye is in a similar boat. He's fit and firing now, and again looking for match opportunities. I think he'll get opportunities again across the summer. For both [him and Morris] I think it's getting through the season fit and then hopefully maximising the amount of cricket they play. Some of that will be domestic, hopefully, there will be some international opportunities [and] Australia A opportunities, then I think we set them up for success in the long term," he said.

Australia's national selector added that the dominance of the pace trio of Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc, and Josh Hazlewood with Scott Boland making inroads with some stunning performances in Test cricket.

"Jhye is in a similar boat. He's fit and firing now, and again looking for match opportunities. I think he'll get opportunities again across the summer. For both [him and Morris] I think it's getting through the season fit and then hopefully maximising the amount of cricket they play. Some of that will be domestic, hopefully, there will be some international opportunities [and] Australia A opportunities, then I think we set them up for success in the long term," he said.

Also Read: Akram ‘hopes’ Indian Team Will Travel To Pakistan For Champions Trophy

"Clearly some of the decisions made around this series is around priortising and getting guys right for what will be a really big summer and for some guys this is an opportunity to get a little bit more work into what they are going to need to be ready for that," he concluded.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom reaches the playoffs with thumping win over MI New York
body:
The Washington Freedom unleashed their offensive might at Grand Prairie Stadium on Wednesday, thrashing MI New York by a resounding 94 runs in the 14th match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Washington Freedom feast on batting bounty

Asked to bat first, Washington got off to a shaky start. Skipper Steve Smith departed after scoring just 8 runs. No. 3 Andries Gous and opener Travis Head stitched together a crucial partnership of 73 runs, laying the foundation for a big total.

Gous, known for his aggressive strokeplay, smashed 59 runs off just 48 balls, peppering the Grand Prairie night with 4 sixes and 3 fours. Head, the ever-reliable left-hander, played a composed innings, scoring 54 runs off 33 balls, including 9 fours and two sixes.

The middle order continued the momentum. Glenn Maxwell, though dismissed cheaply for 15, provided a quickfire cameo with a towering six. The young gun Rachin Ravindra impressed with a whirlwind knock of 31 runs off just 14 deliveries, finding the boundary twice on the on-side and twice over the ropes. The Washington batting order displayed remarkable depth, with even lower-order batters contributing valuable runs to propel the team to a formidable total of 182/5 in their allotted 20 overs.

MI New York falters in face of bowling blitz

Chasing a stiff target of 183, MI New York’s hopes for victory evaporated quickly. Both openers, Steven Taylor and Shayan Jahangir, fell cheaply, leaving the middle order with a mountain to climb. None of the remaining batters could manage to build a significant partnership, succumbing to the pressure applied by the Freedom bowlers.

Jasdeep Singh was the wrecker-in-chief for Washington, picking up 3 crucial wickets for just 14 runs in his 3 overs. The right-arm medium pacer displayed exceptional control and swing, exposing the vulnerabilities in the New York batting line-up. Lockie Ferguson and Marco Jansen provided excellent support, claiming 2 wickets apiece. The Washington bowling attack, with a mix of pace and spin, never allowed the New York batters to settle, restricting them to a paltry 88 runs in just 13.3 overs.

Also WATCH: Imad Wasim’s stunning one-handed catch dismisses Mukhtar Ahmed during SEO vs WAF in MLC 2024

Dominant Washington Freedom qualifies for the playoffs

This emphatic victory consolidates Freedom’s position at the top of the MLC 2024 points table. Their clinical performance with both bat and ball leaves a strong message for the rest of the competition. Washington Freedom are now the first team to reach the playoffs of the second season. MI New York, on the other hand, will need to go back to the drawing board and address their batting woes to bounce back in the tournament.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs in the 14th match of the MLC 2024.

**Batting Performance:** Washington Freedom scored 182/5 in 20 overs, with Andries Gous scoring 59 runs off 48 balls and Travis Head scoring 54 runs off 33 balls. Glenn Maxwell and Rachin Ravindra also contributed to the team's total.

**Bowling Performance:** Jasdeep Singh took 3 wickets for 14 runs, while Lockie Ferguson and Marco Jansen claimed 2 wickets each. The Washington bowling attack restricted MI New York to 88 runs in 13.3 overs.

**Tournament Implications:** Washington Freedom has qualified for the playoffs, consolidating their position at the top of the MLC 2024 points table. MI New York needs to address their batting issues to bounce back in the tournament.

title: Glenn Maxwell Wins Hearts with Heartwarming Gesture at MLC 2024
body:
In a touching display of sportsmanship, Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell won the hearts of fans worldwide during the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. After Washington Freedom’s match against Los Angeles Knight Riders, Maxwell, who had been awarded the Player of the Match (POTM), chose to give his award to a young fan, a gesture that quickly went viral on social media.

Stellar Performance on the Field

Maxwell’s performance was instrumental in Washington Freedom’s victory. Although he did not get a chance to bat, his bowling was exceptional. He took three crucial wickets while conceding only 15 runs, effectively limiting the Knight Riders to a total of 129 runs in the first innings. Washington Freedom chased down the target in just 16 overs, losing only two wickets, and secured an eight-wicket victory.

The Heartwarming Moment

The clip of Maxwell giving his POTM award to a fan was shared by Washington Freedom on their official X (formerly Twitter) handle. The heartwarming video shows Maxwell handing over a big box to a young fan and signing an autograph for him. The gesture was praised widely, with fans and followers lauding Maxwell for his kindness.

“The winner of the hearts award goes to Glenn Maxwell, who graciously gave his POTM award to his fan,” Washington Freedom captioned their post.

Social Media Reaction

The post quickly gained traction, with many expressing their admiration for Maxwell’s gesture. Such acts of kindness enhance the connection between players and fans, showcasing the spirit of the game beyond the boundaries of the cricket field.
summary:
* The article highlights a heartwarming moment during the MLC 2024 tournament when Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, playing for Washington Freedom, gave his Player of the Match (POTM) award to a young fan after a match against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* Maxwell's exceptional bowling performance helped Washington Freedom secure an eight-wicket victory, taking three crucial wickets while conceding only 15 runs.
* The gesture was widely praised on social media, with fans and followers lauding Maxwell for his kindness and sportsmanship.
* Washington Freedom shared a video of the heartwarming moment on their official social media handle, showing Maxwell handing over the POTM award to the young fan and signing an autograph for him.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom Target Playoff Spot With a Win Over MI New York
body:
Washington Freedom will look to complete a double over MI New York and enter the Playoffs of the Major League Cricket 2024 when both teams meet at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Tuesday.

Our match against MI NY on July 16 is scheduled to start at 8:30 PM ET (July 17, 6:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch via LIVE streaming and broadcast.

We continue to remain unbeaten in MLC 2024 and are on top of the points table with seven points from four games.

We beat the Los Angeles Knight Riders by eight wickets in our last match in Morrisville on Sunday. Glenn Maxwell and Saurabh Netravalkar picked up seven wickets amongst themselves whereas Travis Head hit a swashbuckling half-century to make short work of the chase.

Netravalkar has 12 wickets from just four matches and stands on top of the bowling charts of MLC 2024 with an enviable average of 9.16 runs per wicket. The left-arm pacer has an unbelievable strike rate of 7.66, which means he picks up a wicket in under every eight balls he delivers.

Meanwhile, captain Steve Smith, after his unbeaten 42 against LAKR in the last match, occupies fifth place among all batters in MLC 2024 with 126 runs from four outings at an astonishing average of 126.00 and a strike rate of 140.00.

WF vs MI NY form in MLC

Washington Freedom have won three of their last five matches in the MLC, with one game washed off due to rain, coming into this contest. We beat MI NY by four runs in a rain-affected match at Morrisville on July 6 to kick-start our 2024 campaign.

Travis Head scored his first half-century in MLC in our last game with an entertaining 32-ball 54. He showcased his wide array of shots and aggressive intent smashing six sixes and two fours during his knock.

Steve Smith was instrumental in our previous win against MI NY remaining unbeaten on 46 of just 28 balls. He plundered 22 runs off Anrich Nortje’s first over which proved crucial as we were ahead of the DLS par score by four runs when rain stopped play.
