title: MLC 2024 [WATCH]: Nicholas Pooran thrashes Cameron Gannon in MI New York’s win over Seattle Orcas
body:
Nicholas Pooran continued his excellent form in the shortest format, and with Trent Boult and Rashid Khan also in similar fiery moods, last year’s champions MI New York won the opening match of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

In Morrisville, New York clashed with the Seattle Orcas in the first fixture of the tournament. New York skipper Kieron Pollard won the toss and opted to field first, putting the Seattle to the test. Despite their best efforts, Seattle struggled to surpass the 100-run mark, ultimately being bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs.

Seattle Orcas’ struggles

Shubham Ranjan top-scored for Seattle with 35 runs, including 2 fours and 2 sixes in his 31-ball innings. Harmeet Singh contributed 20 runs off 14 balls, hitting 2 fours and 1 six, while Aaron Jones managed 12 runs off 16 balls with 2 fours. However, the rest of the lineup faltered, with Quinton de Kock, captain Enrique Klassen, Imad Wasim and Michael Bracewell all failing to make significant contributions. New York’s bowling attack, led by Boult and Rashid, proved too formidable. Boult took 3 wickets for 25 runs in his 4 overs, while Rashid claimed 3 wickets for 22 runs. Pollard chipped in with 2 wickets for 11 runs, and Ehsan Adil and Enrique Norkia took 1 wicket each.

Nicholas Pooran’s match-winning knock for MI New York

In reply, New York chased down the target with ease, scoring 111 runs for 4 wickets in just 14.2 overs, securing a six wicket victory with 34 balls remaining. The highlight of the chase was Pooran’s unbeaten 62 runs off 37 balls, an innings that included 7 fours and 2 sixes. Pooran’s aggressive approach and timely boundaries kept the momentum in MI New York’s favour. Pooran was further named Player of the Match for his explosive yet calculated knock.

Also READ: Star players from IPL 2024 who will feature in the MLC 2024

Pooran’s brutal assault against Cameron Gannon

Pooran’s assault against Cameron Gannon was the defining moment of New York’s victory. With New York were at one time at a challenging 19/2 in the first four overs of the powerplay, Pooran took charge to change the course of the match. The turning point came in the fifth over, where Pooran unleashed his fury on Gannon, scoring 22 runs off the over and shifting the momentum decisively.

On the first ball of the over, Pooran played a dot ball, setting the stage for what was to come. The second delivery was slightly full and off-stump, which Pooran dispatched over wide long-on for a massive six, electrifying the crowd. This shot demonstrated his power and ability to seize scoring opportunities. Gannon’s attempt to adjust on the third ball resulted in another delivery in Pooran’s hitting zone, which he sent soaring over midwicket for another six, showcasing his aggressive intent and capacity to build pressure on the bowler.

The fourth ball saw Pooran smartly taking a double, keeping the scoreboard ticking and retaining the strike. On the fifth ball, Gannon bowled short and wide, and Pooran expertly cut it behind backward point for a four, highlighting his precision and versatility. The final delivery of the over was placed with finesse by Pooran, again behind backward point for another boundary, emphasizing his skill in finding gaps and executing shots with precision.

Here’s the video:
summary:
* The opening match of MLC 2024 was played between MI New York and Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, New York.
* MI New York won the match by 6 wickets, chasing down the target of 109 runs in 14.2 overs.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs, with Shubham Ranjan top-scoring with 35 runs.
* Trent Boult and Rashid Khan took 3 wickets each for MI New York, while Kieron Pollard chipped in with 2 wickets.
* Nicholas Pooran played a match-winning knock of 62 runs off 37 balls, including 7 fours and 2 sixes, to help MI New York win the match.
* Pooran's aggressive innings was the highlight of the chase, and he was named Player of the Match for his performance.
* MI New York's win was largely due to Pooran's brutal assault against Cameron Gannon in the fifth over, where he scored 22 runs and shifted the momentum of the match in his team's favor.

title: WATCH: Derone Davis takes a screamer to dismiss Joshua Tromp in TSK vs LAKR game at MLC 2024
body:
In the second match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 between the Texas Super Kings (TSK) and the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Derone Davis showcased extraordinary fielding skills, taking a stunning catch that left the crowd in awe.

The moment of magic

The thrilling moment occurred during the 14th over of the Super Kings’ innings, bowled by Ali Khan. On the fifth delivery, Ali bowled a short ball that batter Joshua Tromp smashed towards the third man. The ball seemed destined for a boundary, flying high and fast. Davis, stationed at third man, had to act quickly. With no time to reach the ball conventionally, he threw himself into a dive.

The spectacular catch

As the ball popped out of Davis’ hands during the dive, it seemed the chance might be lost. However, displaying remarkable presence of mind and athleticism, Davis managed to grab the rebound with his right hand. Despite the challenging circumstances, he made the catch look both easy and his ability to keep his eyes on the ball while falling to the ground was nothing short of exceptional.

The crowd erupted in applause, and the video of Davis’ incredible catch quickly went viral, showcasing the high level of skill and excitement that MLC brings to the field.

Here is the video:

Also READ: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Broadcast, live streaming details – When and Where to watch in India, US, UK, Australia & other countries

Unmukt Chand shines with the bat

Electing to bowl first, the Super Kings aimed to restrict the Knight Riders to a manageable total. However, despite early setbacks with Jason Roy and Sunil Narine falling cheaply, Unmukt Chand anchored the innings brilliantly. Unmukt’s splendid knock of 68 off 45 balls, which included 6 fours and 3 sixes, provided a solid foundation for the Knight Riders.

Contributions from Nitish Kumar, who scored 26 off 17, and Corne Dry‘s quickfire 12 off 4 balls, helped LAKR post a competitive total of 162/7. For the Super Kings, Zia-ul-Haq and Aaron Hardie were the standout bowlers, each taking two wickets and conceding 16 and 26 runs respectively.

Ali Khan’s sizzling bowling take the Knight Riders home

Chasing 163, Texas Super Kings’ innings was led by Devon Conway, who scored a solid 53 off 39 balls. Despite Conway’s efforts and a quick 29 off 18 from Calvin Savage, the Super Kings struggled to build partnerships and lost wickets at regular intervals.

The Knight Riders’ bowlers were disciplined, with Ali being the pick of the bowlers, claiming 4 wickets for 33 runs in his 4 overs. Spencer Johnson and Narine also made significant contributions with 2 and 1 wicket respectively. Their efforts restricted Texas Super Kings to 150/8 in their 20 overs, falling short by 12 runs.
summary:
**Match Details:**
The match was played between the Texas Super Kings (TSK) and the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Notable Performances:**

* Derone Davis of TSK took an extraordinary catch at third man, diving to his right and grabbing the rebound with his right hand, leaving the crowd in awe.
* Unmukt Chand of LAKR scored 68 off 45 balls, anchoring the innings and providing a solid foundation for his team.
* Ali Khan of LAKR took 4 wickets for 33 runs in his 4 overs, being the pick of the bowlers and helping his team win the match.

**Match Result:**
Los Angeles Knight Riders won the match by 12 runs, restricting Texas Super Kings to 150/8 in their 20 overs while scoring 162/7 themselves.

title: Star players from IPL 2024 who will feature in the MLC 2024
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to return for its highly anticipated second edition in 2024 after a successful debut season in 2023. The upcoming tournament will commence on Saturday (July 6) and promises to bring even more excitement and top-notch cricket action. MI New York, the champions of the inaugural season, will be looking to defend their title as six teams compete in a round-robin format.

Major League Cricket 2024: Tournament structure and venues

The 2024 season will feature six teams: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco and Washington Freedom. The teams will face each other once in the league stage, resulting in a total of 21 matches.

The initial 15 games will be held at Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium, with the remaining group stage fixtures and knockout matches taking place at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. The top four teams will advance to the playoffs, where the victorious teams from the knockout matches will battle it out in the final.

IPL franchise influence and star power

Four of the six teams in MLC are owned by franchises from the Indian Premier League (IPL), bringing with them a wealth of experience and star-studded lineups. However, it’s not just about the ownership; the tournament will also feature numerous stars who have already made a significant impact in the IPL 2024 season with their electrifying performances. These players will be looking to replicate their success in MLC 2024, adding even more excitement to the competition.

IPL 2024 team: Kolkata Knight Riders

MLC 2024 team: Washington Freedom

IPL 2024 team: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB)

5. Quinton de Kock

MLC 2024 team: Seattle Orcas

IPL 2024 team: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG)

The South African wicketkeeper-batter is known for his aggressive batting style and will be looking to dominate the opposition bowlers in the tournament for the Seattle Orcas

MLC 2024 team: Los Angeles Knight Riders

IPL 2024 team: Gujarat Titans (GT)

The South African left-handed batter, known for his clean hitting and ability to accelerate innings, joins will play for Los Angeles Knight Riders. Miller’s experience and batting prowess will be crucial in guiding his team to success.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Schedule, Time In IST, Venues, Format, Squads and Live Streaming Details
body:
Major League Cricket 2024: Schedule, Time In IST, Venues, Format, Squads and Live Streaming Details. Major League Cricket (MLC) hosts a professional T20 cricket league in the United States. American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) manages the league, which holds official sanctioning from both USA Cricket and the International Cricket Council (ICC). The upcoming season marks the second iteration of the league, following its inaugural season in July 2023.

The upcoming Major League Cricket 2024 season will commence on July 5 (July 6 according to IST). The games will take place at two of the most sought-after venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. It was MI New York, the reigning champions, who snatched the first place in the tournament and outperformed the Seattle Orcas by 7 wickets back in the initial season.

Also Read: IND vs ZIM T20 Series: Schedule, Time In IST, Venues, Squads And Live Streaming Details

The Major League Cricket (MLC) has been growing swiftly in its second season with acquisitions like those of Steve Smith, Travis Head, Pat Cummins, and Glenn Maxwell and the addition of coaches such as Ricky Ponting and Shane Watson. Any evidence of the “M” word, MLC, or to stand on equal footing with the game of baseball is quite amazing. It is remarkable that cricket is ‘nonofficial’ but shows growth in just over one year.

Following the T20 World Cup, where the U.S. national cricket team advanced to the second round, the second season of the competition aims to enhance its visibility. The likes of Lockie Ferguson and David Miller have recently been switching teams but the emergence of local American players has made the fans expect and enjoy the new season.

Also Read: Upcoming ICC Tournaments From 2025 To 2031: Hosts, Date, Year, And Other Details

Major League Cricket 2024 Schedule

Major League Cricket 2024 Format

In the upcoming second edition of MLC, six teams will battle it out in a round-robin format, playing a total of 21 matches. Initially, Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium will host the first 15 matches alternately. For the later stages, including the last six group stage fixtures and all knockout matches, Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas will be the exclusive venue.

During the league stage, each franchise will play against every other team once. The top four teams from this phase will qualify for the playoffs, where they will compete in knockout matches to secure a spot in the championship game. However, the ultimate showdown will determine the winner of the tournament.

Major League Cricket 2024 Squads

MI New York

summary:
**Schedule and Venues:**
The MLC 2024 season will start on July 5 (July 6 according to IST) and will be played at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Format:**
The tournament will feature six teams playing a round-robin format, with each team playing 21 matches. The top four teams will qualify for the playoffs, and the final match will determine the winner.

**Squads:**
The six teams participating in MLC 2024 are MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom. The squads feature a mix of international and local American players.

**Live Streaming Details:**
In India, the tournament will be broadcast on Sony Sports Network, and all 25 matches can be streamed live on the JioCinema app and website. Day matches will start at 12:30 or 1 AM IST, and evening matches will start at 6 AM IST.

**Notable Players:**
The tournament features several high-profile players, including Steve Smith, Travis Head, Pat Cummins, and Glenn Maxwell, as well as coaches Ricky Ponting and Shane Watson.

NY vs SEA Preview

MI New York, having clinched the title against the same opponents last season, will be eager to start their defense on a strong note. The champions have a strong lineup featuring some of the biggest names in T20 cricket. Key players for MI New York include the explosive Nicholas Pooran, whose batting prowess can change the course of a game in a matter of overs, the ever-reliable Trent Boult with his lethal swing bowling, the sensational Rashid Khan, and the experienced T20 veteran Kieron Pollard.

On the other hand, the Seattle Orcas will be looking for redemption after their heartbreak in last season’s final. They have assembled a strong squad capable of challenging for the title this year. The Orcas will be banking on the big-hitting abilities of Heinrich Klaasen, the aggressive opening style of Quinton de Kock, and the all-round skills of Wayne Parnell to spearhead their campaign.

Match Preview

Get ready for an exhilarating showdown as the Texas Super Kings go head-to-head with the Los Angeles Knight Riders in Match 2 of the prestigious Major League Cricket series. Both teams are gearing up to demonstrate their skills and strategies in what promises to be an eagerly anticipated encounter, offering fans a captivating display of cricketing excellence.

The Texas Super Kings, renowned for their aggressive batting and solid bowling lineup, approach the match with confidence following a strong start to the season. title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Broadcast, live streaming details – When and Where to watch in India, US, UK, Australia & other countries
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) has returned with a bang for the highly anticipated second season, captivating cricket enthusiasts worldwide with an opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas. The match, scheduled to be held at Morrisville’s renowned cricket ground, marks the beginning of what promises to be an exhilarating season of cricketing action.

The MLC Season 2 features six dynamic teams, each eager to showcase their prowess in the sport. The lineup includes the Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. With the participation of notable Indian Premier League (IPL) franchise owners, the league has garnered significant attention for its blend of international talent and strategic cricketing acumen.

Unlike the inaugural season, which followed a single round-robin format leading into knockout rounds, Season 2 introduces an enhanced structure. Teams will engage in a rigorous schedule of 7 league games before progressing to the knockout phase. The culmination of the season promises to deliver intense competition, with the final showdown set to take place on July 28, spanning venues in both Morrisville and Dallas.

The excitement of cricket lovers will undoubtedly reach its peak with the truth that we are bursting today in this article. And that is, for the 2nd time, Major League Cricket has announced its tournament for 2024.

We can witness six strong teams competing against one another to lift the trophy. The tournament will begin on 6th July 2024 and end on 29 July 2024. To learn more about the teams and schedule, consider reading the article to the end.

What is Major League Cricket (MLC)?

Major League Cricket (MLC) is a new cricket tournament designed to follow a similar format as the Indian Premier League. MLC features a playoff system with four matches: Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger, and Final.

During the league stage, the top four teams qualify for the playoffs. In the Eliminator, the fourth-placed team faces the third-placed team, and the winner faces the second-placed team in the Qualifier. In the Challenger match, the winner of the Qualifier plays against the top-placed team.

Challenger winners compete in the Final against Qualifier winners. The format ensures that the best teams reach the final stage, resulting in a showdown between the top two teams.

With the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 finished, the cricket world turns its attention to Major League Cricket 2024 — the United States’ premier T20 cricket league. This is the second season for MLC with six teams, including MI New York, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom.

The season is also short. It lasts for a few weeks from now until the MLC 2024 Final on Sunday, July 28.

If you’re looking for last-minute tickets, third-party resellers sites, such as Vivid Seats and StubHub, have tickets available. Moreover, you can use Variety’s exclusive promo code VAR2024 for $20 off at Vivid Seats.

Want to watch Major League Cricket online? Here’s what you need to know about livestreaming options.

How to Watch Major League Cricket 2024

There are a few ways to watch MLC since it broadcasts across regional sports networks in the United States, both on TV and online. However, cricket fans can livestream every MLC match on Willow HD, which is available with Sling TV or Fubo.

With Sling, Willow HD is part of the service’s Dakshin Flex package, which starts at $10/Month. It comes with live and on-demand cricket matches, as well as movies and TV shows from networks, such as Star India, Hotstar Specials, Vijay TV and more. These networks and offerings are in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam and other languages.

Meanwhile, you can also get an annual subscription for $99/Year — which is about a 45% savings, compared to the monthly price.

As for Fubo, Willow HD is part of all of the streaming services plans starting at $79.99/Month. The plan includes more than 145 channels — including CBS, ABC, FX, NBC, HGTV, CNN, ESPN, Fox Sports, NFL Network and others — unlimited cloud DVR and up to 10 streams on multiple devices at once. Additionally, Fubo offers a seven-day free trial, so you can try it out for a week before you commit.

If you’re outside of the United States, but you’d still like to watch MLC matches, you can use a virtual private network, like ExpressVPN or NordVPN. These are online subscriptions that allows you to access live feeds of cricket matches with any of the above streaming services — even if you’re not in the U.S.A. ExpressVPN, which starts at $6.67/Month, and NordVPN, which starts at $3.39/Month, are accessible on laptops, streaming devices, tablets or smartphones. Learn more about ExpressVPN here and NordVPN here.

ESPN presents exclusive coverage of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season than began last Friday, July 5. Fans across the Caribbean can look forward to an action-packed month of cricket, with live broadcasts of every match culminating with the Final on Sunday, July 28.

Launched in 2023, Major League Cricket is America’s first and only world class professional T20 league. Following a successful debut season, MLC returns this summer with its six founding teams taking part in the competition: current champions MI New York, the Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. The league will also showcase top-tier talent including Faf du Plessis, Andre Russell, and Rashid Khan. Additionally, emerging talents such as Ali Khan Harmeet Singh, Saurabh Netravalkar and Andries Gousand Corey Anderson are expected to make significant impacts this season​.

The MLC matches are set to take place at Grand Prairie Stadium near Dallas, TX and Church Street Park in Morrisville, NC. The tournament features a round-robin format where each team plays against the others in a series of matches. The top teams from the round-robin stage will advance to the playoffs, culminating with the championship game.

title: How to watch Major League Cricket in Australia: Channel, schedule to see Pat Cummins and Australian stars in T20 Tournament
body:
What time is Major League Cricket in Australia?

There are two different start times for Major League Cricket in Australia, with games being played either in Texas or in North Carolina.

The earliest start time is at 5:00 a.m. AEST, whilst the later start time is at 10:00 a.m. AEST.

The playoffs and final all begin at 10:30 a.m., with the final scheduled for July 29.

Which Australians are playing in Major League Cricket?

There are 14 Australians who will be playing in the Major League Cricket tournament for 2024.

The most notable names include current Australia captain Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, who is captain of the Washington Freedom, Alex Carey, and Travis Head.

Two former Australian legends are also coaching in the competition, with Ricky Ponting coaching the freedom, and Shane Watson in charge of the San Fransisco Unicorns.

Australian players in Major League Cricket 2024

PlayerTeamSpencer JohnsonLos Angeles Knight RidersAdam ZampaLos Angeles Knight RidersAlex CareyLos Angeles Knight RidersTim DavidMI New YorkPat CummingsSan Fransisco UnicornsMatthew ShortSan Fransisco UnicornsJosh InglisSan Fransisco UnicornsJake Fraser-McGurkSan Fransisco UnicornsAaron HardieTexas Super KingsMarcus StoinisTexas Super KingsSteve SmithWashington FreedomTravis HeadWashington FreedomGlenn MaxwellWashington FreedomAndrew TyeWashington FreedomJack EdwardsWashington Freedom

Major League Cricket schedule

The Major League Cricket tournament began on July 6 and will see each team play each other at least once, with every team playing seven games overall.

The regular season ends on July 24, with the top two sides advancing straight to the qualifier, and the third and fourth placed teams playing off in the eliminator.

The winner from the qualifier will head straight to the final, whilst the loser of that match will play the winner of the eliminator in the challenger match to decide the second team in the final.

Last season's final saw MI New York defeat the Seattle Orcas by seven wickets.

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

After a miserable inaugural Major League Cricket campaign in 2023, the Los Angeles Knight Riders now take on the team that finished as runners’ up last season in the Seattle Orcas, who could do with bouncing back quite quickly.

DATE & TIME: Tuesday 9th July, 2024 - USA ET – 8:30pm / USA PT – 5:30pm / West Indies – 7:30pm / Wednesday 10th July, 2024 - UK – 1:30am / South Africa – 2:30am / Pakistan – 5:30am / India – 6:00am / Bangladesh – 6:30am / Australia – 10:30am

VENUE: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, Texas, United States

WEATHER: 31c or 87.8 F with clear skies

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: A NEW LOOK LAKR

The Los Angeles Knight Riders lost their opening four matches in 2023 before defeating the league winners Seattle Orcas in their final game. This time around, though, LAKR started with a 12-run victory over the Texas Super Kings in Dallas with an excellent performance, spearheaded by Ali Khan, limiting the hosts throughout their run chase.

LAST THREE: LWWLL

SEATTLE ORCAS FORM: POOR START FOR SEATTLE

On the other hand, the Seattle Orcas started their 2024 season by being annihilated by MI New York, who defeated them in the final last year. They were skittled for just 108 before allowing that to be comfortably chased, taking just four wickets in 14.2 overs. That leaves them bottom-of-the-table, albeit having played just one game.

LAST THREE: LLWWL

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

LAKR’s shortcomings were, though, shown up in their second match when they suffered a six-wicket loss to the San Francisco Unicorns. There is a lack of batting depth or even just batting strength and setting a target of 166 against the Unicorns was nowhere near enough with the opposition chasing it down in just 15.2 overs. It is quite an ageing side with Jason Roy, Sunil Narine, Shakib Al Hasan and Andre Russell but the one player they should bee able to rely upon is David Miller so the South African to be their best batter in this match seems a good bet.

With the ball, after taking a four-wicket haul in their opening game, Ali Khan went wicket-less against the Unicorns and the attention turned to Aussie quick Spencer Johnson, who took 3-26. Johnson has been excellent since emerging in the last 12-18 months and the left armer to take two or more wickets once again would appear quite likely.

SEATTLE ORCAS BETTING ANALYSIS

There is no real pattern to emerge from the Seattle Orcas yet given they have played just one game but there will be fewer concerns about their batting line-up. Quinton de Kock’s form is a question but middle-order hitting from Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen and Harmeet Singh should mean they stay in more matches – unlike against an impressive MI New York. Klaasen is the form player and now, as captain, will need to take some responsibility so a 30+ score from him would be worth backing.

MI New York had the luxury of going slowly in their chase of 109 but that doesn’t mean there wasn’t some good bowling from Nandre Burger and Zaman Khan. It does appear a fairly weak attack, though, and Burger will have to be at the top of his game with him being their best bowler most likely to happen more often than not.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS VS SEATTLE ORCAS EXPERT PREDICTION

In terms of who will come out on top, despite their very different first seasons in which LAKR finished rock-bottom and Seattle finished top, these are two very different sides. On paper, the Orcas should be set with De Kock at the top but the South African has been out of form for a while now, despite some flashes at the ICC T20 World Cup. If Johnson continues to open the bowling then backing Johnson to have a major impact on the match, up against De Kock initially, will be worth keeping an eye on.
summary:
**Match Details**

* The Los Angeles Knight Riders will take on the Seattle Orcas on Tuesday, July 9th, 2024, at 8:30pm ET at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.
* The weather forecast is clear skies with a temperature of 31°C (87.8°F).

**Team Forms**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Started the 2024 season with a 12-run victory over the Texas Super Kings, but then suffered a six-wicket loss to the San Francisco Unicorns. Their last three results are LWWLL.
* Seattle Orcas: Lost their opening match to MI New York, being skittled for 108 runs, and are currently bottom of the table. Their last three results are LLWWL.

**Betting Analysis**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: David Miller is a good bet to be their best batter in this match. Spencer Johnson is likely to take two or more wickets.
* Seattle Orcas: Heinrich Klaasen is expected to score 30+ runs. Nandre Burger is likely to be their best bowler.

**Expert Prediction**

* The match is expected to be closely contested, with the Seattle Orcas' batting lineup being stronger on paper. However, Quinton de Kock's form is a concern. Spencer Johnson's performance could have a major impact on the match, especially against De Kock.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Match 5: Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings - Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 8
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 5 - Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings, which will be played on July 8th, at the Church Street Park, Morrisville.

Points Table

Match 5 - Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings (Church Street Park, Morrisville)

Current Form Texas Super Kings:

Texas Super Kings are currently placed at the 5th position on points table with 1 loss to their credit.

The top run scorer for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket is Devon Conway with 53 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket is Aaron Hardie with 2 scalps under his belt.

Texas Super Kings have lost their first match of the Major League Cricket against LA Knight Riders by 12 runs.

LA Knight Riders batted first and they posted a total of 162 for 7 in 20 overs. Jason Roy and Sunil Narine got out cheaply. After their dismissals, Unmukt Chand played a fine knock of 68 runs in 45 balls. He hit 6 fours and 3 huge sixes during his innings. Nitish Kumar also played a nice cameo of 26 runs in 17 balls to help LA Knight Riders get to 162 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis started off really well for Texas Super Kings. They stitched a partnership of 30 runs for the first wicket. A couple of wickets fell in quick succession in the middle order and Super Kings all of a sudden looked in deep waters. Devon Conway kept on batting well and made 53 runs off 39 balls but he barely got any support at the other end as Texas Super Kings were restricted to 150 for 8 in 20 overs, losing the match by 12 runs.

Batting Stats T20

Current Form Washington Freedom:

Washington Freedom are currently placed at the 3rd position on points table with 1 win to their credit.

The top run scorer for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket is Steven Smith with 46 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket is Saurabh Netravalkar with 3 scalps under his belt.

Washington Freedom have won their previous match against MI New York by 4 runs (DLS method).

MI New York batted first and they posted a total of 154 for 9 in 20 overs. The start wasn't encouraging but Nicholas Pooran made sure that he didn't throw his wicket away. Pooran made 44 runs off 30 balls and laid the foundation for a big total. After he got out, Rashid Khan took over the role of an enforcer. He scored 31 off 15 balls and took MI New York to 154 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Washington Freedom lost Travis Head quite early. After his dismissal, Steven Smith let loose and smashed Anrich Nortje for 22 runs in his first over. Then the rain arrived and Washington Freedom were ahead in the DLS calculation by 4 runs. The match couldn't restart again and Washington Freedom were declared winners by 4 runs (DLS method).

Wicket Takers T20

title: MLC 2024, SFU vs LAKR: Andre Russell makes ball disappear, hits Haris Rauf for astronomical 107
body:
Star Windies player Andre Russell smashed a 107-meter six against Pakistan's premium pacer Haris Rauf during the San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders clash in match 4 of the ongoing edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 which was being played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, on July 8 (Monday). The six was so big that for a brief moment, it even disappeared in the night sky. The massive shot became one of the big highlights of this match. However, Russell's LAKR could not pick up a win in this match and lost to SFU by six wickets.

Russell's 107-meter six vs Haris Rauf

In the final over of the LAKR's innings, Russell smashed the humongous hit against Haris Rauf. The Windies star helped his team post a fighting total of 165/6 in 20 overs after smashing 15 runs in the 20th over and he remained unbeaten after scoring 40 runs off 25 balls. The video of his six is now going viral all over the internet at a rapid pace.

ALSO READ: Abhishek Sharma reveals he asked for this player's bat after four-ball duck on debut to score maiden T20I ton vs Zimbabwe

ALSO READ: 'Mujhse galti hui thi aur wahi ek baat...': Kamran Akmal reveals conversation with Harbhajan Singh after IND vs PAK WCL clash, namedrops Babar Azam too

SFU beat LAKR

LAKR defeated SFU by 6 wickets. SFU managed to chase down the 166-run target by the 16th over itself with the help of blazing knocks from Finn Allen and Matthew Short. Allen smashed 63 runs off 37 balls and Short played an astonishing innings of 58 runs off just 26 balls. Both of them helped the team pick up a comfortable win against the Knights.

“Nice to see Finn and Shorty take the bowlers down. The boundaries aren't big. It's ideal to chase in the night but you got to bat well too. You don't have to tell them much (his top three batters). The way they play the game is extremely aggressive. That's going to come with ups and downs. He (Brady Couch) was fantastic today,” said SFU captain Corey Anderson in the post-match presentation.

MORE ON SPORTS TAK:

WATCH - Abhishek Sharma's parents' reaction to son's maiden International century will melt your heart, sister Komal shares beautiful video

Flop in T20 World Cup, New Zealand opener and Punjab Kings batter's fifties help San Francisco Unicorns beat LA Knight Riders by 6 wickets

Pat Cummins makes false claim about Australia cricket while suggesting specific Test cricket window to avoid clash with franchise leagues
summary:

* The match was played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 8.
* Andre Russell of Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) hit a massive 107-meter six against Haris Rauf of San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) in the final over of LAKR's innings.
* Despite Russell's 40 runs off 25 balls, LAKR posted a total of 165/6 in 20 overs, but lost to SFU by six wickets.
* SFU chased down the target of 166 runs in the 16th over, thanks to Finn Allen's 63 runs off 37 balls and Matthew Short's 58 runs off 26 balls.
* SFU captain Corey Anderson credited his top three batters for the win, saying they played an "extremely aggressive" game.

title: Faf du Plessis' century in vain as rain washes out Texas Super Kings vs. Washington Freedom match
body:
The fifth match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings was washed out due to rain, resulting in both teams sharing a point each at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Monday. What could have been a high-scoring thriller was thwarted by the weather.

Match Summary

Washington Freedom *62/0 (4.0 ov)

Texas Super Kings 203/5 (20 ov)

Result - Match abandoned

SCORECARD

Match Analysis

In the first innings, Faf du Plessis showcased his class with an emphatic century, leading the Texas Super Kings to a huge total of 203/5 in 20 overs. Washington Freedom, on the other hand, came out all guns blazing. The Australian duo of Steve Smith and Travis Head got the run-chase going immediately, reaching 37/0 after three overs. Head, who was dropped by Dwayne Bravo off Zia-ul-Haq on the last ball of the third over, went on to score 24 runs, including two sixes and two fours, in the fourth over. Washington Freedom reached 61/0 after 4 overs before rain halted play.

With the minimum five overs not completed in the second innings, the DLS method couldn't be applied, hence the match ended in a no result and shared points. Both opening games of Washington Freedom have been rain-affected thus far, but they remain unbeaten and have jumped to the top, while Texas Super Kings are fifth in the points table.

Earlier in the day, Texas Super Kings batted first. Openers Faf du Plessis and birthday boy Devon Conway got Texas Super Kings off to a flying start as they reached 67/0 in the Powerplay. Skipper du Plessis batted fluently while Conway played a supporting role, with the duo adding 109 runs in no time. Conway was the first to fall, dismissed by Saurabh Netravalkar in the 11th over after scoring 39 runs off 26 balls. The Super Kings then lost their second wicket in the following over when Aaron Hardie (2 off 5) was trapped LBW by Akeal Hosein, leaving them at 114/2 after 12 overs.

Aussie all-rounder Marcus Stoinis joined du Plessis and kept the scoreboard ticking at a rapid pace. Despite picking up an injury to his right hand in the 14th over, Stoinis played a vital cameo of 29 off 18 balls, forming a partnership of 62 off 29 balls with the skipper before being caught by Mukhtar Ahmed off Justin Dill in the 17th over.

Meanwhile, du Plessis continued as he reached his century in 56 balls, taking the Texas Super Kings to 188/3 after 18 overs. He was immediately caught by Steve Smith at extra cover off Saurabh Netravalkar in the following over, but the TSK batters ensured they crossed the 200-run mark. This was the first time a score of 200 was achieved at this venue and the first time any team crossed this mark this season, courtesy of du Plessis' remarkable knock of 100 off 58, which included 12 boundaries and five sixes.

Runs

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings Washed Out After Faf du Plessis Century
body:
oi-Aditya K Halder

The fifth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Tuesday was unfortunately called off due to rain.

This much-anticipated game saw Washington Freedom chasing a challenging target of 204 runs, reaching 62 for 0 in just four overs before the downpour interrupted play.

Travis Head had a rapid start, scoring 32 runs off 12 balls, while Steve Smith followed closely with 26 runs off 12 balls. The duo looked poised for a strong partnership when the rain halted their progress.

Despite an hour-long wait for the weather to clear, match officials eventually decided to call off the game, resulting in both teams sharing a point each from the rain-affected match.

This encounter was significant as it marked the first instance of any team surpassing 200 runs this season and also the first occurrence of a 200-run total at Church Street Park.

Earlier in the match, Texas Super Kings, led by captain Faf du Plessis, set an impressive total of 203 for 5 in their 20 overs. Du Plessis delivered a stellar performance, scoring a brilliant century off 58 balls.

His innings were marked by aggressive and calculated shots, consistently punishing any loose deliveries from the Washington bowlers. Devon Conway provided crucial support, scoring 39 runs off 26 balls. Together, du Plessis and Conway built a solid 109-run partnership for the opening wicket.

Despite dealing with an injured right hand, Marcus Stoinis contributed a vital 29 runs off 18 balls, further boosting the Texas Super Kings' total. However, Washington Freedom's bowling and fielding were below par, with several dropped catches and missed opportunities that allowed the Texas Super Kings to amass their substantial total.

While the rain ultimately denied what could have been an exciting finish, both teams displayed promising performances. The Washington Freedom's explosive start in their chase and the Texas Super Kings' formidable batting display, particularly from Faf du Plessis, set a high standard for the rest of the season.

Both teams will look to build on these performances as the Major League Cricket season progresses, aiming to secure their positions in the tournament standings.
summary:
* The 5th match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings was abandoned due to rain.
* The match was played at Church Street Park in Morrisville, where Texas Super Kings set a target of 204 runs, with Faf du Plessis scoring a century off 58 balls.
* Washington Freedom was 62 for 0 in 4 overs, with Travis Head scoring 32 runs off 12 balls and Steve Smith scoring 26 runs off 12 balls, when the rain stopped play.
* The match was significant as it marked the first 200-run total of the season and the first at Church Street Park.
* Both teams shared a point each from the rain-affected match.
* The match showcased promising performances from both teams, with Washington Freedom's explosive start in their chase and Texas Super Kings' formidable batting display, particularly from Faf du Plessis.

However, the likes of Finn Allen and Nicholas Pooran continue their impressive run of form and dominate bowlers, as the second edition of the league promises to be special in the aftermath of a successful hosting of T20 World Cup 2024.

Finn Allen was instrumental in San Francisco Unicorns' thumping win, as his blistering 63 off 37 handed Los Angeles Knight Riders their first loss of the tournament.

"Yeah, it was good. I think we probably took a little bit too long to get the pace of the wicket at the start. It's just something to focus on next time we come back here, but, yeah, we're all happy with the result. Yeah, I mean, the way Shorty (Short) came out and struck the ball straight away definitely relieved a bit of pressure off me. I guess I could just get into the partnership with him and get into a bit of a zone," said Fill Allen during the post-match presentation ceremony.

title: [Watch] Steve Smith Unleashes Beast Mode With Colossal Sixes Vs Super Kings In MLC 2024
body:
Steve Smith has been in stunning form in MLC 2024 (x.com)

In a striking reproach to the selectors who overlooked him for the T20 World Cup 2024, Australian cricket veteran Steve Smith has unleashed a storm of runs in his debut at the Major League Cricket in the United States.

Smith, playing for Washington Freedom, has quickly turned heads with his explosive batting displays that left spectators and critics alike in awe.

In his inaugural match for Washington Freedom against MI New York, Steve Smith blasted a rapid 46 off 28 balls, propelling his team to a narrow four-run victory by the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method. His innings was a critical factor in Washington’s win, setting the tone for what was to come.

Steve Smith unleashes six-hitting storm in MLC 2024

The fireworks continued in Washington's second outing against the Texas Super Kings. After the Super Kings, led by captain Faf du Plessis—who scored a brilliant century (100 off 58)—posted a colossal total of 203/5, Smith and opener Travis Head responded with ferocity. The duo put on a blistering 62-run stand in just four overs.

Steve Smith's aggressive approach was highlighted in the third over when he hammered Zia-ul-Haq for two massive sixes.

The first, a magnificent hook off a slower short ball, soared over fine leg. He followed up with a hefty blow over deep square leg from a full-length delivery, showcasing his brilliance and intent.

Watch: Steve Smith sixes in MLC 2024

Before the rain gods intervened with Washington Freedom at 62/0, Smith had notched up an unbeaten 26 from 13 deliveries, studded with three sixes, though the match ultimately concluded with no result due to the weather.

Despite the anticlimactic end to his second game, Smith’s performances have sent a clear message: he is here to dominate.
summary:
* Steve Smith, playing for Washington Freedom, has been in exceptional form in the MLC 2024 tournament.
* In his debut match against MI New York, Smith scored a rapid 46 off 28 balls, leading his team to a narrow four-run victory by the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method.
* In the second match against the Texas Super Kings, Smith and opener Travis Head put on a blistering 62-run stand in just four overs, with Smith scoring 26 off 13 deliveries with three sixes before the match was called off due to rain.
* Smith's aggressive batting displays have sent a strong message that he is here to dominate the tournament.
* The teams mentioned in the article are Washington Freedom, MI New York, and Texas Super Kings, with Faf du Plessis as the captain of the Texas Super Kings.

title: [Watch] 6, 6, 6 - Rashid Khan Lights Up MLC 2024; Bludgeons Marco Jansen With Hat-Trick Of Sixes
body:
Rashid Khan takes the attack to Marco Jansen (X.com)

Rashid Khan made headlines yet again on Sunday while representing MI New York during their Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 fixture against Washington Freedom at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

However, the Afghanistan sensation, this time around, hogged the limelight due to his batting heroics, and it was Marco Jansen who was at the receiving end.

Rashid Khan Thrashes Marco Jansen In MLC 2024

In his entertaining 15-ball 31 run knock, Rashid smashed three sixes on the bounce during the 18th over of Mumbai's innings. Two of his sixes were over deep mid-wicket, while one was over long-on for a half-of-dozen.

To make matters worse for Jansen, Rashid smashed a four off the last ball, making it a 23-run over.

However, Rashid's brisk knock went in vain for MI New York, as Washington Freedom defeated them by four runs via DLS method. In reply of MI New York's 154/9, Washington reached 55/1 in 7.4 overs before heavy lightning did not allow any further play.

Despite the defeat, MI New York remained at the top of the points table, as they cruised past Seattle Orcas in the tournament opener.
summary:
* The article reports on a match between MI New York and Washington Freedom at Church Street Park, Morrisville, in the MLC 2024 tournament.
* Rashid Khan, playing for MI New York, scored 31 runs off 15 balls, including three consecutive sixes and a four, in the 18th over against Marco Jansen.
* Despite Rashid's impressive batting, MI New York lost the match to Washington Freedom by four runs via the DLS method.
* MI New York scored 154/9, while Washington Freedom reached 55/1 in 7.4 overs before the match was halted due to bad weather.
* Despite the loss, MI New York remains at the top of the points table after winning their tournament opener against Seattle Orcas.

title: Bangladeshi players' performance in foreign cricket leagues: Updates from LPL and MLC
body:
While the Bangladesh national team has no ongoing assignments, some key players are participating in foreign leagues, including the Lanka Premier League (LPL) and Major League Cricket (MLC).

Batter Towhid Hridoy and pace bowlers Taskin Ahmed and Mustafizur Rahman are competing in the LPL in Sri Lanka, while Shakib Al Hasan is playing in the MLC in the USA.

Towhid, representing the Dambulla Sixers, played two matches before losing his spot in the playing XI. He scored only one run in his first match and did not get a chance to bat in the second.

Taskin, playing for the Colombo Strikers, bagged three wickets in his first two matches but proved expensive. Mustafizur, also representing the Dambulla Sixers, has taken five wickets in four matches but has also been expensive, conceding 53 runs in his last match on July 7th.

Shakib is playing for the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the MLC. In two matches, he scored 53 runs and took one wicket. He is the only Bangladeshi player participating in the MLC.

After the MLC, Shakib will join all-rounder Mohammad Saifuddin in the Global T20 in Canada.

title: WATCH | Shakib Al Hasan goes speechless as Russell smashes 107-meter six off Haris Rauf
body:
By SportsCafe Desk , SportsCafe Editor

4935

In an era where rockets and satellites regularly soar into space, few batters possess the power to metaphorically send a cricket ball there. But such was the spectacle in Major League Cricket when Andre Russell launched a colossal 107-meter six off Haris Rauf, leaving his teammates in awe.

‌The San Francisco Unicorns clashed with the Los Angeles Knight Riders in their opening game in Dallas. Unicorns skipper Corey Anderson won the toss and chose to bowl first, a decision that initially proved effective as IPL MVP Sunil Narine was scalped by Haris Rauf in the second over. With Jason Roy and Unmukt Chand’s dismissal, the Knight Riders struggled at 46/3 after seven overs. However, a vital 45-run partnership between Shakib Al Hasan and Nitish Kumar took them to 88/3 by the 11th over. It was Andre Russell's explosive innings, featuring a colossal 107-meter six, that then further propelled the purple brigade to a solid 165/6 in 20 overs.

The West Indian powerhouse walked in to bat in the 13th over following Kumar's dismissal. Russell took some time to find his rhythm but began his onslaught from the 16th over onwards, saving the most spectacular moment for the 20th over. On the third ball of the final over, Rauf delivered a short-length ball angled into the stumps. Russell used his flawless judgment as he stood tall and unleashed a mighty pull shot. The timing was impeccable, and the sweet sound of the bat carried the ball out of the ground for a maximum. The shot travelled an astounding 351 feet, marking the longest six of the season. The Knight Riders' dugout, especially Shakib, was momentarily in disbelief at the incredible display.

Russell-Mania at Dallas

1

0

1

0

1

0
summary:
* The article reports on a match between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket tournament.
* The Knight Riders batted first and struggled early on, losing three wickets for 46 runs in seven overs.
* A partnership between Shakib Al Hasan and Nitish Kumar helped the Knight Riders recover, and they eventually scored 165/6 in 20 overs.
* The highlight of the match was an explosive innings by Andre Russell, who hit a 107-meter six off Haris Rauf in the 20th over, which was the longest six of the season.
* Russell's shot was described as a "colossal" and "mightily pulled" shot, and his teammates, including Shakib Al Hasan, were left in awe.

title: [Watch] 6,6,6: Finn Allen Goes Berserk Against Shakib Al Hasan In MLC 2024
body:
Finn Allen takes down Shakib Al Hasan [X]

New Zealand explosive opener Finn Allen went ballistic against Shakib Al Hasan during an MLC game between San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders when he rammed him for 3 sixes on the trot in the powerplay of the 166-run chase.

Major League Cricket has picked up pace with an enthralling encounter between San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders taking place on July 7 at Dallas.

Knight Riders batted first, and courtesy of Andre Russell’s 40 (25) finish, LAKR posted a target of 166 runs on board for the Unicorns.

Finn Allen goes berserk Vs Shakib Al Hasan

While the game looked evenly poised, Finn Allen turned it into a one-sided contest with a sheer display of formidable power hitting in the powerplay.

Despite losing partner Fraser McGurk early, Allen didn’t change his approach. A 12-run-over from Spencer Jones set the tone right for the Kiwi, and he continued the momentum against Andre Russell to fetch 17 runs off the 5th over.

With 48 runs already on the board, Finn Allen went for the final punch against Shakib Al Hasan in the final over. He slammed an overpitched slot ball over wide long-on to record the first six of the over.

With Shakib under the pump, Allen went on the back foot to loft another maximum over the long-on boundary rope.

Before the spinner could catch a break, the Kiwi once again used the depth of his crease to hammer another six, this time the ball travelled out of the ground.

With a 19-run over, San Francisco Unicorns were 67/1 inside the first six overs and went on to wrap up the chase with four overs to spare.

The Unicorns secured their maiden win of the tournament and climbed to the top of the table with a healthy net run rate.
summary:
* The match was played between San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 7 at Dallas.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders batted first and scored 166 runs, thanks to Andre Russell's 40 off 25 balls.
* Finn Allen, the New Zealand opener, led the chase for San Francisco Unicorns, scoring heavily in the powerplay.
* Allen hit 3 sixes in a row off Shakib Al Hasan's over, contributing to a 19-run over, and helping his team reach 67/1 in the first 6 overs.
* San Francisco Unicorns eventually won the match with 4 overs to spare, earning their maiden win of the tournament and moving to the top of the table with a healthy net run rate.

title: Prime Video secure exclusive broadcast rights for the 2024 MLC season
body:
Share

Tweet

Share

Email

Prime Video and Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) have unveiled a partnership to grant Prime Video exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season.

All 25 matches will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand from 6 July – 29 July local time (5 July – 28 July in the USA) at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

The announcement comes after the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, which Prime Video also had the exclusive broadcast rights to. Co-host of the tournament the USA progressed to the Super Eight stage in their tournament debut.

The second season of MLC will provide a stage for international T20 superstars to compete alongside the USA’s top domestic players from six major cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

Across the six teams, eight Australian players and five New Zealander players have been confirmed to participate in the tournament.

• Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns alongside bowler Josh Inglis, batter Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand all-rounder Matt Henry.

• Seattle Orcas have nabbed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

• Washington Freedom have secured Ricky Ponting as coach, as well as Australian batters Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell. New Zealand’s bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson are also named in the squad.

• MI New York will see batter Tim David and bowler Trent Boult return for a second season.

• Australian bowler Adam Zampa will join the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

“At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series and live sports offerings,” said Hushidar Kharas, Head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand.

“The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” said MLC’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan.

“This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in it’s second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test.

“MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

The MLC and Prime Video partnership comes as the Prominence and Anti-Siphoning Bill was passed without amendment by the Senate last week.

This means subscription streamers, such as Prime Video, Netflix and Foxtel’s Kayo could now outbid free-to-air networks for digital streaming rights for Australian sporting events.

While streaming services, as well as subscription TV, cannot buy the free broadcast (aerial delivered) rights until a free-to-air broadcaster, such as Nine, Seven, or 10, has acquired them, they are not stopped from bidding on the streaming rights that free-to-air broadcasters currently have on their respective BVOD services (9Now, 7Plus, 10 Play or SBS On Demand).
summary:
The MLC has announced a partnership with Prime Video to grant exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season. The tournament will feature 25 matches from July 6-29, which will be available on Prime Video at no extra cost to Prime or Prime Video members.

The second season of MLC will see international T20 superstars compete alongside top domestic players from six major cities in the USA, including Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. The tournament will feature eight Australian players and five New Zealand players, including notable names such as Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell.

The six teams participating in the tournament are the San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Washington Freedom, MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Dallas. Each team has a mix of international and domestic players, with coaches including Ricky Ponting.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Live Streaming: How to Watch Online
body:
With the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 over, the cricket world is turning its attention to Major League Cricket 2024, the premier T20 cricket league in the United States. The MLC will be in its second season this year and will feature six teams: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.

The season is also short. It’s just a few weeks from now until the MLC 2024 final on Sunday, July 28.

If you’re looking for last-minute tickets, there are tickets available to buy on third-party sites such as Vivid Seats and StubHub. Plus, you can use Variety’s exclusive promo code VAR2024 to get $20 off Vivid Seats.

Want to watch Major League Cricket online? Here’s everything you need to know about live streaming options.

How to watch Major League Cricket 2024

There are multiple ways to watch, as the MLC will be broadcast on regional sports networks across the US, both on TV and online. However, cricket fans can live stream all MLC matches on Willow HD, available on Sling TV or Fubo.

On Sling, Willow HD is part of the service’s Dakshin Flex package, which starts at $10 per month. It includes live and on-demand cricket matches, as well as movies and TV shows from channels such as Star India, Hotstar Specials, and Vijay TV. These channels and services are available in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, and other languages.

You can also purchase an annual subscription for $99 per year, which is about 45% off the monthly rate.

As for Fubo, Willow HD is part of all streaming service plans starting at $79.99 per month. The plan includes 145+ channels including CBS, ABC, FX, NBC, HGTV, CNN, ESPN, Fox Sports, NFL Network, and more, unlimited cloud DVR, and up to 10 streams simultaneously across multiple devices. Plus, Fubo offers a 7-day free trial so you can try it out for a week before committing.

If you’re outside the US but still want to watch the MLC games, you can use a virtual private network like ExpressVPN or NordVPN. These are online subscriptions that allow you to access live feeds of cricket matches using any of the streaming services listed above, even if you’re not in the US. ExpressVPN (starting at $6.67 per month) and NordVPN (starting at $3.39 per month) can be accessed on your laptop, streaming device, tablet, or smartphone.

Major League Cricket 2024 is available to stream on Willow HD via Sling or Fubo from now until Sunday, July 28. The MLC final will be held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 is set to begin soon, with the final scheduled for Sunday, July 28.
* The tournament features six teams: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.

**Watching the Tournament:**

* Tickets are available on third-party sites like Vivid Seats and StubHub, with a promo code VAR2024 offering $20 off on Vivid Seats.
* The MLC will be broadcast on regional sports networks across the US, both on TV and online.
* Live streaming options include Willow HD on Sling TV (starting at $10/month) and Fubo (starting at $79.99/month).
* For international viewers, virtual private networks like ExpressVPN (starting at $6.67/month) and NordVPN (starting at $3.39/month) can be used to access live feeds.

**Final Match:**

* The MLC final will be held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas on Sunday, July 28.

title: San Francisco Unicorns Dominate LA Knight Riders in MLC Showdown
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns executed a commanding six-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders with 28 balls to spare in the fourth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. Electing to bowl first, the Unicorns restricted the Knight Riders to 165/6, with debutant Broady Couch (2/24) and Harris Rauf (2/38) taking two wickets each.

Blistering half-centuries from Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) guided the Unicorns' swift chase. Despite a late effort from Andre Russell (40*), the Knight Riders fell short as their key batsmen, including David Miller (24), Shakib Al Hassan (35), and Jason Roy (26), failed to capitalize on good starts.

The Unicorns' response saw opener Jake Fraser Mcgurk dismissed early, but Allen's aggressive knock, including five sixes in consecutive deliveries, set the tone. By the end of the powerplay, the Unicorns were 67/1. Short then took charge, bringing up his half-century alongside Allen. Their 116-run partnership set up an easy chase, completed with 15.2 overs, despite Allen's dismissal. Josh Inglis (15), Corey Anderson (11), and Hassan Khan (2) provided the finishing touches. Johnson led the Knight Riders' bowling with 3/36.

(Disclaimer: With inputs from agencies.)
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns defeat LA Knight Riders by 6 wickets in the 4th match of the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Key Performances:**

* Broady Couch (2/24) and Harris Rauf (2/38) took two wickets each to restrict the Knight Riders to 165/6.
* Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) scored blistering half-centuries to guide the Unicorns' chase.
* Andre Russell (40*) made a late effort for the Knight Riders, but it was not enough.

**Other Notable Mentions:**

* The Unicorns completed their chase with 15.2 overs to spare, thanks to a 116-run partnership between Allen and Short.
* Johnson led the Knight Riders' bowling with 3/36.

title: Andre Russell’s Massive Six Against San Francisco Unicorns Lights Up the MLC Stage
body:
The T20 season from the cricket world never goes off. Just a few days ago another edition of the T20 World Cup ended. But the thrilling Major League Cricket is back with another thrilling edition. In the last match, LA Knight Riders and San Fransisco Unicorns locked horns. But in that match, Andre Russell’s monstrous 351 feet six caught all the limelight,

Monstrous Six by Russell:

In the T20 cricket, every ball is exciting. After an exciting edition of the T20 World Cup, cricket enthusiasts are witnessing another thrilling edition of the Major League Cricket.

In the fourth match of the league, LA Knight Riders and San Francisco Unicorns locked horns and the fans watched another thrilling match.

As the match was exciting, Knight Riders player Andre Russell’s monstrous sox of 351 feet grabbed the limelight. The exciting moment took place in the first innings. In the last over, Haris Rauf came to bowl and Andre Russell was on strike. Rauf delivered a short ball angling in, prompting Russell to line it up perfectly and send it soaring over wide long-on for a massive six, measuring 351 feet. That was a thunderous shot by the power-hitter.

Unicorn’s Exciting Win Over Knights:

The USA cricket fans are enjoying another thrilling edition of the Major League Cricket. In the fourth match of the league, LA Knight Riders faced San Francisco Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium. After winning the toss, the Unicorns opted to field first. While bowling in the first innings, the bowlers dominated the opponent.

Haris Rauf got the first breakthrough for the team while dismissing Sunil Narine. Brody Couch secured 2 crucial wickets just by conceding 24 runs. Rauf ended up taking 2 wickets. Abrar Ahmed and Liam Plunket secured 1 wicket each and restricted the opponent in 165 runs.

While batting in the second innings, the Unicorn Batters lost an early wicket as Jake Fraser McGurk was dismissed in 9 runs. But Finn Allen and Matthew Short played responsible innings. Aleen played a knock of 63 runs in 37 balls. Short completed his half-century and played a knock of 58 runs in 26 balls. With their dazzling displays, they secured win in the 16th over and won the match by 6 wickets.
summary:
**Match Summary:** The fourth match of the Major League Cricket tournament was played between LA Knight Riders and San Francisco Unicorns at the Grand Prairie Stadium. San Francisco Unicorns won the match by 6 wickets.

**Key Performances:**

* Andre Russell hit a massive six of 351 feet in the first innings while playing for LA Knight Riders.
* Haris Rauf took 2 wickets for San Francisco Unicorns in the first innings.
* Brody Couch took 2 crucial wickets for 24 runs for San Francisco Unicorns in the first innings.
* Finn Allen scored 63 runs in 37 balls for San Francisco Unicorns in the second innings.
* Matthew Short scored 58 runs in 26 balls for San Francisco Unicorns in the second innings.

**Other Details:**

* LA Knight Riders were restricted to 165 runs in the first innings.
* San Francisco Unicorns won the match in the 16th over.

title: WATCH: Faf du Plessis roars back into form with a stunning century in MLC 2024 | TSK vs WF
body:
Global star Faf du Plessis lit up the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas with his magnificent century in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. Leading the Texas Super Kings (TSK) against the Washington Freedom (WF), Du Plessis dazzled with the bat, smashing a tremendous ton to announce his grand arrival in the US T20 tournament.

Struggles in previous MLC season

Notably, Du Plessis didn’t have a good time with the bat in MLC. He scored only 47 runs in the previous season of the exciting tournament and his start in the ongoing edition wasn’t promising either.. The right-handed batter managed just 14 runs in TSK’s opening game against the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LKR). Under significant pressure, Du Plessis needed to find his form, and he did so emphatically with a spectacular three-figure score.

A tremendous century to mark his return

During his stay in the middle, Du Plessis smashed 12 fours and five sixes to exhibit a batting brilliance. He was dismissed for exact 100 runs from 58 deliveries by Saurabh Netravalkar. Notably, on the last ball of the 18th over, Du Plessis reached the milestone by driving the slower leg-cutter pitched full outside off Lockie Ferguson for a boundary. Overall, it was his 6th hundred in the shortest format and the entire TSK dugout was up to applaud their captain’s knock.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Finn Allen slams Shakib Al Hasan for a hat-trick of sixes as SFU defeat LAKR in MLC 2024

Rain spoils the exciting match

Driving on Du Plessis brilliant century, the Super Kings posted a massive total of 203/5 in 20 overs. However, his magical ton went in vain as the match ended without a result due to rain. Washington started their chase strongly, scoring 62 runs in just four overs with Travis Head (32 runs off 12 balls) and Steve Smith (26 runs off 13 balls) looking well set. Unfortunately, rain intervened after four overs, preventing the match from restarting. As a result, the game was cancelled, and both sides shared a point each.
summary:
**Match Summary:** The Texas Super Kings (TSK) led by Faf du Plessis played against the Washington Freedom (WF) in the MLC 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Faf du Plessis' Century:** Du Plessis scored a magnificent century (100 runs from 58 deliveries) with 12 fours and 5 sixes, his 6th hundred in the T20 format, to lead TSK to a massive total of 203/5 in 20 overs.

**Background:** Du Plessis had a poor previous MLC season, scoring only 47 runs, and struggled in the opening game of the ongoing season with just 14 runs.

**Match Outcome:** Unfortunately, the match was cancelled due to rain after four overs of WF's chase, with Travis Head and Steve Smith looking strong. Both teams shared a point each.

No other relevant information about the MLC tournament is present in the article.

title: WATCH: Finn Allen slams Shakib Al Hasan for a hat-trick of sixes as SFU defeat LAKR in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, the San Francisco Unicorns defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders by six wickets at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday, July 8. The star of the show was New Zealand opener Finn Allen, who put on a spectacular display of power-hitting against the Knight Riders’ bowling attack.

Finn Allen’s carnage against LAKR

Allen smashed Shakib Al Hasan for three consecutive sixes in the fifth over, sending the ball deep into the stands. He continued his onslaught in the seventh over, hitting Andre Russell for two more maximums, taking his tally to five sixes across the two overs.

Here’s the video

Allen’s blistering knock of 63 off just 37 balls, at a strike rate of 170.27, laid the foundation for the Unicorns’ successful chase. He was ably supported by Matthew Short, who scored a quickfire 58 off 26 deliveries, as the pair added 116 runs for the second wicket.

Match summary

The Knight Riders, after being put in to bat first, posted a competitive total of 165/6 in their allotted 20 overs. Shakib (35) and Russell (40 off 25 balls) were the main contributors with the bat for the Knight Riders. For the Unicorns, Brody Couch and Haris Rauf picked up two wickets each, while Abrar Ahmad and Liam Plunkett chipped in with one apiece.

In response, the Unicorns got off to a flying start, thanks to the explosive batting of Allen and Short. Allen, in particular, was in a belligerent mood as he took on the Knight Riders’ bowlers, especially Shakib and Russell.

The Unicorns eventually reached their target in 15.2 overs, winning the match by six wickets. Spencer Johnson was the pick of the bowlers for the Knight Riders, finishing with figures of 3/30.

Also READ: Andre Russell smokes gigantic 107m six off Haris Rauf in SFU vs LAKR game

Words from the match-winning duo

Speaking at the post-match presentation, a delighted Allen said, “It was a great team effort. The bowlers set it up nicely for us, and we just had to go out there and express ourselves. I’m glad I could contribute with the bat and help the team get over the line.”

Short, who was named the Player of the Match, echoed Allen’s sentiments of the dressing room, saying, “We are joking in the change room as to who can hit the biggest sixes. I think the pitch got better to bat on under lights, probably dew played a part as well. This tournament has a lot of good players.”

The win puts the Unicorns in a strong position in the MLC 2024 standings, while the Knight Riders will look to bounce back in their next match. With players like Allen and Short in their ranks, the Unicorns will be a force to be reckoned with in the tournament.
summary:

title: Watch: Andre Russell's humongous 107-meter six in MLC leaves Haris Rauf shell-shocked
body:
West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell looked in a mood with the bat during the game between the San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket (MLC). The match between the two teams took place at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday (8th July).

Playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders, Andre Russell played a sensational innings for his team and made sure that he helped them post a decent total on the board. The all-rounder oozed his class with the bat and exhibited great power-hitting skills during the fag end of the innings.

With the Los Angeles Knight Riders struggling at 96/5, Andre Russell stepped up for his team and made sure that he bailed the team out of trouble. He counter-attacked the bowlers and brought his team back into the game with his powerful knock while batting against San Francisco Unicorns.

One of the highlights of Andre Russell's innings was the massive 107-meter that he hit against Haris Rauf. During the last over, the pacer bowled a short ball angling in, to which the batter lined it up and smashed it over wide long-on for a massive six.

The massive six by Andre Russell left the pacer Haris Rauf in shock as he didn't expect the batter to hit the six this far. Apart from the pacer, Los Angeles Knight Riders players in the dugout looked extremely jubilant as the ball went out of the ground for a massive six and the crowd at the stadium went berserk.

Here's video of Andre Russel's massive six against Haris Rauf:

Andre Russell ended with the innings of unbeaten 40 runs off 25 balls. He batted with a strike rate of 160 and also hit 2 fours and 3 sixes in his innings. His brutal innings in the end powered Los Angeles Knight Riders to a total of 165 runs, which at one moment seemed impossible.

However, his effort went in vain as San Francisco Unicorns went on to win the game pretty easily. Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) played magnificently well and helped their team win the game by 6 wickets and inside the 16 overs.

We were 15-20 runs short - Los Angels Knight Riders skipper Sunil Narine

Los Angeles Knight Riders skipper Sunil Narine talked about the loss that his side faced against San Francisco Unicorns. He admitted that they were 15-20 runs short and also failed to take early wickets. He was confident of doing well in the next game. Speaking after the match, he stated:

"We had to take early wickets, 15-20 runs short. We could have taken early wickets but didn't bowl well. We got 160 in two games so we aren't too far from getting a big score. Just about batters digging deep. I back myself with my decisions. I didn't work today, hopefully, they work in the next game," he concluded.
summary:
**Match Summary:**
In a Major League Cricket (MLC) match between the San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders, the Unicorns won by 6 wickets with 4 overs to spare at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

**Andre Russell's Innings:**
Andre Russell, playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders, played a sensational innings, scoring an unbeaten 40 off 25 balls at a strike rate of 160, with 2 fours and 3 sixes, including a massive 107-meter six against Haris Rauf. His knock helped the Knight Riders post a total of 165 runs.

**Post-Match Reaction:**
Los Angeles Knight Riders skipper Sunil Narine acknowledged that they were 15-20 runs short and failed to take early wickets, but expressed confidence in their ability to bounce back in the next game.

**Other Match Details:**
Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) played crucial roles in guiding San Francisco Unicorns to victory, achieving the target in just 15.4 overs.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom beat MI New York by four runs in a rain
body:
Saurabh Netravalkar and skipper Steve Smith guided Washington Freedom to a four-run win over MI New York in their rain-shortened opening match of Major League Cricket 2024 at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina on Saturday.

Netravalkar registered impressive figures of 3/24 as MI NY ended at 154/9 in their 20 overs. Medium-pacer Justin Dill picked up 3/33 while Nicholas Pooran scored 44 from 30 balls for MI NY.

In response, Smith hit three sixes and four boundaries to top-score in the contest with an unbeaten 46 off just 28 balls. We moved to 55/1 in 7.4 overs before rain intervened with us being ahead of the par score of 51 as per the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern system, a method for calculating par scores and targets in rain-affected matches.

Bowling first, Marco Jansen struck for us as early as the third over with Dill also picking up a wicket in the powerplay. We managed to keep MI NY to 39/2 after the first six overs.

Glenn Maxwell started his journey with us in the MLC with a wicket in his first over and Netravalkar provided a crucial breakthrough dismissing MI NY skipper Kieron Pollard with half the side back as the score read 91.

Though Lockie Ferguson dismissed dangerman Pooran, MI NY bounced back with a quickfire 33-run partnership for the eighth wicket. Netravalkar picked up two wickets in the final over, including Rashid Khan who scored 31, to bring us back in the game. The left-arm seamer, along with Dill, finished with three wickets.

Chasing 155, Smith got things rolling scoring 13 runs in the fourth over. He smashed two sixes and two fours off Anrich Nortje as we ended the powerplay at 43/1.

In the end that big over proved the turning point for us as rain interrupted play in the eighth over with the score at 55/1.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom won by 4 runs against MI New York in a rain-shortened match of Major League Cricket 2024.

**Scorecard:** MI New York: 154/9 in 20 overs, Washington Freedom: 55/1 in 7.4 overs (rain-interrupted)

**Key Performers:** Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom) - 3/24, Steve Smith (Washington Freedom) - 46* off 28 balls, Nicholas Pooran (MI New York) - 44 off 30 balls, Justin Dill (Washington Freedom) - 3/33.

**Key Moments:** Washington Freedom restricted MI New York to 154/9, thanks to Netravalkar's impressive bowling. Steve Smith's unbeaten 46 guided Washington Freedom to a win, with the team ahead of the par score when rain intervened.
